claim: Every Democrat on the Energy and Commerce Committee blocked Steve Scalise's amendment to require New York to turn over all the data on nursing home deaths or have a temporary decrease of the Federal Medical Assistance Percentage
label: Supported
justification: Evidence finds that all of the "no" votes were from Democrats. Hence, the claim is supported.
speaker: LAUREN GIELLA

questions.question: Steve Scalise's proposed amendment would temporarily decrease the Federal Medical Assistance Percentage for medical assistance under state Medicaid plans for states that undercount COVID-19 deaths in nursing facilities. All of the "no" votes were from Democrats. Diana DeGette of Colorado and Donald McEachin of Virginia did not vote.

claim: Meat packing workers have suffered more COVID-19 cases than health care workers.
label: Refuted
justification: The QA discovers that around 59,000 workers in some of the largest meat companies in America have been infected, and around 269 deaths compared to 570,000 health workers infected and 2,500 deaths, so the claim is refuted as more health workers have died than meat packing workers.
speaker: Bruce Blackburn

questions.question: At least 59,000 workers at Tyson Foods, Smithfield Foods, JBS, Cargill and National Beef were infected with the coronavirus during the pandemic’s first year. At least 269 workers across these companies died of covid-19 between March 1, 2020, and Feb. 1. COVID-19 has infected some 570,000 health workers and killed 2,500 in the Americas.

claim: South African hospital found that traces of the novel coronavirus had survived on the surface of fresh food items for 12 hours during lab tests.
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: There is not enough evidence offered to verify the claim.  The only source link is to a fact-checker website site.

questions.question: The private hospital in South Africa's KwaZulu-natal province is mentioned in the claim. The hospital did not discover the period for which COVID-19 can live on the surface of fresh food, as it was stated by the claim author.

claim: Pfizer is “managed by Black Rock (sic) finances. Who, by chance, manages the finances of the Open Foundation Company (SOROS FOUNDATION)!
label: Refuted
justification: The claim is not correct, it can be seen from the Q&A that there is no evidence to support the connection between black rock and SOROS.
speaker: Susan Mundy

questions.question: Vanguard is the second biggest shareholder of Pfizer. There is no evidence that Blackrock manages the finances of Open Society Foundation's. The foundation is run by Soros' foundation, Open Society Initiative. It is not managed by Blackrock either.  Blackrock does not manage Open Society Institute's finances.

claim: The Chinese biological laboratory in Wuhan is owned by Glaxo. Who, by chance, owns Pfizer (the one who produces the vaccine!
label: Refuted
justification: Neither of the claims made are correct as the 2nd and 4th QAs refute them
speaker: Susan Mundy

questions.question: GlaxoSmithKline is a Big Pharma corporation. It sits at No. 282 on Forbes’ Global 500 rankings. GSK is ranked number 6 among the top 20 pharma companies by revenue in 2019. The Wuhan Institute of Virology that was the focus of conspiracy theories early in the covid 19 pandemic is owned by the Chinese Academy of Sciences controlled by China’s State Council. Pfizer was nearly 69% owned by institutional shareholders as of 10 December.

claim: Vanguard is a "shareholder of BlackRock... which, incidentally, is a major shareholder of Microsoft The property of Bill Gates, who owns Pfizer (the company that sells the miracle vaccine) and is currently the first sponsor of WHO.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification:
Although the Q&A pairs are missing some points made in the claim, the points they do make are cherry picked, to form the claim overall
The 2nd Q&A pair does state that bill gates stepped down but it fails to point out he is still a majority shareholder/owner
speaker: Susan Mundy

questions.question: Bill Gates is stepping down from the board of Microsoft, but he remains one of the largest individual shareholders. Vangaurd is the largest shareholder in Microsoft. BlackRock is the second largest shareholder of Microsoft and Pfizer. It's not Bill Gates' property.

claim: The Trump administration built the greatest economy in the history of the world.
label: Refuted
justification: Some economic measures are lower than previously.
speaker: Donald Trump

questions.question: Trump administration did not improve the US economy. Unemployment is near historical lows, but growth in gross domestic product was well below previous presidents' achievements. Other metrics such as wages and business investment ranged from decent to mediocre under Trump's presidency. The president's economic performance has been mixed.

claim: Ruth Bader Ginsburg was nominated and confirmed 43 days before an election
label: Refuted
justification: She was nominated on a different date to the confirmation date.

questions.question: Ruth Bader Ginsburg was nominated on June 22, 1993 and confirmed on August 3, 1993. She was confirmed by the Senate by a vote of 96-3. The record vote was 232 on March 3, 1994. It is 43 days before an election.

claim: Wildfires raging through California are due to poor land management, not climate change.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: Evidence shows that both climate change and land management affect wildfires in California in different ways.

questions.question: Climate change has created a new wildfire reality for California. Fifteen of the 20 most destructive wildfires in the state’s history have occurred since 2000. Ten of the most destructive fires have occurred between 2015 and 2016. Warming atmosphere is slowing the jet stream, leading to more California heat waves and high-pressure ridges in the Pacific.

claim: Luc Montagnier, French virologist and 2008 Nobel Prize winner in Medicine, said that COVID-19 was artificially created in a lab by biologists due to its signature similarity to the AIDS virus
label: Supported
justification: The source link in the Q&A supports the claim about Luc Montagnier's quote.
speaker: Luc Montagnier

questions.question: Luc Montagnier claims that Covid-19 virus is a man-made virus from Wuhan Institute of Virology. The hypothesis has gained increasing currency, but it remains unverified to date. Luc Montagniers' theory is gaining increasing currency.

claim: 5G millimeter waves could be absorbed by skin cells acting as antennas, transferred to other cells and play the main role in producing coronaviruses in biological cells.
label: Refuted
justification: The second answer clearly states that the article was retracted as being untrue. The first answer states that it is not possible for the virus to be transmitted through mobile technology.

questions.question: There is no evidence that 5G mobile technology is helping to spread the SARS-CoV-2 virus. The article with the claim was retracted at the request of the Editor-in-Chief because it showed evidence of manipulation of the peer review.

claim: Several circulating links  allow users to click on them and register for Indian government’s flagship National Health Policy scheme, called, Ayushman Bharat.
label: Refuted
justification: From the 2nd answering seems that there is only one link that leads the people to sign up for the scheme. Therefore the claim is refuted.
speaker: Ayushman Yojana

questions.question: Ayushman Bharat Yojana is a program which aims to create a healthy, capable and content new India. Presently it is running as a pilot project in Uttar Pradesh from 4 September 2018. It has two goals: creating a network of health and wellness infrastructure across the nation and providing insurance cover to at least 40 per cent of India's population deprived of secondary and tertiary care services.

claim: A Facebook post credits Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates with saying, “I choose a lazy person to do a hard job. Because a lazy person will find an easy way to do it.”
label: Refuted
justification: No evidence to support this quote to Bill Gates.
speaker: Aytekin Tank

questions.question: There is no record of Bill Gates ever saying or writing the expression attributed to him in the Facebook post. The Daily Caller also searched his books, "The Road Ahead" and "Business @ The Speed of Thought" and his personal blog but found no similar statements. In 1947, Clarence Bleicher testified before the Senate that one should “put a lazy man on it” to make a difficult job easier.

claim: Alexei Navanly has been arrested in Russia.
label: Supported
justification: The publication linked on the source verified that Alexei Navanly was arrested.

questions.question: Alexei Navanly was detained on January 17th 2021 when he returned to Moscow from Berlin. He has not been arrested yet.    navanly is a Russian citizen who lives in Moscow.  navansly.com.

claim: COVID 19 bacteria is caused due to 5g electromagnetic radiation.
label: Refuted
justification: No evidence found by who
speaker: Chowkidar Ravichiruvolu

questions.question: Is SARS-CoV-2 a bacteria? Can viruses travel on radio waves or mobile phone networks? There is no evidence of any health effects associated with radio wave exposure from either mobile phones or radio base stations. WHO has reviewed the available research on electromagnetic fields and health and concluded that there are no evidence to suggest such health effects.

claim: Covid19 is a bacteria
label: Refuted
justification: The answers and credible sources show that covid 19 is a virus not a bacteria so the claim is refuted.
speaker: Chowkidar Ravichiruvolu

questions.question: Virus that causes COVID-19 is in a family of viruses called Coronaviridae. Some people who become ill with COVID 19 can also develop a bacterial infection as a complication. Both viruses and bacteria are microorganisms visible only under the microscope. Bacteria are living organisms composed of a single cell, which has everything they need to live. Antibiotics act against bacteria only. Since viruses do not live, they cannot be killed.

claim: COVID 19 can be cured by antibiotics
label: Refuted
justification: The Q&A's verify that COVID-19 is a virus and therefore can't be cured by antibiotics.
speaker: Chowkidar Ravichiruvolu

questions.question: Covid 19 is a virus from the Coronavirus family. Antibiotics are only effective against bacterial infections. People with COVID-19 may receive antibiotics only to treat secondary bacterial infections and not cure them.    A cure treats diseases or infections differently than a vaccine.

claim: COVID 19 patients don’t need intensive care or ventilators.
label: Refuted
justification: It seems that up to 10% of the patients need ventilators, therefore the claim is refuted
speaker: Chowkidar Ravichiruvolu

questions.question: 5-15% of COVID-19 patients with pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome require intensive care surveillance and ventilator support. According to Medical Xpress, if lung function has been severely impaired, patients may need a ventilators in intensive care.

claim: COVID 19 is a thrombosis
label: Refuted
justification: As the evidence has found, COVID-19 is a virus, whereas thrombosis occurs when a blood clot forms either in a vein or an artery. The core symptoms are a fever and a cough. Body aches, a sore throat, and a headache are all possible but not guaranteed. Hence, the claim is refuted.
speaker: Chowkidar Ravichiruvolu

questions.question: Covid-19 is a mild infection for 8 out of 10 people who get it. The core symptoms are a fever and cough. Body aches, sore throat and a headache are possible but not guaranteed. Thrombosis occurs when a blood clot forms either in a vein or an artery.

claim: COVID-19 can be cured in one day.
label: Refuted
justification: The answer and source show that covid can not be cured in one day so the claim is refuted.
speaker: Chowkidar Ravichiruvolu

questions.question: Can COVID-19 be cured in one day? According to data on 24 deaths that occurred in mainland China and 165 recoveries outside of China, the mean duration from onset of symptoms to death is 17.8 days (95% credible interval [CrI] 16–19.2 days) and to hospital discharge is 24.7 days (22–9 days).

claim: France24 encouraging Niger Delta militants to fight for their right to equity in resource sharing.
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: Q&A 2 shows no answer to say if France24 made this remark as claimed, although the organisations named in the claim are real more evidence is needed to see if France 24 encouraged Niger Delta militants to take the action claimed.
speaker: Defense news Nigeria

questions.question: Niger Delta militants are the latest militant group. France24 will do a news item about them in 2021, but no answer could be found.  No answer was found. It is not clear if they are Niger Delta militants or just NDA.

claim: Left-wing activist John Sullivan incited the insurgence of the US Capitol
label: Supported
justification: Answer 1 - the source is about a different protest that this person organised. This part of the answer is misleading and not really necessary. The other source for Q2&3 indicates he was the founder of this group.

questions.question: John earl Sullivan was charged for taking part in the Jan 6th US capitol riots. He is an activist and a member of the Insurgence USA group. In his own videos he can be heard egging on the saboteurs, yelling, "It's our house".

claim: Mark Tully wrote about PM "Modi destroying termite ridden old Banyan tree".
label: Refuted
justification: Tully rebutted the claims of him making this post in the Hindustan Times column.
speaker: Govindarajan Srinivasan

questions.question: Mark Tully is the former Bureau Chief of BBC, New Delhi. He worked with BBC for 30 years before resigning in July 1994. He held the position of Chief of Bureau, BBC, Delhi for 20 years. He has received awards and he has also written books.

claim: Nonsurgical ear-loop masks are useless at offering protection from COVID-19
label: Refuted
justification: The non surgical masks offer a level of protection from the COVID-19 and are in many cases, nearly equivalent to or better than their non-N95 respirator medical mask counterparts.

questions.question: Wearing a face mask to prevent COVID-19 transmission can reduce transmission by up to 50%. CDC recommends fabric masks for the general public and N95 masks for health care providers. WHO recommends medical masks for people at higher risk of becoming seriously ill with COVIED-19.

claim: N95 masks blow the virus into the air from a contaminated person.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: depends what type of N95 mask it is
speaker: William Senkarik

questions.question: N95 masks have vents that blow a virus in the air, but those used by frontline health workers are unvented. A surgical N95 is recommended only for use by healthcare personnel who need protection from both airborne and fluid hazards (e.g., splashes, sprays).

claim: Homework spelled backward translate to child abuse in Latin
label: Refuted
justification: Incorrect. Answers show Latin translation correctly.

questions.question: Krowemoh is not in the Latin dictionary. Child abuse translates to puer abusus in Latin. It is not a word in the English language.    In Latin, it means "puer abuse". In English, it is translated as "punishment".

claim: Manny Pacquiao has been disqualified in the 2022 presidential election.
label: Refuted
justification: Given that the claim was made on 2021-06-12 and that the filing period for the 2022 presidential election is October 1, 2021 (Friday), to October 8, 2021 (Friday), *including Saturday and Sunday, This would mean Manny Pacquiao has yet to file to run for president in the 2022 national elections.
speaker: Showbiz Fanaticz

questions.question: Senator Manny Pacquiao hasn't confirmed nor denied his supposed plan to run for the presidency in the 2022 national elections. The filing for 2022 candidacy starts on October 1, 2021 (Friday) and ends on October 8, 2021 including Saturday and Sunday.

claim: Kazakhstan has a multiparty democratic system and open civil society.
label: Refuted
justification: Kazakhstan does not have a multiparty democratic system
speaker: Kazakhstan's U.S. Embassy

questions.question: There was no opposition party in Kazakhstan's 2021 election. Five parties competed for seats in the lower house of parliament, but all are loyal to the government. The only registered opposition party declined to field candidates. There is no open civil society in Kazakhstan. Protesters were detained for criticizing Kazakhstan’s vote in the Jan 2021 elections.

claim: The Indian Government has approved and have started giving out free R7,500 Relief Funds to each citizen.
label: Refuted
justification: The Indian government via a tweet refuted the claim
speaker: Katlego Shalom

questions.question: The Indian government has denied the claim that it promised to give R7,500 relief funds to each citizen in July 2021. The viral message claims to offer free Rs 7500 relief fund to each person were fake.  In early June 2021 the Indian Government issued a tweet saying that the claim was false.

claim: Kenya has roped in the Maasai Tribe to enforce a lockdown.
label: Refuted
justification: Although the question for the Q&A pair is worded poorly, it does ask a relevant question, which provides a useful answer which shows the claim to be refuted as it is  based on a YouTube video which was meant to be entertainment.

questions.question: Arisa Nelson is telling people to keep one metre away from each other in the video.  She says it was made for entertainment, but has an educational message for society. The ropen in Kenya does not enforce lockdown on Maasai tribes.

claim: Microsoft cofounder Bill Gates said Be nice to nerds. Chances are you'll end up working for one.
label: Refuted
justification: The answer and credible source show that Bill Gates did not say this quote so the claim is refuted.
speaker: Tea talk and gossip

questions.question: The quote is from the book 50 Rules Kids Won't Learn in School: Real-World Antidotes to Feel-Good Education by Charles J Sykes. The full quote is actually: "Be nice to nerds. You may end up working for them. We all could."

claim: The laws in the UK have been changed because of Covid-19 so that you can be forcibly vaccinated and that it is an offence to ask what’s in the vaccine. The Control of Diseases Act in the UK changed on 27 April.
label: Refuted
justification: The Q&A's show that the act did not change in April and you cannot be forcibly vaccinated. You can also ask what is in the vaccine so the claim is refuted.
speaker: Zed Phoenix

questions.question: The Public Health (Control of Disease) Act 1984 in the United Kingdom was amended on 25th March 2020. Local authorities can arrange for cremation against the wishes of the deceased. Coronavirus Act 2020 does not make COVID-19 vaccinations mandatory. There is no law where individuals are not allowed to ask what is in a vaccine.

claim: CDC Admits Only 6% of Recorded Deaths from COVID-19
label: Refuted
justification: The answers and sources show that this is untrue and the quote from the CDC was misinterpreted so the claim is refuted.

questions.question: There are 180,000-plus deaths from Covid-19 virus in the United States. President Donald Trump retweeted a false statistic that only 6% of those deaths were caused by COVID-19. White House Coronavirus Task Force member Dr. Anthony Fauci says the CDC's report "really did reflect the reality" of those dying from COVID.-19.

claim: UK Daily Covid-19 deaths dropped to “just” seven on Saturday 10 April 2021.
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: nothing in the question and answers actually addresses how many covid deaths occurred on the claimed date, and the link in this question and answer isn't working.
speaker: Niamh Cavanagh

questions.question: The government publishes the number of deaths within 28 days of a positive test by date of death to report covid-19's deaths.  Covid-20 died on November 19th, 2013. The government published the number after that date.

claim: PETA, a U.S.-based animal rights organization, called for a ban of the Instagram page @SavageHunts.
label: Refuted
justification: A different account which goes by @PETAUSA called for a ban on the Instagram page @SavageHunt and not the U.S. based PETA organisation which username on Instagram is @PETA.
speaker: @godblessdjt

questions.question: @PETAUSA called for a ban of the Instagram page @SavageHunts due to their glorifying of killing and eating animals. PETA's official Twitter handle is @PETA. The Twitter account @Petausa is not active and has a Chinese username.

claim: Face masks restrict breathing.
label: Refuted
justification: No changes in blood oxygen levels or in end tidal carbon dioxide measurements.
speaker: Prashant Bhushan

questions.question: There are no clinically significant changes in end tidal carbon dioxide measurements. There are no changes in blood oxygen levels after 5 or 30 minutes of wearing a mask while resting in participants that partook in a study.    ‘Masks do not cause CO2 toxicity, but they do not make it difficult to breathe.

claim: Face masks do not prevent the transmission of Covid-19.
label: Refuted
justification: A study in the Lancet found that communities with high reports of mask-wearing and physical distancing had the highest predicted probability of transmission control. Most masks prevent aerosols from passing through them, thus preventing the spread of COVID-19. Hence, the claim is refuted.
speaker: Prashant Bhushan

questions.question: Wearing masks prevents aerosols from passing through them, thus preventing the spread of COVID-19. Communities with high reported mask-wearing and physical distancing had the highest predicted probability of transmission control.  The Lancet found that most masks prevent aerosols pass through them.

claim: SNP has channelled public funding to voluntary groups that advocate lowering the age of consent to 10
label: Refuted
justification: Confirmed as false in QA pairs.

questions.question: The Scottish National Party (SNP) is the dominant political party in Scotland. LGBT Youth Scotland is one of the organisations that it is said have received funding or lobbied to lower the age of consent to 10. ILGA does not support paedophilia and never has.

claim: During the final days of the Trump presidency, House Rep. Matt Gaetz (R-Fla.) privately pursued a blanket pardon from then-President Donald Trump, while the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ), under Trump appointee William Barr, was launching a concurrent investigation into an alleged sexual assault of a minor by the congressman.
label: Supported
justification: The senator was being investigated for sexual assault at the same time he was pursuing a blanket pardon from the Trump administration
speaker: Social Media Users

questions.question: Matt Gaetz is an American lawyer and politician. He has served as the U.S. representative for Florida. He was being investigated by the DOJ for sexual misconduct. Joel Greenberg, a friend and colleague of Matt Gaetz, faces a raft of charges, including sex trafficking of a minor.

claim: Crowded picture of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus claimed to be taken on 7th April 2021 during covid pandemic.
label: Refuted
justification: The claim refers to a picture or a video which isn't present but the answer says the claim was debunked offically

questions.question: Northeast Frontier Railway official account debunked the claim of the video being recent. The authorities have not commented on the matter yet. It is still unknown what the authorities say about the video. it's still unknown if it was recently recorded.  It's still unclear if it's even current.

claim: Prince Harry's son Archie isn't a prince because of a rule established by King George V.

justification: The answer and source explain that the claim is true so the claim is supported.

questions.question: Meghan and Harry's baby will not be a Prince because he or she will be too far down the line of succession to be granted a HRH title. The rule was created by King George V in 1917.  He stated that only the eldest living son of the Prince of Wales can be called a Prince.

claim: Quebec is exempt from carbon pricing.
label: Refuted
justification: Quebec is not exempted from carbon pricing, but they have an equivalent system in place.
speaker: AFP Canada

questions.question: Carbon pollution pricing applies throughout Canada. Quebec has its own carbon pricing system in the form of a cap-and-trade that is deemed to be equivalent to carbon pricing. The federal price applies to any province or territory that does not have an equivalent system in place.

claim: Joe Biden rushed to the hospital on April 5, 2021.
label: Refuted
justification: From the 2nd QA it is evident that the president was not rushed to a hospital. Therefore, the claim is refuted
speaker: Qanon

questions.question: Joe Biden joined Jill and a masked bunny at the White House for his Easter message on April 5th 2021. There is no record of him going to hospital that day, so there's no way to check if he was in hospital then. He probably wasn't.

claim: Masks were no longer mandatory in Ohio from April 5th 2021.

justification: This claim is refuted. According to the QA pairs, the Ohio Department of Health has stated on twitter that the claim is misinformation. They said that the mask mandate is mandatory until Ohio reachers 50 cases per 100,000 for a 2 week period. On the 5th July 2021, the mask mandate was, again, still in place. Therefore, this claim is refuted.
speaker: Ohio Department of Health Press Release

questions.question: Masks are still mandatory in Ohio from the 5th of April 2021. New order states that everyone should wear a mask when engaging with others outside their household until July 5, 2021.    "Everyone should wear masks when engaging and socializing outside their homes to prevent COVID-19".

claim: A photo shows that hand sanitiser is poison because it degrades metal.
label: Refuted
justification: The answer shows that water can rust metal so the claim is refuted. The face that hand sanitiser contains water does not mean it is poison.
speaker: Liberty Smithe

questions.question: Purell Advanced Hand Sanitizer is an alcohol-based sanitiser. The active ingredients are:Ethyl alcohol 70%, Water (Aqua), Isopropyl Alcohol, Caprylyl Glycol, Glycerin, Isoprofum, Tocopheryl Acetate, Acrylates/C10-30 Alkyl Acrylate Crosspolymer, Aminomethyl Propanol, Fragrance (Parfum) and Isoprophyl Alcohol. Water is listed as an ingredient that could degrade metal.

claim: U.S. Special Forces Arrest John Podesta and Huma Abedin
label: Refuted
justification: I5 seems the website is fake therefore the claim is refuted

questions.question: Lead Stories say that Real Raw News is known for publishing fake news.  They made a false claim about the arrest of an individual.    They are responsible for publishing other fake news stories.  i.e. they published another fake news story about the same person.

claim: A student from Pondicherry University has discovered a cure for COVID-19.
label: Refuted
justification: Fake news.

questions.question: A student from Pondicherry University has not discovered a cure for COVID-19. The WHO has not approved it.    Government asks everyone to trust only official sources for correct information about COVID19.  “Fake News Alert” is false.

claim: KANYE WEST BUYS SPOTIFY
label: Refuted
justification: From the 1st and 2nd QAs it is evident that this claim is refuted

questions.question: There is no evidence that West bought Spotify. The press releases do not mention it. It was published on April 1st, but there is no proof of it.    Spotify's press releases don't mention it at all. They are not mentioned in any press releases.

claim: Philippines President Rodrigo Duterte is enraged at Health Secretary Francisco Duque III over ivermectin drug controversy amid current health crisis.
label: Refuted
justification: No evidence shown for Duque supporting use of ivermectin.
speaker: Eduard Q. TV

questions.question: Ivermectin is a registered veterinary product used to treat parasites and prevent heartworms in animals. It's also allowed for use for people only in topical form under a prescription to treat head lice and skin conditions like rosacea. DOH has not recommended the product as treatment for COVID-19, citing six randomized controlled trials which did not show that the drug reduces the risk of deaths or the length of hospitalization of patients with symptoms. WHO representative to the Philippines Rabindra Abeyasinghe said it has “not proven efficacy” against COVIED-19. Presidential Spokesperson Harry Roque denied reports that President Rodrigo Duterte wants to authorize ivermECTin for use against COVID 19 No. 19.

claim: Rwanda's president, Paul Kagame, ordered deportation of 18 Chinese nationals.

An official statement said it never happened and they were never deported.  The statement was made on behalf of the Chinese government, which denies that this ever happened. It is not clear if there were any more people deported.

claim: Just Giving has kept a large percentage of the funds raised by Captain Tom Moore for the NHS, some say they have kept £2 million.
label: Refuted
justification: The official statement from Just Giving is that they would not be claiming £2 million from the appeal

questions.question: JustGiving takes a 5% platform fee plus other processing fees. Captain Tom has raised 27 million and JustGiving will not be claiming £2m from the appeal. Over 97% of the total raised will go straight to charity. The commission is roughly £300,000.

claim: Work is already in progress by the Delhi government towards establishing the first virtual school in India.

Uttarakhand government had launched the Virtual Classroom Project intending to benefit 1.90 lakh students from classes 6-12. The initial phase was to cover 150 schools.  There are many other virtual schools in the country.

claim: Assam has the highest unemployment rate in India.

justification: It is the lower than all states listed in the QA pair.

reporting_source: A public gathering in Assam’s Nalbari

questions.question: Assam recorded an unemployment rate of 6.7% in 2018-2019. Arunachal Pradesh had 7.7%, Delhi 10.4%, Nagaland 17.4%.    nagaland has a jobless rate of 9.8%.

claim: The vaccine causes the body to produce the spike protein so by the time you get your fourth shot your body will be making all four proteins that make up the COVID-19 virus.
label: Refuted
justification: the evidence does not support the claim
speaker: Abdul Alim Muhammad

questions.question: The first dose of the Covid 19 vaccine primes the immune system and introduces the body to the germ of interest. The second dose ramps up the quality and quantity of the antibodies used to fight the virus. There are estimated to be roughly 26 spike trimers per virus.

claim: COVID19 virus originated in a US Army lab at Fort Detrick, Maryland.
label: Refuted
justification: The Lab was closed during the initial outbreak of Covid-19 and only reopened in March 2020.
speaker: Hua Chunying

questions.question: Centre for Disease Control and Prevention closed down the US Army lab at Fort Detrick in 2019. The center did not have sufficient systems to decontaminate wastewater from its highest-security labs. Institute will reopen in March 2020. There was no threat to public health, no injuries to employees or leaks outside the laboratory.

claim: The mRNA vaccine is “not even a vaccine,” it’s “an operating system that takes over the machinery of your cells”
label: Refuted
justification: The MRNA does not control the working of all cells., it tells cells how to make a particular protein.
speaker: Damon Jones

questions.question: Comirnaty COVID-19 mRNA vaccine is being used to prevent SARS-CoV-2 infection. It contains a piece of mRNA that tells the cells in the body how to make a viral protein. This gives the immune system time to design powerful antibodies that can neutralize the virus.

claim: Scotland is spending more on health per head than the rest of the UK.
label: Refuted
justification: Scotland ranks 3rd after Northern Ireland and then Wales. Scotland does however beat England who ranks 4th.
speaker: Nicola Sturgeon

questions.question: The UK as a whole spends the equivalent of one quarter of total public expenditure and £2,972 per capita on healthcare in 2017. Scotland spends 21% of its GDP on healthcare, while Wales spends 23%. England spends 25% of her economy on healthcare.

claim: U.S. Rep. Matt Gaetz was the lone vote in the House against an anti-human trafficking bill.
label: Supported
justification: Q&A and source support the claim.

questions.question: Matt Gaetz voted against the anti-human trafficking bill in the House. The bill was approved 418 to 1 on Dec. 19, but Gaetz was the only member of Congress who voted against it. He is a Florida Republican. His colleague voted for it.

claim: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) reported that a new variant of Covid-19 had emerged that only affected children and people aged below 30.
label: Refuted
justification: Anyone of any age is able to catch COVID-19 as the evidence in the answers suggest, people who are older or have existing conditions are more likely to have worse symptoms but age does not play a factor in if you can or cannot catch it or how likely you are to catch it.
speaker: Yogesh Acharya

questions.question: People of any age can catch COVID-19. It does not affect children under the age of 30 only. The covid 19 variant is available to all people. For confidential support call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline on 1-800-273-8255 or visit www.suicidepreventionlifeline.org.

claim: Nicola Sturgeon's government delayed the rollout of devolved social security benefits.
label: Supported
justification: It seems from the question and answer pairs that the benefits were indeed delayed. Therefore, the claim is supported
speaker: Willie Rennie

questions.question: Shirley-Anne Somerville is responsible for social security in Scottish government. The universal credit programme, for which the original date of completion was 2017, is now 2023. It's six years later than planned and it's still fundamentally flawed. Shirley Anne Somerville said that.

claim: U.S. Rep. Matt Gaetz was the lone vote in the House against an anti-human trafficking bill.
label: Supported
justification: Confirmed via vote count shown and name assigned to that vote.

questions.question: Gaetz voted against the anti-human trafficking bill, which is one of the 1 Representatives who voted against it. He was the only representative to vote against the bill. The bill has not been passed yet.  It will be voted on in the next Congress.

claim: Hillary Clinton faced a military tribunal on April 8, 2021
label: Refuted
justification: Evidence shows claim originated on a satirical website.
speaker: Real Raw News

questions.question: According to Real Raw News, information on this website is for informational and educational and entertainment purposes. It also contains humor, parody and satire. The about us page states that the disclaimer has been included for their protection. They follow legal counsel's advice on this matter.

claim: NESARA-enacting legislation was secretly signed into law by President Bill Clinton.
label: Refuted
justification: The NESARA conspiracy has been around for decades, fooling thousands (and counting) since first making an appearance in the late 1990s.

questions.question: Harvey Francis Barnard proposed the National Economic Security and Recovery Act as an academic exercise towards his doctoral degree. The NESARA conspiracy has been around for decades, fooling thousands (and counting) since first making an appearance in the late 1990s. It was never passed in the U.S.

claim: The SNP promised in three manifestos to reform council tax but people are still paying council tax.
label: Supported
justification: SNP did state it would "scrap the council tax and introduce a fairer system based on ability to pay" in the 2007 election manifesto. However, in 2016, the SNP voted in favor of increasing the top four council tax bands. Therefore, the SNP went against their promise. Hence, the claim is supported.
speaker: Douglas Ross

questions.question: In its 2007 election manifesto the SNP promised to scrap the council tax and introduce a fairer system based on ability to pay. In its 2011 manifesto the party pledged to consult with others to come up with a new system to replace council tax. In 2016 the SNP proposed changes to the way council tax operates in Scotland. Following the 2016 election the Scottish Parliament voted in favour of the minority SNP government’s proposal to increase the top four council tax bands. The change was implemented in April 2017.

claim: During the pandemic the Scottish Green party stopped evictions and negotiated support payments to the poorest families.
label: Supported
justification: The green party did contribute to the banning of evictions during the pandemic
speaker: Lorna Slater

questions.question: There was a ban on eviction orders in the Coronavirus (Scotland) act during the COVID pandemic. Patrick Harvie and the Greens played a key role in creating the eviction ban. Nicola Sturgeon, Scottish First Minister, wrote to Kate Forbes MSP thanking them for their help.

claim: Hoisting the tricolor on government buildings has been made mandatory in Jammu and Kashmir
label: Supported
justification: Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha’s government in Jammu and Kashmir has made hoisting of the national flag mandatory on all government offices and buildings across the Union Territory
speaker: Meghalsinh Parmar

questions.question: Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha's government in Jammu and Kashmir has made hoisting of the national flag mandatory on all government offices and buildings across the Union Territory. Divisional Commissioners in both Kashmir and Jammu have directed all the concerned officers to implement the LG’s instructions within a fortnight.

claim: Thieves are using face masks doused in chemicals to rob people.
label: Refuted
justification: there is no evidence that this is true at all.
speaker: Susan Johnson

questions.question: Facebook fact-checks a story that falsely claims thousands of Irish people were brought to the United States as slaves. The article is disputed by Snopes.com and the Associated Press. Facebook does not share the story immediately when someone shares it on their timeline.

claim: Someone won a luxury RV worth $99,995 but failed to respond within the 48 time  limit, so the vehicle will be given to someone who shares the facebook post.
label: Refuted
justification: The Facebook post about someone wining luxury RV worth $99,995 was a scam.

questions.question: RV companies across Michiana have been made aware of the Facebook posts going around claiming that they were giving away a top of the line 2020 RV. The Facebook post asks people to like, share, and comment to win an RV. It turns out that giveaway is a scam that attempts to obtain information from users.

claim: During the pandemic 25,000 calls to the NHS 24 helpline's mental health hub went unanswered.
label: Supported
justification: More than 25,000 calls to the NHS 24 helpline's mental health hub went unanswered.
speaker: Anas Sanwar

questions.question: There were 93,772 calls to the NHS 24 mental health hub from 11 March until 17 February. 68,883 of these were answered, while 24,889 were abandoned by the caller. Many people lost their jobs because of the pandemic and many calls went unanswered.

claim: Loophole in Georgia election law allows voters to be given drinks other than water.
label: Refuted
justification: The answer does state that food or drinks are prohibited being given to voters but self-service water is available, so there is no loophole in the law and the answer provides proof that the claim is refuted.
speaker: Equality House

questions.question: Georgia Governor Brian Kemp signed into law the "Election Integrity Act of 2021" (formerly SB 202) on March 25, 2021. Foundation for Government Accountability supports the reforms implemented in this bill. The new law contains rational and sound policy provisions to ensure fair and free elections.

claim: Time Magazine Named (Assistant Secretary for Health) Rachel Levine 'Woman Of The Year'
label: Refuted
justification: Although it was not possible to verify the information about the source of the information, it was confirmed that Time Magazine person of the 2020 was not Rachel Levine.
speaker: The United spot

questions.question: Time magazine named Rachel Levine as its Woman of the Year 2020. The image of Time magazine cover with Rachel Levine was posted on Facebook by "The United Spot", which is labelled as a satire site. Joe Biden and Kamala Harris were Time's Person of the year 2020.

claim: New Zealand is the first country to pass a law providing bereavement leave for miscarriages and stillbirths.
label: Refuted
justification: Even though NZ do provide this leave, they are not the first country to do so, so the claim in incorrect.
speaker: Megan Healey

questions.question: Bereavement leave is a temporary time off granted to an employee following the death of a relative or a friend. New Zealand's parliament passed legislation giving mothers and their partners the right to paid leave following a miscarriage or still birth in 2021. Women who suffer a miscarriage can take up to 60 days of maternity leave with full pay in the Philippines.

claim: US President Joe Biden put anti-abortion groups on domestic extremist list, calling them violent.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: The claim makes two points, The first Q&A pair make clear that one point about anti abortion groups being on U.S domestic extreamist groups lists, however the point the claim makes about a comment made by Joe Biden appears to have no evidence of proof according to the second Q&A pair.
speaker: Pro-Life Politics

questions.question: There is no evidence that Joe Biden has called anti-abortion groups violent. The report lists several domestic violent extremists, including those with ideological agendas in support of pro-life or pro-choice beliefs and abortion-related violent extremists who are on Joe Biden's list.

claim: Georgia's New Voting Law Make It A 'Jail-Time Crime To Drop Off Grandma's Absentee Ballot'
label: Refuted
justification: 8t seems from the QA that the claim js refuted
speaker: Greg Palast

questions.question: Georgia's new voting law does not make it illegal to drop off grandma's absentee ballot. It only applies to the elector's mother, father, grandparent, aunt, uncle, brother, sister, spouse, son, daughter, niece, nephew, grandchild, son-in-law, daughter-in Law, mother and father-in laws, and other households.

claim: Russian military aggression is a “myth” created to justify rising NATO spending
label: Refuted
justification: Evidence has found Russia to be aggressive even after a cease-fire was violated by Russia-controlled armed groups in the Donbas warzone on Sunday, March 28. Hence, the claim is refuted.
speaker: Maria Zakharova

questions.question: Command of Ukraine's Armed Forces reports 10 violations of the latest ceasefire agreement committed by Russia-controlled armed groups in the Donbas warzone on Sunday, March 28. The cease fire was called a week ago but Russia has been aggressive even after it was called.

claim: The mRNA vaccine is “an operating system that takes over the machinery of your cells..by the time you get your fourth shot your body will be making all four proteins that make up the COVID-19 virus.”
label: Refuted
justification: The sources show that the vaccine helps the body fight the virus and gives the body some immunity from the virus it does not make up the covid virus in the body so the claim is refuted.
speaker: Abdul Alim Muhammad

questions.question: Covid 19 mrna vaccine is a new type of vaccine to protect against infectious diseases. People aged 70 and over can have up to 4 doses of the vaccine. The Ministry of Health made an announcement for a booster/4th dose to be given to people aged 70 years and over.

claim: Joe Biden has never flown on Air Force One.
label: Refuted
justification: This claim is refuted. According to the QA pairs, Joe Biden flew on Air Force One on 06/02/2021, more than a month before this claim was created (28/03/21). Therefore, this claim is refuted.

questions.question: Biden's first flight as President was on Air Force One on February 2nd, 21st of February, 2021. He was made president on 28th of March, 21d of that year. It is not clear when this claim was made.

claim: Since President Muhammadu Buhari took office in 2015, the number of unemployed Nigerians has fallen.
label: Refuted
justification: 23.2 million (number of unemployed Nigerians at date of claim) is greater than 6.1 million (number of unemployed Nigerians when Buhari took office in 2015).
speaker: Femi Adesina

questions.question: 23.2 million Nigerians are unemployed at date of the claim. Buhari took office in May 2015. Nigeria's un-employment figure for May 2015 was 6.1 million people. There is no unemployment allowance for Nigerian workers until 2021, according to the government.

claim: Lil Nas X and MSCHF  'Satan Shoes' use human blood in their production
label: Supported
justification: Confirmed via MSCHF & also a spokesperson.

questions.question: MSCHF collaborated with Adidas on a shoe collaboration. The sole of each shoe contains 60 cubic centimeters (2.03 fluid ounces) of red ink and "one drop" of human blood. The blood was provided by members of the art collective, MSCHF.

claim: United Nations chief said they were “deeply shocked” by the conditions at migrant detention facilities under President Joe Biden’s administration.
label: Refuted
justification: The statement was made when President Trump was still in office

questions.question: Michelle Bachelet is the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights. She was speaking about conditions at a U.S migrant detention facility. Donald Trump was President of the U.N. in July 2019. He started on January 20, 2017 and his tenure ended on January 2020. Michelle Bachele didn't talk about Joe Biden.

claim: The chairman of Tirupati Balaji temple samiti Chandrashekhar Reddy is a Christian, and the chairman of Siddhi Vinayak Temple trust Salim is a Muslim
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: Unable to verify they work there or confirm religion.
speaker: Vipin Sharma

questions.question: Chandrashekhar Reddy is not the chairman of Tirupati Balaji temple. The website does not have a list of those working there. It is not possible to find a list with the names of the chairmen linked to this temple.

claim: Kids and body parts were found in the Ever Given, the cargo shipped that blocked Egypt's Suez Canal for multiple days.
label: Refuted
justification: The answer given states that thie was no kids or body parts found as claimed and the ship was allowed to go on its way, which is also common knowledge for many people as the event was wildly publicized.
speaker: Greg Clark

questions.question: The cargo ship Ever Given got stuck in the Suez Canal in March 2021. There is no evidence to suggest it was carrying body parts. It was inspected after being freed from the canal and there were no news reports of body parts being found during the inspection.

claim: 1 cup of dandelion greens = 535% of your daily recommended vitamin K and 112% of vitamin A.
label: Supported
justification: Confirmed via Data from the Department of Agriculture.

questions.question: 1 cup of dandelion greens contains 508 micrograms of vitamin A and 778.4 microg of vitamin K per person on a 2,000 calorie diet. According to nutritiondata.self.com, that is 112% daily value for vitamin A but 535% daily amount for vitamin K.

claim: Voices of Los Angeles Police Department pilots, captured on police scanner, talk about dumping gas over protesters and homeless people before lighting it on fire.
label: Refuted
justification: The members are no LAPD
speaker: mrcheckpoint_

questions.question: Pilot 1 and Pilot 2 were recorded on a live LAPD scanner last night (3/24/21) saying that they would have dumped the fuel on Glendale Boulevard long ago. They are not employees of the LAPD. There was a command review by Air Support Division of the radio transmission and the helicopters depicted in the video.

claim: A new Georgia law will end voting hours early making it harder for working people to vote.
label: Refuted
justification:
QA 3's answer is misleading as a section of information was omitted: 
"... but no longer than 7:00 A.M. through 7:00 P.M."
"Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph, counties and municipalities
1513 the registrars may extend the hours for voting beyond regular business hours to permit
advance voting from 7:00 A.M. until 7:00 P.M. 
A QA with a question similar to: What is the intention of changing the voting hours in Georgia? would have been pertinent.
speaker: President Joe Biden

questions.question: The Election Integrity Act of 2021 would expand early voting access for most counties. Polling places are open on Election Day from 7:00 a.m. to 7:30 p.m., but some counties will have an extra weekend day and weekday early voting hours will likely be longer.

claim: Kerala has 20 lakh illegal Bangladeshi voters
label: Refuted
justification: It seems from the 1st QA that these voters are not illegal, therefore the claim is refuted
speaker: Social Observer

questions.question: There are 20 lakh Bangladeshis and Rohingya Muslims in Kerala who have ration cards and voter ID cards. According to the article, these voters will decide which government will rule the state. There are over 23 lakh Bangladedish immigrants in India. 76 percent of them have been staying in India before 1991. In 2018, Kerala had an estimated 35 lakh workers.

claim: During February 2021, the vast majority of families who were attempting to cross the southwest land border into the US were sent back.
label: Refuted
justification: The questions cleverly recognise that a part of the claim is about the type of people crossing, in this case families, which are statistically logged as FMUAs. The use of this data and return figures, disproves the claim clearly.
speaker: Joe Biden

questions.question: 7,915 immigrants were expelled from the US southwest land border in February 2021 as part of FMUAs. 19,246 people were encountered by the US Border Patrol and the US Office of Field Operations trying to cross the border in that year.  Almost 41% of them were sent back to their home countries.

claim: The Vast majority of people coming to the US border are being sent back
label: Supported
justification: 96, 974  apprehended is a large chunk of 100,441 that initially tried to cross.
speaker: Joe Biden

questions.question: There were 96,974 people apprehended trying to cross the US southwest land border in February 2021.  In February 2021 there were 100,441 people trying to enter the US from the south. The number is expected to reach 100,000 in February 2019.

claim: Amazon delivery drivers are forced to pee in plastic bottles because of intense pressure to work quickly.
label: Supported
justification: Both Q&A pairs point out that both Amazon itself knew about employees having no time to take a toilet break and comments from former employees confirming this.
speaker: Rep. Mark Pocan

questions.question: Some Amazon delivery drivers have to urinate in bottles while delivering packages. A memo from Amazon logistics highlights this fact. One former employee used to work for Amazon as a subcontractor driver and he had to pee in the van during his non break time, because the company phone would keep track if he stopped delivering.

claim: 800 Crore Kumbh Scam Under Bhartiya Janta Party (BJP) Govt In Uttar Pradesh.
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: Unable to confirm if satire news or genuine from lack of QA evidence provided,
speaker: MP Congress

questions.question: Amar Ujala published a page of satire only articles. There is no proof that it is satire.  No answer could be found as to whether it is true or not. It was shared by Amar Ujla.    For confidential support call the Samaritans on 08457 90 90 90, visit a local Samaritans branch or click here.

claim: In Washington DC USA The Joe Biden administration spent more money on housing National Guard than shelter for migrants
label: Supported
justification: It seems indeed that more is being spent on housing the national guard than migrants, therefore the label is supported
speaker: Doug Treff

questions.question: The US spends $483 million on National Guard support through March 15. The cost of housing the National Guard in Washington is estimated to be $284 million for personnel and $199 million for operations. Hotel costs are probably factored into these costs as well.

claim: The World Health Organisation announced in January 2021 that the Covid-19 PCR test is flawed and all positive tests in the past 14 months are ‘invalid’ if a high cycle threshold of 35 or above has been used.
label: Refuted
justification: The answers are very comprehensive and explains in detail the WHO guidance.

questions.question: The January 2021 WHO guidance on SARS-CoVirus testing for PCP-2 states that careful interpretation of weak positive results is needed. The cycle threshold (CT) needed to detect virus is inversely proportional to the patient's viral load. If test results do not correspond with the clinical presentation, a new specimen should be taken and retested using the same or different technology.

claim: Republicans recently passed a bill to eliminate early voting on Sunday in Georgia.
label: Refuted
justification: The answers and sources show that there is still some Sunday early voting so the claim is refuted.
speaker: Charles Schumer

questions.question: SB 202 bill allows for two Sundays of early voting but both have to take place two weeks before Election Day. According to SB 202 both Saturdays of the three-week early voting period would become mandatory and both Sundays would be optional. Sixteen of Georgia's 159 counties held Sunday voting in November.

claim: There was no news coverage of Covid-19 cases in the Philippines on March 23rd 2021.
label: Refuted
justification: Its clear from the Q&A that there were news reports that day, so the claim is refuted.
speaker: Jay Sonza

questions.question: There were 5,867 new coronavirus cases on March 23. The number of new infections has declined for the first time in five days.    State-run Philippine News Agency reported on the news. Rappler, ABS-CBN News, Philstar, CNN Philippines, INQUIRER.net, GMA News, SunStar, and even the state-run news agency covered Covid-19 Stories.

claim: The Ugandan country’s Ministry of Health Covid-19 task force posted job vacancies on Facebook
label: Refuted
justification: The answer and credible source show that the claim is featured on a fake account so it is refuted.
speaker: Daily Monitor Jobs

questions.question: Facebook account purporting to be run by Daily Monitor is spreading the claim that Uganda's Covid-19 task force is hiring more staff. The account is fake and not affiliated with the newspaper. AFP Fact Check confirmed with the Ministry of Health that the job listings are a hoax.

claim: Biden Administration  referred to as Biden Harris Administration.
label: Supported
justification: The Offical White House website have officially used the term Biden-Harris Administration to refer Biden Administration.
speaker: Patrick Goodenough

questions.question: Joe Biden won the 2020 US presidential election. Kamala Harris is the vice president of the United States. The Offical White House website have used the term Biden-Harris Administration since the first day of Biden's presidency. It is officially called the Biden and Harris Administration.

claim: Senators in the U.S. demanded an anti-white ban on the cabinet.
label: Refuted
justification: The Senators in the U.S  did not call for an outright ban on white people in the Cabinet. Some of the Senators promise to withhold their votes on some nominees until Mr. Biden engaged more actively on the issue amid a rising tide of racism toward Asian-Americans during the pandemic.
speaker: The National Pulse

questions.question: Tammy Duckworth and Mazie K. Hirono will delay approval of some cabinet nominees until Vice President Biden engages more actively on the issue of increasing the number of Asian-Americans in his administration. The aim is to increase representation of different demographics within the administration.

claim: The number of new Covid-19 cases in the Philippines dropped on 23rd March 2021.
label: Refuted
justification: QA pair states at record high since pandemic began.
speaker: Jay Sonza

questions.question: The Philippines on Tuesday, March 23, logged 5, 5,867 new coronavirus cases and 20 new deaths. The number of active infections at present is the highest since the start of the COVID-19 outbreak in the country. It surpassed the 81,851 recorded on Aug. 15 last year.

claim: The trustee of Siddhi Vinayak Temple is Salim Muslim.
label: Refuted
justification: The answer and sources show that no one with that name is a trustee of the temple and so the claim is refuted.
speaker: Kumar Laxman

questions.question: Siddhi Vinayak Temple is a Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shri Ganesh. It is located in Prabhadevi, Mumbai, Maharashtra, India. The temple has a Board of Trustees and none of them have the name Salim.

claim: American protocol requires Vice Presidents to salute military personnel.
label: Refuted
justification: Per section 2-1-g of the Salutes, Honors, and Courtesy document non-military personnel (of which the VP is one) are not required to salute.
speaker: BonginoReport

questions.question: In America, Vice Presidents are not required to salute military personnel. The Commander in Chief returns salutes as a matter of courtesy. Since the VP is not in the chain of command, it would be incorrect for her to salute anyone.  If other VPs did it, it was incorrect.

claim: The chairman of Tirupati Bala Tirupati Balaji Temple Committee, Chandrashekhar Reddy is a Christian.
label: Refuted
justification: Sri Y V Subba Reddy is a Hindu.
speaker: Kumar Laxman

questions.question: Chandrashekhar Reddy does not appear on the website of TTD. The chairman of the TTD is Sri Y V Subba Reddy, who is Hindu. He is the Chairman of the Tirupati Bala Tirupathi Balaji Temple Committee.

claim: AstraZeneca, the name of a British-Swedish drugmaker, means "weapon that kills" in a combination of three languages
label: Refuted
justification: This claim is refuted. Astra means star in Greek and Zeneca was invented by branding consultancy agency Interbrand. There is no evidence of AstraZeneca meaning "weapon that kills". Therefore, this claim is refuted.
speaker: Pete Veritas

questions.question: Astra AB was founded in 1913 in Södertälje, Sweden. Astra has its roots in the Greek astron, meaning 'a star'. Zeneca was formed in 1993 by the demerger of the pharmaceuticals and agrochemicals businesses of Imperial Chemical Industries.

claim: Boulder supermarket in Colo shooting suspect  came to the US during the Obama administration as a Syrian refugee via Obama-era asylum programs
label: Refuted
justification: According to the evidence, Obama was elected president in 2009, while Boulder supermarket suspect Ahmad Al Aliwi Alissa immigrated to the United States from Syria in 2002. Hence, this claim is refuted.

questions.question: Ahmad Al Aliwi was born in Syria in 1999. His family emigrated to the U.S. in 2002, before Barack Obama was president. He is the suspect in the shooting in Boulder. The suspect's brother told CNN that their family emigrated from Syria to the US in 2002.

claim: Ford agreed to invest $900 million at an Ohio plant because Donald Trump “lowered taxes” and is now moving the project to Mexico because Joe Biden is “increasing taxes.
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: Evidence could not be found that proves that plant was moved from Ohio to Mexico because of tax reasons

questions.question: Ford promised $900 million of investment and a new model for the OHIO ford plant. Ford will build the next-generation vehicle in Mexico instead. No answer could be found as to whether it was because of tax reasons or because of other reasons.

claim: legislation i offered in 2013 could have prevented one of the deadliest such events in U.S. history, except Democrats “filibustered it, demanded 60 votes.”
label: Refuted
justification: This claim is false as the amendment could have made gun crimes increase
speaker: Sen. Ted Cruz (R-Tex.)

questions.question: Ted Cruz's 2013 gun control proposal would not have prevented the Texas massacre. It would have made it easier for the shooter to attack a church in a neighboring state instead. The amendment would not prevent any of the six specific protocol failures at the Air Force that allowed Kelley to slip through the cracks.

claim: The 1994 assault-weapons law reduced mass shootings.
label: Supported
justification: The 1994 assault-weapons law reduced mass shootings, but its expiration in 2004 was followed by an increase in the use of these weapons in mass shootings and other crimes.
speaker: Joe Biden

questions.question: The 1994 assault weapons ban was a weak law with many loopholes. The grandfather clause allowed gun manufacturers to sell all of their existing inventory. Gun manufacturers were able to make cosmetic changes to their products without being subject to the Act. The sunset provision after 10 years allowed the Act to expire, so mass killings increased after it expired.

claim: Boulder, Colorado had a 2-year “assault weapons” ban at the time of the Boulder shooting killing 10 people.
label: Refuted
justification: the ban was lifted just days before the shooting, so this is refuted.
speaker: Antonia Okafor Cover

questions.question: Boulder had an assault weapon ban since 2018, but it was lifted days before the mass shooting on March 22. A city ordinance banning assault-style rifles and high-capacity magazines was struck down by a judge just days before that shooting.

claim: Suspected Islamic State (IS) group brides Lisa Smith and Shamima Begum received different legal treatments. Lisa Smith was able to resume a normal life at home while Shamima Begum faced punishment, including losing her citizenship.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: One is from the UK and one from Ireland so different judicial systems.

questions.question: Lisa Smith, 38, was arrested at Dublin Airport on Sunday after being deported from Turkey. She is suspected of being an Islamic State bride in Syria. Lisa Smith has been charged for her connection with the Islamic State terrorist group and she's been granted bail. If convicted, Lisa Smith could face seven years in prison.

claim: An AR-15 semi-automatic rifle was used as the weapon by the shooter in 11 past mass shootings in the US.
label: Supported
justification: The claim is supported as the evidence gathered finds all the guns found from each shootings are a type of AR-15 rifle.
speaker: Adam Best

questions.question: Sig Sauer MCX is a descendant of the AR-15 semi-automatic rifle used in the Pulse Night club attack in Orlando, Florida. An Ar-15-style weapon was used in Route 91 Harvest music festival on the Las Vegas Strip shooting. A Smith & Wesson M&P15 semiautomatic rifle was used at the movie theater in Aurora, Colorado. The Bushmaster XM15-E2S rifle was also used in Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting in Newtown, Connecticut. Ruger AR-556 rifles were used at First Baptist Church in Sutherland Springs, Texas and the Tree of Life Congregation in Pittsburgh.

claim: Kylie Jenner earns $450,000 per day.
label: Supported
justification: She makes the given number of dollars per day, as per the 2nd question and answer pair. Therefore, thar claim is supported.
speaker: David Leavitt

questions.question: Kylie Jenner makes $19,006 per hour. When multiplied by 24 hours in a day it is $456, 144. Kylie Jenner earns that amount if she works for an hour every 24 hours. She earns this amount per hour divided by the total number of hours worked per day is $19,.006.

claim: The EU has exported 41.6 million vaccines so far, 10 million of which were to the UK.
label: Supported
justification: The answers show that the amounts of vaccines mentioned in the claim is correct so the claim is supported.
speaker: Alex Taylor

questions.question: 41 million doses of coronavirus vaccine have been exported from the EU up to March 2021. The U.K. is the largest recipient of doses made in the EU, receiving 10 million. It's estimated that there will be more than 100 million cases of virus in the UK by 2020.

claim: Texas’s Operation Lone Star is aimed at completing former US president Donald Trump’s controversial Mexico border wall project, which his successor has moved to end.
label: Refuted
justification:
According to the sources of the Q&A's, there is no substance in the claim that the Mexico border wall project is to be completed by 
Texas Operation Lone Star. Without additional evidence, it appears that the information provided by the source has been misinterpretated.
speaker: Scott Shields

questions.question: Governor Greg Abbott launched Operation Lone Star to combat the smuggling of people and drugs into Texas. The operation will expand to include efforts to crack down on human trafficking related to illegal border crossings. Troopers and agents will interview unaccompanied minors who crossed the border to identify victims of human trafficking and gain actionable intelligence that will aid in the arrest of traffickers.

claim: The US Defense Secretary discussed human rights issues with Indian ministers.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: One answer says did not speak with the prime minister about it but did speak with other members of the cabinet, while answer 2 says there was no discussion.
speaker: Avinash Srivastava

questions.question: Lloyd J. Austin III is the first member of the administration to meet with Prime Minister Modi. He did not discuss human rights issues with him, but he did have a conversation with other members of the Cabinet on this issue. Human rights and values were mentioned as shared attributes in the Biden/Harris administration.

claim: There has been a 460% increase in people trying to cross the Southern USA Border illegally under Joe Biden's Presidency.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: Yes there was an increase under Joe BIden but it had been rising prior to this too.
speaker: GOV. DOUG DUCEY (R), ARIZONA

questions.question: Illegal apprehensions at the southern border of the U.S. increased by 487% between 2017 and 2021. The increase was not due to rise under Joe Biden's administration, but because the rate had already been rising since around 2017. Donald Trump was president of the US from 2017 to 2020.

claim: The Khalife Sisters pitched CBD gummies on a television programme.
label: Refuted
justification: There is no mention of CBD gummies in the pitch or any link to them.
speaker: Alice Palmer

questions.question: Donna and Rosy Khaliffe co-founded Surprise Ride, a box subscription service for kids. Donna has no association with Jolly CBD Gummies.
