claim: The COVID-19 vaccine should not be given to people with neurological issues as it can further aggravate their symptoms.
label: Refuted
justification: Evidence finds that the COVID-19 vaccine is safe for people with neurological conditions. The only reason the vaccine should not be given is if someone has a severe allergy to an ingredient in the vaccine.
speaker: Biswaroop Chaudhary and Tarun Kothari

questions.question: All COVID-19 vaccines are safe for neurology patients. The ABN recommends you take whichever vaccination you are offered without delay. There is no specific contraindication to the vaccine, unless there is a severe allergic reaction.  Covid-19 Vaccines are safe and effective for people with neurological issues.

claim: The COVID-19 vaccine should not be given to children as it can cause diseases in the future.
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification:
Q&A 1 shows there was limited data on children receiving a covid vaccine and so only kids at High risk from covid itself  children should receive one but not because it was proven harmful, only as there were unknown possibilities of harm. so some cherry picking going on.
Q&A 2 shows the people who made this claim were anti-vax which does not discredit the claim but only the people who made it. so more evidence form the time of the claim is needed. ( although hindsight says the claim is easily refuted)
speaker: Biswaroop Chaudhary and Tarun Kothari

questions.question: There is limited data on vaccination in adolescents and no data on younger children at this time. Children with severe neuro-disabilities that require residential care should be offered vaccination with either the Pfizer-BioNTech or AstraZeneca vaccine. Clinicians should discuss the risks and benefits of vaccination with a person with parental responsibility.

claim: Indian armys Sena Jal' makes commercial debut
label: Refuted
justification: The answer and source clearly say that the package is not available to purchase so the claim is refuted.

questions.question: Sena Jal is a packaged water initiated by the Army Wives Welfare Association. It's not being produced for commercial use by the army and there are no agency proposals as of now.    There was no water available to buy commercially at the time of this claim.

claim: The H.R. 1446—the Enhanced Background Checks Act of 2021—“would create a nationwide ‘waiting period’” after the purchase of a firearm.
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: There is not enough evidence to say that there would be a waiting period according to the answers below.
speaker: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene

questions.question: H.R-8 is The Bipartisan Background Checks Act of 2021. It establishes new background check requirements for firearm transfers between private parties. NICS conducts background checks on people who want to own a firearm or an explosive as required by the law.

claim: 966 people had died after having the Pfizer or Moderna COVID vaccines.
label: Supported
justification: The 3rd answer shows that there have been a similar amount of people die after having the 2 vaccines so the claim is supported.

questions.question: 970 people died after being given a Pfizer or Moderna vaccine shot. 495 of those deaths occurred following a Moderna shot and 475 following a Pfizers shot. The MHRA is reviewing reports of an extremely rare blood clotting problem affecting a small number of people who had the Oxford/AstraZeneca vaccine.

claim: Hydroxychloroquine is an effective treatment for Covid-19.
label: Refuted
justification: It is clear from the Q&As that Hydroxychloroquine is not recommended or considered safe by experts for the treatment for covid-19.
speaker: Canadian doctors

questions.question: Hydroxychloroquine is a medication used to prevent and treat malaria. Clinical trials found it ineffective for this purpose and there is a risk of dangerous side effects. A publication by The Lancet retracted due to data flaws, so the speculative use of hydroxychlorquine for COVID-19 threatens its availability for people with established indications.

claim: The current number of immigrants being apprehended at the U.S - Mexico border in the first two months of 2021 is higher than the crisis Joe Biden, Barack Obama and Nancy Pelosi acknowledged in 2014.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: The claim is cherry picking because some of the numbers in 2021 could be due to title 42 expulsions so the amount is uncertain and the claim does not mention this factor.
speaker: Kayleigh McEnany

questions.question: There was an immigration crisis at the U.S.- Mexico border in the first two months of 2021. January 2021 recorded 75,312 encounters at the southern border. In May 2014 there were 60,683 apprehensions. President Trump invoked Title 42 expulsions in March 2020 to expel migrants seeking admission into the U.,S. on the grounds that their entry into the country could contribute to the spread of COVID-19.

claim: The PCR test is worthless, and only 3% of those with positive tests have COVID-19.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification:
The 1st Q&A pair states that PCR tests in relation to covid cases do provide some accuracy and aid in detecting cases but are not exactly highly accurate overall,  which somewhat disagrees with the claim stating they are worthless. this 1st Q&A pair also give much higher accuracy percentages than the claim states.
Which looks like the claim is cherry-picking some aspects of the available data.
speaker: Canadian doctors

questions.question: The false-negative rate for SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR testing is highly variable. It's highest within the first 5 days after exposure and lowest on day 8 after exposure. At its best, one out of five people suspected of COVID-19 will test negative.

claim: Meghan Markle once worked at Humphrey Yogart
label: Supported
justification: Worked there at 13 years old.
speaker: Meghan Markle

questions.question: Meghan's first job was at Humphrey Yogart when she was 13. She worked there until she was 16.  It is not clear where Meghan Markle got her first job now. It could be anywhere from a place called Humphrey Yart to a shop called "Yogart".

claim: Vitamin D is an effective treatment for Covid-19.
label: Refuted
justification: Vitamin D is important for bone, muscle and dental health not for the treatment for Covid-19.
speaker: Canadian doctors

questions.question: Vitamin D is important for bone, muscle and dental health. There is no strong evidence that taking vitamin D supplements will make you less susceptible to COVID-19. It's not clear if Vitamin D plays a positive role in the treatment of covid 19.

claim: The H.R. 8—the Bipartisan Background Checks Act of 2021—“would create a national gun registry”.
label: Refuted
justification: The Act specifically states that it does not authorise the creation of a national firearms registry.
speaker: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene

questions.question: The new bill says nothing in it can be construed to authorize the establishment of a national firearms registry. It also doesn't interfere with the authority of a state to enact a law on the same subject matter as this Act. The bill was passed by the Senate.

claim: The Centre for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) reported that face masks do not work.
label: Refuted
justification: This claim is refuted. According to the QA pairs, the CDC in a white house briefing said "you have decreases in cases and deaths when you wear masks". Therefore, this claim is refuted.
speaker: Linda Arnett

questions.question: The CDC claims that face masks don't work at stopping Covid 19 spread. The director of the CDC made the statement during a White House briefing. There are decreases in cases and deaths when people wear masks.  Dr. Rochelle Walensky said it.

claim: Army wives welfare association has started 'Sena Jal' packaged water initiative.
label: Supported
justification: The answers and sources show that the initiative was started by the AWWA so the claim is supported.

questions.question: Madhulika Rawat, wife of current army chief General Bipin Rawat is running the Army Wives Welfare Association (AWWA). AWWA is one of the largest voluntary organizations in India. Sena Jal is ozonised and purified bottled water which is being developed by AWWA. The profit will go towards the welfare of soldiers and their families.

claim: Coronavirus variants get weaker over time and less dangerous.
label: Supported
justification: The claim states that the virus 'covid19' gets weaker over time and thus becomes less dangers, Q&A pair 1 say this is true as the virus does mutate this way to survive
speaker: Canadian doctors

questions.question: Covid-19 variants get weaker over time and don't survive for long. There's the possibility of mutating in such a way that ensures their survival.    They can be repaired by surgery, but they are not very likely to survive long term.

claim: A Gujarat court acquitted 122 Muslim men after they had spent 20 years in jail for alleged links to banned outfit Students' Islamic Movement of India (SIMI).
label: Refuted
justification: Gujrat court did not aquit the 122 musilm men who had connects with SIMI, as they were already out on bail for 20 years and not in prison. The actual figure was 127 men but five of them had died during the course of trial.
speaker: Azim Uddin Mondal

questions.question: Gujarat court acquitted 122 Muslim men on Saturday for alleged links to banned outfit Students' Islamic Movement of India (SIMI). The actual figure was 127 men, but five of them died during the course of trial. Gujrat court did not aquit 122 men who had connections with SIMI as they were already out on bail for 20 years and not in prison.

claim: Coronavirus variants artificially created are not found in humans.
label: Refuted
justification: Evidence concludes that COVID-19 variants were not artificially created. More so, if the virus had been genetically engineered in a lab, there would be signs of manipulation in the genome data. Therefore, this claim is refuted.
speaker: Canadian Doctors

questions.question: SARS-CoV-2 virus evolved into two distinct strains, acquiring adaptations for more efficient invasion of human cells. Coronavirus is constantly evolving in its host to form different variants and it's not artificially created. SARS has been sequenced and shared by scientists all over the world.

claim: £37 billion has been spent on NHS Test and Trace so far.
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification:
The answer to Q1 is not strictly correct because the question asks "what was the budget"  The source confirms that the £37 billion includes additional funding.
No idea where the date in Q3 comes from.
Answer 3 doesn't answer the question.
The last question is garbled but I understand the intent.
The answer to the last question is not supported by the source, which is a report dated 11 Dec 2020  which does have some evidence of spending which is not in the answer given.
It is possible to glean from the sources, but not the Q&A, that this is a budgeted amount. There is no evidence that it has not been spent.
speaker: Jim Grace

questions.question: A total of £37 billion has been allocated to the NHS Test and Trace scheme. This is the budget for its first two years up to April 2022. The figure does not represent the money that has been spent so far. It is estimated that 37 million was spent by March 2021.

claim: The majority of COVID-19 patients are asymptomatic.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: Most age groups are shown to be asymptomatic in Q&A 1 however the answer shows that this does not apply to all age groups such as older folks so some cherry picking is going on in the claim as Q&A 2 bluntly states that it depends on age.
speaker: Canadian doctors

questions.question: In general population studies, the proportion of asymptomatic COVID-19 infection at time of testing was 20% and 75%. In three studies in contacts it was 8.2% to 50%. In obstetric patients, 95% (45% to 100%) remained asymPTomatic through follow-up. In nursing home residents, the percentage was 54% (42% to 65%).

claim: Line 17 of the $1.9 Trillion USD Covid-19 Stimulus bill awards $25 Million USD to House representatives.
label: Refuted
justification: The answers confirm that the Stimulus bill doesn't mention money awarded to the House representatives.
speaker: K.E. Bolton

questions.question: The American Rescue Plan document (Covid-19 Stimulus bill) does not mention an award of $25 million USD to House representatives. The 628 page document contains nothing relating to this.  It is not part of the American Rescue plan.

claim: A fire broke out and engulfed the Nigerian President’s Villa in Aso Rock, Nigeria, causing tensions.
label: Refuted
justification: No fire broke out in the Nigerian President’s Villa in Aso Rock.
speaker: Igbo Mara Mma

questions.question: A fire did not break out in the Nigerian President’s Villa in Aso Rock, Nigeria. It was not caused by tensions at the president's residence there. The situation is not as it appears.    in fact, no tension exists.

claim: CDC study found that face masks have a negligible effect on the spread of COVID-19
label: Refuted
justification: It seems from the question and answer pairs that there has been indeed a reduction in covid cases due to face masks. Therefore, the claim is reufuted

questions.question: The U.S CDC conducted a study on the effectiveness of facemasks at stopping Covid 19. The study found that mask mandates were associated with reductions in COVID-19 case and death growth rates within 20 days, as well as reductions in deaths.

claim: The filibuster was never an idea of the founding fathers."
label: Supported
justification: The answers show that filibusting was not used originally so the claim is supported.
speaker: Chuck Todd

questions.question: In 1789, the House and Senate rulebooks included what is known as the “previous question” motion. The House kept their motion and today it empowers a simple majority to cut off debate. In 1975, the number of votes required to end a filibuster was changed from two-thirds of senators voting to three-fifths of all senators duly chosen and sworn.

claim: $1.9 trillion US pandemic relief act includes a $25 million bonus for members of the House of Representatives.
label: Refuted
justification: This claim is refuted. There is no mention of a bonus in the US Pandemic Relief Act for House of Representatives. Therefore, this claim is refuted.
speaker: K.E Bolton

questions.question: $1.9 trillion was in the US pandemic relief act. There is no bonus for House or Senate members of the House of Representatives as stated in the act's documentation, but there is no mention of it in the legislation.    The bill does not include a bonus for members of Congress.

claim: The $1.9 trillion COVID-19 relief bill awards a $25 million bonus to House members.
label: Refuted
justification: No evidence to support.

questions.question: There is no mention of any kind of bonus for House members from the relief fund in the $1.9 trillion COVID-19 relief bill, but it could award a $25 million bonus to House members if passed. It's not clear if this is true.

claim: The high blood pressure medication hydrochlorothiazide can cause skin cancer.
label: Supported
justification: Studies have reported an increased risk of skin cancer with long term use of the drug.

questions.question: Hydrochlorothiazide is used to treat high blood pressure. It's taken by mouth once daily in the morning with or without food. The MHRA has issued a drug safety update about the risk of non-melanoma skin cancer associated with hydrochlorothsiazide.

claim: Sen. John Barrasso of Wyoming defended his vote against the American Rescue Plan Act, in part, by claiming that the legislation would provide $1,400 stimulus checks to prisoners who shouldn’t receive them.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: A Payment made to someone who is incarcerated should be returned to the IRS by following the instructions about repayments.
speaker: Sen John Barrasso

questions.question: Prisoners are not eligible to receive the $1,400 stimulus checks under the American Rescue Plan Act. Barrasso voted for Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act in March and Consolidated Appropriations Act in December. The bills included the same language denying checks to “any nonresident alien individual” that Barrasso now claims is insufficient.

claim: INTERNATIONAL SPACE STATION FILM A UFO FOR 22 MINUTES
label: Refuted
justification: It is difficult to understand the question. However from the answer it seems that the observed object was a japanese experiment. Therefore, the claim is refuted.

questions.question: The video lasted for 22 minutes. It was the Japanese Experiment Module Inter-orbit Communication System–Exposed Facility. The facility is a space communication system. it's located in orbit.  It's called the JEMIMAISAT. Its main purpose is to communicate with other objects in space.

claim: Ballots From The 2020 US Election Were Found Shredded And Trashed In Maricopa County, Arizona
label: Refuted
justification: The source of reporting was found to be biased according to the Q&A, and no validation of the claim was presented.

questions.question: Gateway Pundit and InfoWars are the most biased conservative news sources according to an independent audit. Maricopa County's 2020 elections were safe, secure, and accurate. The equipment worked well and the people were above reproach. It doesn't matter if you like the results or not, the will of the people was represented.

claim: Pakistan requests made-in-India Covid vaccine under Global Alliance for Vaccines and Immunisation program.
label: Supported
justification: Correct claim
speaker: Major Surendra Poonia (@MajorPoonia)

questions.question: Pakistan will receive 45 million doses of Indian-made COVID vaccine under the GAVI (Global Alliance for Vaccinations & Immunizations) vaccine alliance. Pakistan has requested to receive a made-in-India Covid vaccine. It is manufactured in India.

claim: The Controller General of the Nigerian Customs Service, Hameed Ali said the service has not recruited in the last 17 years.
label: Supported
justification: The quote was made by the CGC on March 4, 2021
speaker: The Cable

questions.question: The CGC said that the NCS had not recruited in the past 17 years. Recruitment into the service is the prerogative of the President. The article was published in Guardian, Nigeria on March 4, 2021 and it's relevant to this context.

claim: Indian Union Government is providing a monthly allowance of Rs 3,500 to unemployed youth.
label: Refuted
justification: Unemployed youths do not receive an allowance on unemployment benefit - only those who have worked for a maximum of 2 years due to their work being closed down.
speaker: Roshan Mishra

questions.question: The Indian government provides an unemployment benefit. Unemployed people are entitled to 50% of wage for a maximum of 2 years during the lifetime. The allowance is only available to unemployed people who have been employed for at least 2 years and their work has closed down.

claim: In a letter Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi praised Yogi Adityanath, chief minister of Uttar Pradesh, for his contribution towards laying the foundation of a Hindu Rashtra (Hindu nation).
label: Refuted
justification: Deemed to be a fake.
speaker: Zakir Hussain

questions.question: The Uttar Pradesh government's fact check twitter handle said the viral letter is fake. The fake letter says, "Dear Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath". Most official letters by PM Modi use honorifics like 'Shri' or 'ji', as in the condolence letter.

claim: Former president Pratibha Patil praised the work of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
label: Refuted
justification: No evidence to support.

questions.question: There are no reports where Patil has made these comments. No interviews or mentions of this can be found.  Patil is not mentioned in any media reports about the matter.   . He did not make any such comments.  It is not known if he has ever been interviewed.

claim: The New York Times and German broadcaster Deutsche Welle have endorsed China’s Covid-19 vaccines.
label: Refuted
justification: The answers and sources clearly show that the publishers have not endorsed the vaccines.
speaker: Tai Shing Suen

questions.question: Deutsche Welle did not endorse China’s Covid-19 vaccines. New York Times did not say that Chinese vaccines are superior to those produced elsewhere. Deutsche Welle listed COVID-19 as part of the 10 most advanced vaccine projects in the world, but this was during phase III trials.

claim: Senators are not given sufficient time to read proposed high dollar legislation before it is voted on.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: It seems like senators may skip past reading every page in a bill - but they do have specific time dedicated within the "Calender".
speaker: Ron Johnson

questions.question: Senator Ron Johnson skipped past the reading of a 628-page bill introduced minutes before a vote. Mark Pocan pointed out that he did it when he got a tax break in a $2 trillion bill a few years ago. The time limit for reading legislative bills is under the order of business now known as "Calendar".

claim: Ivermectin is effective for preventing and treating COVID-19
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: From the question ans answer pairs it seems like there isn't enough information to make a label on these claims, as the working of ivermectin is inconclusive

questions.question: Ivermectin is an FDA-approved antiparasitic drug used to treat several neglected tropical diseases. There are insufficient data for the COVID-19 Treatment Guidelines Panel to recommend either for or against the use of IvermECTin for the treatment of Covid 19 infection.

claim: A flatter bag of lettuce at the grocery store indicates it is fresher than that in an inflated bag.
label: Refuted
justification: From the 3rd question and answer pair it seems that the flatter bag of lettuce is not a good indicator. Therefore, the claim is refuted.

questions.question: Cut lettuce releases carbon dioxide gas, but it won't build up in bagged lettuce due to a unique innovation called modified atmosphere packaging. Best by date is the best indicator of freshness in packaged lettuce bags. It's better than flatness or puffiness of the bag.

claim: West Virginia “is the only state to decline in population over the last 70 years”
label: Supported
justification: The answer and source show that the state was the only one to decline so the claim is supported.
speaker: Jim Justice

questions.question: West Virginia lost 11% of its population between 1950 and 2019. North Dakota, South Dakota and Vermont gained a small number of residents from 142,000 to 246,000 in that time period. The other states near the bottom all had small gains rather than losses.

claim: Hair loss may be a side effect of antidepressants.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: The Q&As show differing opinions on hair loss and one shows that the research did not compare to people not taking antidepressants so the claim is conflicting evidence.

questions.question: Antidepressants can cause hair loss. The British NHS does not mention it as a side effect of anti-depressants. Some people may develop temporary shedding around 3 months after starting taking the medication.  Hairspray is listed as an uncommon side effect for some modern antidepressants, i.e. Sertraline.

claim: A German children's charity has commissioned a laboratory to examine a commercially avalailable mask. The face mask was previously worn by a child in school for 8 hours. Examination findings: Detection of 82 bacterial colonies and 4 mold colonies !!
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: The first source just shows a Twitter post so that is not proof it is correct. The other Q&As do not prove the claim or refute it either. Really need questions about the credibility of the research in the claim.

questions.question: The charity has published the report from this examination. The CDC advises to store cloth masks properly and wash them regularly to keep them clean. It is recommended to remove wet or dirty masks as soon as possible to prevent them from becoming moldy. After each wear, bacteria from even a healthy wearer’s own respiratory droplets collect on the inside of a mask and on the outside.

claim: BJP MP Sushil Modi claims first five Indian education ministers were Muslims
label: Refuted
justification: Dr Kalu Lal Shrimali  was a Hindu
speaker: Sushil Kumar Modi

questions.question: Maulana Abul Kalam Azad, Kalu Lal Shrimali, Humayun Kabir, Mohammad Karim Changla and Fakhruddin Ali Ahmed were the first 5 Indian education ministers. Dr Kalu Lall Shrimli was Hindu.

claim: All first five education ministers of India were from  one community.
label: Refuted
justification: The answers show that three of the first five education ministers come from different communities.
speaker: Sunil Kumar Modi

questions.question: Abul Kalam Azad, Dr. K.L. Shrimali, Shri Humayun Kabir and Shri M.C. Chagla were the first five education ministers of India. Abul Kalan Azad was born in Makkah. Humay un Kabir was born at Komarpur. M.c. Chagsla was born on Bombay.

claim: Covid-19 is a rebrand of flu
label: Refuted
justification: COVID-19 is the disease caused by a new coronavirus called SARS-CoV-2

questions.question: What causes the flu is caused by the influenza virus. SARS-CoV-2 is a new coronavirus that can cause the disease COVID-19, which is also known as Covenvirus-Co Virofluenza.

claim: The DHS released thousands of COVID-positive migrants into the United States.
label: Refuted
justification: The answer and sources show that the migrants tested positive after being released so the claim is refuted.
speaker: Ryan Fournier

questions.question: 108 illegal immigrants released by the Border Patrol into Texas since late January have tested positive for Covid-19 after their arrival in Brownsville, Texas. The migrants had been living on the U.S.-Mexico border and were released by Border Patrol. They are all asylum-seekers.

claim: Cuomo Called For Lawmaker Vito Lopez to Resign Amid Sexual Harassment Claims.
label: Supported
justification: Direct quotes to this effect in the source.
speaker: Andrew Cuomo

questions.question: Gov. Andrew Cuomo called on Vito Lopez to resign immediately and said that if he doesn't, he should be expelled. He also said that there should be a zero tolerance policy when it comes to sexual harassment. Mr. Lopez was accused of sexual harassment by another woman.

claim: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez is worth more than $1 million
label: Refuted
justification: This claim is refuted. According to the QA pairs, Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez is estimated networth maximum of $46,997. She also has student loans in the range of $15,001 - $50,000. She is not worth than $1 million. Therefore, this claim is refuted.
speaker: Eric Lipschutz

questions.question: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez has a net worth of 84. She owes the U.S. Dept. of Education $15,001 - $50,000 on student loans.    Max Max is $46,997, Min $29,999 and Average is $8,499.

claim: The index of economic need, underpinning prioritisation for the “Levelling Up Fund” has been transparently published by MHCLG.(the Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government )
label: Supported
justification: The evidence shows that the MHCLG has published the Leveling Up Fund. The index does include economic need, indicating priority areas in the UK for the Levelling Up Fund. Hence, the claim is supported.
speaker: Chancellor Rishi Sunak

questions.question: The Levelling Up Fund provides £4.8 billion in funding for areas across the UK for infrastructure investment. The index of economic need has been published by MHCLG, Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government. It places local authorities into categories 1,2 or 3 depending on their level of need.

claim: The Ingenuity helicopter cannot fly in the Martian atmosphere.
label: Refuted
justification: The Ingenuity helicopter was specifically designed with Mars in mind
speaker: Flat Earth

questions.question: NASA's Ingenuity helicopter is the first aircraft humanity has sent to another planet to attempt powered, controlled flight. It will land safely on Mars under the belly of the Perseverance rover. The power system on the Mars 2020 spacecraft periodically charges Ingenience’s batteries on the way there.

claim: A mountain of gold has been found in the Democratic Republic of Congo.
label: Supported
justification: From the questions and answer pair it does indeed seem like the has been gold found in the DRC, therefore the claim is supported
speaker: @AfricaFactsZone

questions.question: A gold rush in Luhihi village in Congo's South Kivu province has driven authorities to ban mining there until more oversight is established. The discovery of gold-rich ore in late February brought throngs of diggers to the site, putting pressure on the small village around 50 km from the provincial capital, Bukavu.

claim: People traveling to their provinces amid the pandemic no longer need to meet travel requirements.
label: Supported
justification: Seems from the question and answer pair that people indeed do not require the health certificates for travel anymore. Therefore the claim is supported/
speaker: KaViaje

questions.question: IATF for the Management of Emerging Infectious Diseases issued Resolution No. 101 which introduced a “uniform travel protocol” for land, air and sea travel in the Philippines on Feb. 26th. Travel authorities from the Joint Task Force COVID Shield and health certificates are no longer needed. Other requirements, while not nationally mandated anymore, may still be required under certain conditions.

claim: A helicopter gets it lift by pushing air downwards.
label: Supported
justification: The credible source shows that an helicopter does get its lift by pushing air downwards so the claim is supported.
speaker: Flat Earth

questions.question: How do helicopters get their lift? According to Liberty helicopter company, a lift is generated by the way the main rotor blades are formed so the air is pushed in a downward movement when the blades spin. As the air pressure changes, the helicopter lifts up.

claim: There exists a water-powered car that can run solely on water.
label: Refuted
justification: Technology does not currently exist according to QA pairs it would be inefficient to create as take more power than generates.

questions.question: Using water to power cars is a pipe dream. Water molecules are stable and it takes more energy to separate them than to extract any energy from them. Hydrogen is flammable and without the right safety measures, a fender-bender could turn into an explosion worthy of an Avengers movie.

claim: Rockets need atmospheric oxygen which is not available on Mars.
label: Refuted
justification: The question clears up quickly whether oxygen is needed.
speaker: Flat Earth

questions.question: DLA Energy's hydrazine has always been used by NASA for its missions to Mars. Hydrazine propelled the spacecraft in its cruise stage from Earth to Mars and small thrusters were used to adjust the vehicle's course. Most of the hydrazin is used to fire bigger thrusters to control entry, descent, and landing on the Martian surface.

claim: Combustion, cannot exist without at least 16% of oxygen content to burn, and Mars atmosphere only contains 0'16% of molecular oxygen. So, NASA's Perseverance rover cannot land on Mars.
label: Refuted
justification: Hydrazine propellant that does not require oxygen to ignite will be used to power the Perseverance
speaker: Flat Earth

questions.question: Perseverance, Ingenuity and a descent vehicle called "Skycrane" enter the Mars atmosphere at 19,500 km/h (12,100 mph). 21.5-metre parachute will deploy and the heat shield will be ejected. Skycrane will descend at 2.7 km/H (1.6 mph) and lower the rover on 7.6 m nylon cords 20 m above the ground. Hydrazine is the propulsion fuel used by Perseverance.

claim: Helicopter gets its lifting force by pushing air downward. Mars has an atmospheric volume less than 1% of Earth's atmosphere. So, NASA's Ingenuity aircraft cannot fly on Mars.
label: Refuted
justification: The answers and sources show that Ingenuity can fly on Mars so the claim is refuted.
speaker: Flat Earth

questions.question: Mars has one-third the gravity of Earth. Ingenuity's rotor blades are 4ft wide. There is a youtube video of InGenuity's test flight.  Ingenuity have specially adapted rotor blades to cope with Mars' thin atmosphere.

claim: An illegal Christian cross was erected on a hilltop in Edlapadu, Andhra Pradesh, India where footprints of Hindu deity Sita used to exist, thereby encroaching on a Hindu religious site.
label: Refuted
justification: The only Q&A pair state that the location of a cross in the claim is not on the Hill the claim says, and the cross is on another hill that is not of religious significance so not illegal either, as also claimed.
speaker: Sunil Deodhar

questions.question: The hill with Sita Maata footprints and carvings of Lord Narsimha is different from the hill which has the Cross. The allegation that the Cross was erected where SitaMaata footprints were existed is not true. It's a false allegation.

claim: Mars has an atmospheric volume less than 1% of Earth's atmosphere.
label: Supported
justification: Correct
speaker: Flat Earth

questions.question: Mars is about half the size of Earth by diameter and has a thinner atmosphere than Earth's. Mars' atmosphere volume is less than 1% of Earth's, according to ESA (European space agency).  It is also smaller in volume than Earth’s atmosphere.

claim: The Mars Perseverance mission didn't happen because of unfavorable Martian atmospheric conditions.
label: Refuted
justification: QA pairs confirmed the mission did happen.
speaker: Flat Earth

questions.question: On February 18, NASA's Perseverance rover landed on Mars. It will begin a two-year search for signs of ancient microbial life. justification: Patanjali’s managing director Acharya Balakrishnan tweeted that it was clear that the WHO did not approve of the medication as a COVID-19 drug
speaker: Pawan Singh

questions.question: Patanjali Ayurveda has made the first medicine for coronavirus disease Covid-19. WHO South-East Asia tweeted on February 19, 2021 that it has not reviewed or certified the effectiveness of any traditional medicine for the treatment. WHO guidelines state that they do not approve or disapprove any drugs.

claim: The price of oil rose from $25 a barrel on 5th Jan 2021 to $61.30 a barrel on 9th Feb 2021.
label: Refuted
justification: Although the 2nd amount is not far off the 1st amount is hugely different, so the claim is incorrect.

questions.question: How much was a barrel of oil on 5th January 2021 $53.70? What was the price of a barrel  on Feb 19th 2021 $62.84?    The current price of oil is $62:1.00.

claim: The vast majority of the American people” support Biden’s $1.9 trillion rescue plan, “including a majority of Republicans.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: A SurveyMonkey poll shows that 72% of the general American public approved of the bill while 56% of Republicans disapproved of it.
speaker: Joe Biden

questions.question: SurveyMonkey survey shows that 56% of Republicans disapprove of the $1.9 trillion rescue plan by President Biden. 72% of the general American public approved of the bill. The general American Public is in support of the Rescue Plan by President Joe Biden.

claim: A video viral on social media shows police arresting a group of terrorists from the Pydhonie area of South Mumbai
label: Refuted
justification: From the question and answer pair it seems that the video is actually showing a series and not a real event. Therefore the claim is refuted.

questions.question: Some people are sharing a viral video from South Mumbai Payadhuni Police Station. It is from the shooting of a web series movie. The police station is based in South Mumbai. There is no evidence to suggest that it is a real police operation.

claim: The SARS-CoV-2 virus has not been positively identified.
label: Refuted
justification: Positively identified and confirmed in the answer "Airway epithelial cells from infected patients were used to isolate a novel coronavirus, named the SARS-CoV-2"
speaker: 67podcast

questions.question: Airway epithelial cells from infected patients were used to isolate a novel coronavirus named SARS-CoV-2. Phylogenetic analysis of full-length genome sequences obtained from infected people revealed that SARS CoV 2 is similar to severe acute respiratory syndrome coronaviruses (SARS) and uses the same cell entry receptor, angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2).

claim: We have nine years left to avert the climate crisis.
label: Refuted
justification: From the QA it seems that the number of nine years is only an estimate. Therefore the claim is refuted
speaker: John F. Kerry

questions.question: The world might already be at 1.2°C and warming at 0.25°C per decade. That would get us to 1.5°C by 2030, 12 years from 2018. An additional quarter of a degree of warming is not going to feel like Armageddon to the vast majority.

claim: Cambodia's sub-decree for Internet control, National Internet Gateway, was based on and similar to the Internet controls used in other countries such as UK and USA.
label: Refuted
justification: The answers and source show that the internet control is similar to China not the UK or USA so the claim is refuted.
speaker: Phay Siphan, Cambodian government spokesman.

questions.question: Cambodia's new internet control system will funnel all international internet connections through a single entry point. Comparisons have been drawn to China's "Great Firewall" which deploys a vast and sophisticated surveillance state to scrub the internet of dissent. The internet structure used in Cambodia is being correctly classified.

claim: Nita Ambani, chairperson and founder of the Reliance Foundation, is going to donate 3 gold crowns which are going to be mounted on the heads of the idols in Ayodhya's Ram Temple.
label: Refuted
justification: This has been refuted oficially.
speaker: Pinkee Singh #3h

questions.question: Nita Ambani has not offered to donate 3 Gold Crowns to be mounted on the heads of the idols in Ayodhya's Ram Temple. Reliance Media Department denies that they are doing such a thing. The fact checking website contacted them about it.

claim: 5G Towers Cause COVID-19.
label: Refuted
justification: The answers and sources show that the claim is incorrect so the claim is refuted.
speaker: 67podcast

questions.question: WHO and IARC have classified all radio frequency radiation as "possibly carcinogenic". Covid 19 is not a cancer. Coronaviruses are viruses that cause illness in humans and animals. 5G towers are the newest generation of cell towers. They respond to a mobile phone signal by assigning it an available RF channel.

claim: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo "issued a legal blanket immunity, and snuck that into our budget, giving these facilities [nursing homes] essentially a license to kill, a get-out-of-jail free card.”
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: The New York Governor did make provision for immunity but it isn't just a straightforward as saying a license to kill
speaker: Ron Kim

questions.question: Nursing homes and hospitals in New York can be held liable for the care provided to patients not being treated for COVID-19 under a law signed by Gov. Andrew Cuomo on Monday. They will no longer have immunity for care not related to COVIdd-19 provided from now until the state's COVID'-19 emergency declaration ends.

claim: The Covid-19 PCR test is not accurate after a certain point.
label: Refuted
justification: There is nothing in the Q&As to suggest that Covid tests are not accurate after a certain point. As highlighted in Q3, the claim is refuted.
speaker: 67podcast

questions.question: NAATs are the most reliable test for COVID-19. Antigen tests are less reliable than NAATs, especially for people who do not have symptoms. RT-PCR allows calculation of viral load and is associated with transmission risk and disease severity in other viral illnesses.

claim: Donald Trump Jr. Said The Governor Of Texas Was A Democrat
label: Supported
justification: Donald Trump Jr did say “the hypocrisy of those trying to cancel Ted Cruz,” adding that their silence “on their Democrat Governor’s incompetence is telling.”
speaker: Donald Trump Jr.

questions.question: Donald Trump Jr tweeted about the hypocrisy of those trying to cancel Ted Cruz. Donald Trump Jr called out Texas Governor Greg Abbott for his "incompetence". Many Texans pointed out that Abbott is a Republican and was chair of the Republican Governor's Association from 2019 to 2020.

claim: Did President Biden say the US didn't have a COVID-19 vaccine before he took office?
label: Refuted
justification: President Biden made a comment about the United States not having any  Supply Backlog of the vaccine -- NOT About Existence of the covid-19 vaccine, when he took office.
speaker: Joe Biden

questions.question: Joe didn't mean that the US didn't have a COVID-19 vaccine before he took office. He meant that there was a supply shortage of the vaccine and it wasn't about availability but about the backlog. The quote about not having Covid-19 Vaccine Coming into Office was about Supply Backlog, not about Vaccine Existence.

claim: BJP leadersaid that the price of petrol would have been much more expensive if the Modi Government did not rule
label: Refuted
justification: The question and answer pairs show the tweet came from a spoof page.
speaker: Manoj Tiwari

questions.question: The same statement can be found on the page of Dainik Khaskar's Twitter account. The bio reads that it is fake news and parodies are for fun only. Manoj Tiwaris has no tweet for this statement on his social media page.

claim: Monticello power plant just outside of Pittsburg, TX has been closed since 2018 because of renewable energy
label: Supported
justification: Evidence showed it was shut down because of recent advances in energy generation from cheap natural gases

questions.question: Monticello power plant in Texas was closed in 2018 due to low electricity prices. It is the latest coal-powered plant to be shut down as a result of cheap natural gas and advances in solar and wind energy technology continue to depress wholesale power prices. The company behind the plant says it's purely economic.

claim: FEMA is offering hotel rooms to Texas residents affected by power outages and needing shelter.
label: Refuted
justification: FEMA debunked the claim as a scam themselves.
speaker: LaMont James

questions.question: There is a false phone number being shared with a message about FEMA paying for hotels for Texas Disaster Relief. This is a scam. The best information on legitimate sources of help in your area will come from local officials and @TDEM.  FEMA's official Twitter page confirmed the phone number posted on the claim was incorrect.

claim: Muslims in Kerala, India have demanded a ban on chanting Omkaram (a sacred sound and a spiritual symbol in the Hindu religion) on February 2021.
label: Refuted
justification: The answer shows that the claim is incorrect so the claim is refuted.

questions.question: Two teachers of a government primary school in Abhikode, Kerala were sent on leave after parents complained about their children getting religious pamphlets with religious symbols. There are no reports of Muslims in Kerala demanding a ban on chanting Om. The post is misleading.

claim: In 2020, there was a 64% drop in cases of GBVF compared to the same period in 2019
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: From the Q&As it seems that the statistics are not published separately for the GBVF, so there is no way of knowing if there was a drop in cases.

questions.question: The police’s latest crime statistics covered the period up to 31st March 2020. The next release document for crime statistics also included data from April to June 2021. GBVF case statistics are not isolated from other crime statistics in a way that easily allows them to be measured separately.

claim: Newly released flight logs put Biden on Jeffrey Epstein’s ‘Lolita Express’ jet.
label: Refuted
justification: Satire source
speaker: Harry Helmet

questions.question: America's Last Line of Defense is a network of satire websites with visible satire disclaimers. It was published by America's Last line of defense.  It's a website with visible satiric disclaimers on its content. The claim has been made there.

claim: Not a single megawatt of new generation has been procured in over five years from the Renewable Energy Independent Power Producer Procurement Programme in South Africa
label: Supported
justification: The last question and answer shows that there was no energy produced in the former five years of the claim so it is supported.

questions.question: The Renewable Energy Independent Power Producer Procurement Programme (REIPPP) was set up in 2010 to increase the country’s renewable energy supply and help achieve broader national development goals, such as job creation. The REIPPP has procured 6,422 megawatts of electricity from 112 IPPs since 2020. No energy has been procured since the last bid window in 2015. Future bid windows are on hold while a new Integrated Resource Plan is implemented.

claim: Today we have more dysfunctional municipalities than functional municipalities
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: latest data from 2018 suggest that there are more dysfunctional municipalities than functional municipalities. Functional municipalities being at only 7 %.  However there is no data for 2021 when the claim was made.

questions.question: 87 out of 257 municipalities in South Africa were declared dysfunctional or in financial distress in 2018. Only 7 per cent were considered to be well-functioning. COGTA is exploring the acquisition of ICT capability and an early warning system dashboard. This will improve their effectiveness in supporting early interventions.

claim: The Covid-19 vaccines in use in the UK are still in the experimental phase.
label: Refuted
justification: Since it is clearly stated in the last question and answer pair that the vaccines have been approved for use, the claim is refuted

questions.question: All three of the vaccines used in the UK in 2021 have been approved for use. None of them is still in the experimental phase.    Moderna, Pfizer and AstraZeneca are the vaccines that will be used in Britain in 2021.

claim: Energy experts and State House Dems, among others, were warning of the Texas power blackout for years.
label: Supported
justification: Supported by the report on the 2011 incident, and Mr Cauley's letter and the chron.com article from 2013.
speaker: Beto O'Rourke

questions.question: There was a power outage in Texas before 2021. In 2011, the PUCT issued recommendations aimed at improving winterization on the part of the generators. The recommendations were not mandatory and implementation lapsed over time. Many generators that experienced outages in 1989 failed again in 2011. Expert Gerry Cauley raised alarms after the outage in 2011 as he believes more preparation for cold weather could have prevented it.

claim: Covid19 vaccines in the UK  contain sorbitol.
label: Refuted
justification: Lists of ingredients on government website does not list sorbitol in any vaccine.

questions.question: Sorbol is a polyol (sugar alcohol) that is used as a sweetening agent in various food products. It has 60% of the sweetness of sucrose with one-third fewer calories. UK Covid-19 vaccines do not contain sorbitol.

claim: Covid19 vaccines in the UK  contain phenoxyethanol.
label: Refuted
justification: It seems from the 2nd-4th QAs that neither of these vaccines contain phenoxyethanol, therefore the claim is refuted

questions.question: Phenoxyethanol is used as a preservative in cosmetic products for decades. Pfizer/BioNTech's BNT162b2 vaccine contains 6 doses of 0.3 mL with 30 micrograms of mRNA each. AstraZeneca's PEG2000-DMG vaccine contains one dose of 1.5 L of ChAdOx1-S* recombinant, replication-deficient chimpanzee adenovirus vector encoding the SARS CoV 2 Spike glycoprotein. Moderna's product contains genetically modified organisms (GMOs).

claim: Joe Biden not the official US president because soldiers at a wreath ceremony did not wear their decorations on their coats and the 21-gun salute was moved to Arlington Cemetery on January 20, 2021
label: Refuted
justification: The Soldiers actions do not relate to if someone is president.
speaker: BitChute

questions.question: The 20th Amendment of the US Constitution states that a new president's term officially begins on January 20th. There is no reference in the amendment to decorations on soldiers’ coats at a ceremony or to 21-gun salutes. The terms of the President and Vice President end on the 20th day of January, and the terms of Senators and Representatives at noon on the 3rd of January.

claim: Covid19 vaccines in the UK contain Formaldehyde
label: Refuted
justification: The questions cover the main covid vaccines and none contain formaldehyde

questions.question: Pfizer's and AstraZeneca's vaccines do not contain formaldehyde. Moderna's is not listed as an ingredient in the list of vaccine ingredients. It's not listed on the manufacturer's website either. The amount of formaldehyde found in the Moderna vaccine does not exceed 0.5%.

claim: 50% of grade 1 pupils will never write a matric examination
label: Refuted
justification: 53.97% wrote the exam

questions.question: There were 1,071,905 grade 1 students in South Africa in 2009. In 2020 there will be 578,468 grade 1s who wrote the school-leaving exams. 53.97% of them went on to do the matric examination.

claim: Highland Park and Preston Hollow, rich areas of Dallas, US have not experienced power outages like other parts of the city.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: Though rich areas seem to be suffering less from outages, there still exist outages in these areas.
speaker: Steven Monacelli

questions.question: There are still power outages in Preston Hollow and Highland Park during the Texas power outage. There are 2,781 outages for 15,791 customers in Preston Hill's main zip code 75220. Highland Park has a much lower rate of outages with only 2% of its residents affected.

claim: Covid19 vaccines in the UK  contain sodium phosphate.
label: Refuted
justification: It's not in the published ingredients of the three available vaccines.

questions.question: Sodium phosphate is used to keep the pH balance while vaccines are being manufactured. Pfizer/BioNTech vaccine does not contain sodium phosphate. It's not on the ingredient list published. Moderna vaccine contains no sodium phosphate, according to the company's website.

claim: The COVID-19 vaccines in the UK contain potassium phosphate.
label: Supported
justification: This claim is justified. According to the QA pair, the COVID-19 vaccine contains "monobasic potassium phosphate" which the claim states. Therefore, this claim is supported.

questions.question: Pfizer/BioNTech's COVID-19 vaccine contains less than 1 mg of potassium per dose and 23 mg of sodium per dose. The active ingredient in the vaccine is mRNA, which works by encoding a portion of the spike protein found on the surface of SARS-CoV-2.

claim: Biden removes 'We the People' petitioning from White House website.
label: Supported
justification: The second Q&A states that the petition page did actually disappear on the day Biden took office and it has not returned since which is in agreement with the claim.
speaker: Ron Paul Inistitute

questions.question: The "We are the people" page on the White House website has been removed twice. The purpose of the page was to allow citizens to start petitioning campaigns and when they reached at least 100,000 signatures, it was required to respond. It disappeared after Biden's inauguration.

claim: Covid19 vaccines in the UK contain mercury
label: Refuted
justification: Although the compound mercury has been used as a preservative in some vaccines, it is not listed as an ingredient in the three main COVID-19 vaccines used in the UK. Therefore, the claim is refuted.

questions.question: There is no evidence of harm caused by low doses of thimerosal. It has been phased out of most vaccine use in the UK and US. There is no mercury in Covid vaccines currently in UK or in Pfizer/BioNTech Vaccines.

claim: South Africa was already in a recession for three quarters before the outbreak of the coronavirus.
label: Supported
justification: this is true, by definition south africa was in a recession prior to the coronavirus.

questions.question: South Africa's GDP in January to March 2020 contracted by 1.8%. In the third and fourth quarters of 2019, South Africa’s GDP contracted by -0.8% and -1.4%. The first case of Covid-19 was recorded in South Africa on 5 March 2020.

claim:
Joe Biden stated on February 16, 2021 in remarks at a CNN town hall:
"If we kept (the minimum wage) indexed to inflation, people would be making $20 an hour right now.”
label: Refuted
justification: The Q&A show this claim is not true, the minimum wage would be much lower than this figure. So its refuted.
speaker: Joe Biden

questions.question: Inflation-adjusted value for the minimum wage of $7.25 in 2009 is $8.98 in 2021 according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics' CPI calculator. The minimum wage would be worth about $8:1, as calculated by the calculator.

claim: 21 year old climate activist Disha Ravi from Bangalore is a single mother.
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: There is no evidence to support the claim in QAs. Questions could be: does she have a facebook page? any photographs of her, indicate she has a child?

questions.question: Does Disha Ravi have children? Not known. No answer could be found.  “No answer” can be found as no information was available.  “It's not known”.    "It's unknown".

claim: Rep.Jim Jordan’s (R-Ohio) claims that Pelosi denied a request for National Guard troops prior to January 6th.
label: Refuted
justification: Speaker was not involved in the decision.
speaker: US Rep. Jim Jordan (R-Ohio)

questions.question: Sergeant at Arms Paul Irving made a request for National Guard prior to the attack. Nancy Pelosi was aware of the request. Irving did not consult congressional leadership. He advised them as he would do with many security protocols, but he didn't wait for their input.

claim: Transgender rights activists from Gender Justice LA demanded a gender dysphoria study carried out by the University of California at Los Angeles’s Semel Institute for Neuroscience and Human Behavior be shut down.
label: Refuted
justification: The answers and source show that they do not ask for the study to be closed down so the claim is refuted.
speaker: Chad Felix Greene

questions.question: There is a need for research within the transgender, gender variant and intersex community. Unethical research practices create distrust among TGI community members and affect their willingness to participate in research. LGBTQ network activists did not ask for the study to be shut down.

claim: California wants signature verification for Gavin Newsom’s recall but they didn’t require it for mail-in ballots..
label: Refuted
justification: The answer clearly states that both mail in and recall ballots so the claim is refuted.
speaker: Larry Lugnut

questions.question: California requires signature verification for both mail-in ballots and recall petitions. The state did not forgo the requirement for the November election. It is required for both elections. For the past two elections, it has not been required for this election but it will be in November.

claim: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention withheld data that showed a federal vaccine reaction-reporting database -- VAERS -- was under-reporting the number of people who have died after receiving a COVID-19 vaccine
label: Refuted
justification: Vaers does not act in the way the claim suggests.

questions.question: VAERS reports cannot be used to determine if a vaccine caused or contributed to an adverse event or illness. There were no deaths from the Covid 19 vaccine reported by VERS.    “The number of people who died from this vaccine is not included in the report.

claim: US Vice president Kamala Harris said So here's a message to the soldier boys. Get a job
label: Refuted
justification: The answer is a direct tie in to the claim. Therefore, it is quite biased. But from the answer it seems that the label is refuted, as the vice president did not actually say the quote.
speaker: Doug Johnson

questions.question: The quote comes from a satire site article. Kamala Harris is not quoted as saying "So here's a message to the soldier boys. Get a job".  She is talking about US Vice President KamalaHarris.    i'l like it.

claim: The Spanish flu was caused by radio waves.
label: Refuted
justification: Caused by an H1N1 virus which is not a form of radio wave.
speaker: Ali Zeck

questions.question: Spanish flu was caused by an H1N1 virus with genes of avian origin. It was transmitted by people with the same name as the bird flu virus. The virus has no genetic code for humans. it's a virus with human and avian genes.

claim: Leaked visitor logs show Democratic California Rep. Adam Schiff visited deceased convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein’s private island 78 times.
label: Refuted
justification: The answer and source show that the claim appeared on a satirical website so therefore the claim is refuted.
speaker: Linda Turcotte

questions.question: The image originates from Satire News Website. It's a satire news website.  It's an image of a man with a funny hat. The image was created by SatireNews.com.   . For more information, visit the website here.

claim: India banned the Pfizer COVID-19 Vaccine.
label: Refuted
justification: Even though India turned down Pfizers application, they can still reapply, so they haven't actually banned Pfizer. So the claim is refuted.
speaker: Alex Jones

questions.question: India's expert panel on Covid-19 drugs and vaccines has rejected Pfizer's application for emergency use authorisation for its vaccine candidate. The company was allowed to meet up with the required regulations and reapply again. It does not mean a ban for Pfizer.

claim: The United Kingdom will be one of the first countries to end the COVID-19 epidemic, and due to herd immunity. The most infectious strain of the virus has already immunized over 60% of the population.
label: Refuted
justification: It seems the UK is not doing well in terms of covid, therefore the claim is refuted
speaker: Osmar Terra

questions.question: The coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic has led to declines in gross domestic product in advanced economies in 2020. England had the highest number of COVID- 19 deaths, compared to US and EU. The UK has experienced the largest contraction in volume GDP amongst the G7 countries.

claim: Former US presidents Barack Obama and George W. Bush are cousins.
label: Supported
justification: Good claim
speaker: Ali Zeck

questions.question: Both Obama and Bush are 11th cousins from Samuel Hinckley, who lived in Massachusetts in the 17th century. He is the name of the person of whom both Presidents Obama and George W Bush are descendants.  Hinckley died in 1838.

claim: Polio is caused by the insecticide commonly known as DDT.
label: Refuted
justification: Evidence finds that polio is caused by the poliovirus. It is transmitted through contact with an infected person, primarily through the fecal-oral route. Therefore, it is not caused by the insecticide commonly known as DDT. Hence, the claim is refuted.
speaker: Ali Zeck

questions.question: Polio is an infectious disease caused by the poliovirus. It is transmitted through contact with an infected person. The virus enters the body through the mouth or respiratory system and multiplies in the throat and intestines. It can travel through the blood and may enter the central nervous system (spinal cord and brain). It exits the body via the feces.

claim: AIDS was injected, not spread.
label: Refuted
justification: HIV can also be spreaded via  anal or vaginal sex.
speaker: Ali Zeck

questions.question: Most people who get HIV get it through anal or vaginal sex, or sharing needles, syringes, or drug injection equipment. It is transmitted through shared needles and other drug-injectable equipment. The virus can also be passed via blood transfusions.

claim: Norther Ireland has had only 113 Covid-19 Deaths since the start of the pandemic.
label: Refuted
justification: the numbers show that there was 808 deaths registered.
speaker: Dee Brotherston

questions.question: Covid-19 was the underlying cause of death for 808 deaths (89.6%) of the 902 COVID-19-related deaths registered in Northern Ireland between 1st March and 30th September 2020. Covid- 19 was reported in the causal chain of events for 1,263 deaths but there were no pre-existing conditions for 114 deaths.

claim: A viral video is of a woman receiving a message from her dead husband.
label: Refuted
justification: Video is scripted / for entertainment purposes.
speaker: Mapagmahal

questions.question: Rick Lax's videos are intended for entertainment purposes only. The videos on this page include scripted dramas, satires, parodies, magic tricks and other forms of entertainment. Where did a viral video of a woman receiving news of her husband's death originate from?

claim: Chief prosecutor of the International Criminal Court (ICC) Fatou Bensouda, who is leading a probe into the Duterte government’s war on drugs, is being “removed” from office.
label: Refuted
justification: The claim says Fatou Bensouda is being removed from office, However Q&A 5 states they were only given a 9 year term and lost re-election to another candidate so not 'removed from office' as claimed.

questions.question: Fatou Bensouda is the incumbent chief prosecutor of the International Criminal Court (ICC). She was elected by consensus on 12 December 2011 and sworn in on 15 June 2012. Her term ends in June 2021. Karim Khan has been elected to replace her.

claim: US president Biden’s plan will immediately let in 25,000 asylum-seekers who’d been waiting in Mexico as their cases were judged.
label: Refuted
justification: Only 25 of an allowed 300 per day were admitted.
speaker: Ron Johnson

questions.question: 25,000 people are waiting for their asylum claims to be heard in Mexico. On the first day of the program 25 people were admitted. The plan is to admit 300 people a day. They will be transported to a US port of entry and processed.

claim: The Muslim population is growing at the rate of 25% in Kerala, followed by Christians at 20%, but the growth rate of Hindu population is at 3%.
label: Refuted
justification: The answer and source show that the rates in the claim are incorrect so the claim is refuted.
speaker: Balakrishnan Gangadharan

questions.question: The rate of change for Muslims in Kerala is 12.83%, for Christians 1.38% and for Hindu's 2.2%. For Hindus, the rate of changes is less than one per cent each.  For Muslims it was 12.3%, for Christian's it was 1.8%, for Hindu’s it was 2.0%.

claim: In south Africa there were 1.7 million fewer people employed in the third quarter of 2020 than there were in the first quarter. Our unemployment rate stands at a staggering 30.8%
label: Supported
justification:
The decrease in number of people employed in South Africa between Q3 and Q1 = 14.691m - 16.383m = - 1.692m. This rounds up to 1.7m as per the claim. 
The 30.8% unemployment rate for Q3 is stated in the official South African government statistics document.
speaker: President Cyril Ramaphosa

questions.question: There were 16,383,000 people employed in the first quarter of 2020. There were 14,691,000 employed in third quarter 2020. The South African unemployment rate was 30.8% in the third quarter of 2019.   Â£1.5 billion will be spent on education by 2020.

claim: There were 1.7 million fewer people employed in the third quarter of 2020 than there were in the first quarter. South Africa unemployment rate stands at a staggering 30.8%.
label: Supported
justification: Confirmed via the maths.
speaker: Cyril Ramaphosa

questions.question: There were 16,383,000 people employed in South Africa in the first quarter of 2020. There were 14,691,000 employed in the third quarter of 2019. The unemployment rate for the thirdquarter of 2020 was 30.8%.    It is a difference of 1.69 million between the first and third quarters of 2020 compared to previous quarters.

claim: In South Africa, 2.7 million hectares has been transferred through the land restitution process, since 1995.
label: Refuted
justification: 3 483 269,02 hectares had been restituted between 1995 and 2018 and an additional 177 623 hectares in the 2018/2019 financial year
speaker: Cyril Ramaphosa

questions.question: How many hectares of land was restituted between 1995 and 2018? 3 483 269,02 hectares. 177 623 hectares were transferred in financial year 2018/19. No answer could be found for 2019/20 as no information was available.

claim: Through the implementation of the poultry master plan the poultry industry has invested R800 million to upgrade production. South Africa now produces an additional 1 million chickens every week.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: Although there is an additional 1 million chickens a week - it's actually R1.1 billion which has been invested in upgrading production.
speaker: Cyril Ramaphosa

questions.question: The poultry master plan aims to increase state support to local poultry farmers. It was implemented on 7 November 2019. R1.1 billion has been invested in the plan and 1 million additional chickens have been produced since the plan's inception. The number of chickens produced has increased by 1 million.

claim: A total of 18 million South Africans received additional grant payments in 2020.
label: Supported
justification: The evidence shows that there was 18,369,977 social grants paid which supports the claim.
speaker: Cyril Ramaphosa

questions.question: There are 18,369,977 social grants paid to 11,412,303 beneficiaries in July 2020. There are 18 million recipients of social grants in South Africa in 2020. The grant payments will be made to 11 million people in July that year.

claim: In 2020, South Africa became the world’s second-largest exporter of citrus.
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: According to the source linked in the q&a, there were no figures sourced for 2020.  The latest date related to 2018/19, when South Africa was ranked the world’s second-largest exporter of citrus.
speaker: Cyril Ramaphosa

questions.question: South Africa exported 2.1 million tonnes of fresh citrus in the 2018/2019 export season and came 2nd in the 2020 Citrus Industry Statistics for Citrus Growers report. No answer could be found as to where South Africa ranked against other countries in exporting citrus in 2020.

claim: By the end of January 2021, over 430,000 opportunities were supported through the South African Presidential Employment Stimulus.
label: Supported
justification: the answer is very similar to the claim
speaker: Cyril Ramaphosa

questions.question: There are 433,167 people who have been supported through the South African Presidential Employment Stimulus. It is estimated that 1 in 4 people benefit from it.  The stimulus was introduced by President Jacob Zuma in 2008 and has helped to create jobs.

claim: mRNA vaccines increase the risk of death for COVID-19 patients, provoke cytokine storms, and turn patients into genetically modified organisms.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: There are some aspects which are supported such as the vaccine provoking a cytokine storm but the other parts are refuted so the claim has conflicting evidence.
speaker: Dean Miller

questions.question: MRNA vaccines do not increase the risk of system over-reactions for COVID-19 patients. They do not genetically modify organisms within COVID patient's cells. Anaphylactic reactions can occur with any vaccine, but they are rare. There have been six cases of anaphylaxis among 272,001 people who received the COVI-19 vaccine in the United States as of 19 December.

claim: By the end of January 2021, over 430,000 opportunities have already been supported through south africas Presidential Employment Stimulus. A further 180,000 opportunities are currently in the recruitment process.
label: Supported
justification: Fro  the numbers it seems that the claim is supported
speaker: President Cyril Ramaphosa

questions.question: At the end of January 2021 433,167 opportunities were created by the Presidential Employment Stimulus. The figure is based on the number of jobs created since January 1st, 2021. It's not yet known how many opportunities will be created at the year's end.

claim: There were 1.7 million fewer people employed in South Africa in the third quarter of 2020 than there were in the first quarter.
label: Supported
justification: The answers and credible sources show that there were just under 1.7 million fewer people employed so the claim is supported.
speaker: Cyril Ramaphosa

questions.question: In the first quarter of 2020, there were 16,383,000 employed people between the ages of 15 and 64 in South Africa. By the third quarter of 2019, that figure had dropped to 14,691,000. This is a difference of 1.69 million.

claim: Alt News is funded by George Soros through IFCN
label: Refuted
justification: The answers and sources show that George Soros funds one of the foundations that funds IFCN but Alt news is no longer a signatory of the IFCN so the claim is refuted.
speaker: Vinodh Kumar

questions.question: The International Fact-Checking Network (IFCN) is a forum for fact-checkers worldwide hosted by The Poynter Institute for Media Studies. IFCN has received funding from the Arthur M. Blank Family Foundation, the Duke University Reporters' Lab, the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, Google, the National Endowment for Democracy, the Omidyar Network, the Open Society Foundations and the Park Foundation. George Soros transferred billions to Open Society foundations on October 17, 2017.

claim: South Africa’s national power utility, Eskom, is the "largest greenhouse gas emitter" in South Africa.
label: Supported
justification: The answers and sources show that the largest greenhouse emitter is electric and as Eskom provides 95% of the populations electricity the claim is supported.
speaker: President Cyril Ramaphosa

questions.question: In 2017, South Africa produced 555,663.2 gigagrams of greenhouse gas emissions excluding forestry and other land uses (FOLU). Electricity and heat production is the biggest source of major greenhouse gas emission in South Africa. It contributes 38.1% and 33.5% to total emissions excluding and including FOLU.

claim: Digipub Is Linked To Greta Thunberg's Toolkit
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: There is not enough evidence to support the claim. Digipub is not explained and any affliction between Digipub and Greta Thunberg's Toolkit is not explained. Therefore, this claim does not have enough evidence.
speaker: Vinodh Kumar

questions.question: Greta Thunberg's toolkit is a google document with resources to mobilise people against the farm laws in India. There is no evidence linking it to Digipub yet. No answer could be found.  There are no links between Google and Digipubs.

claim: Digipub was set up to receive foreign funds
label: Refuted
justification: The evidence presented  refutes any claim about the claim of its formation to propagate foreign funds.
speaker: Vinodh Kumar

questions.question: Eleven Indian digital news organisations have joined hands to form the umbrella group DIGIPUB News India Foundation. Membership is limited to digital news outlets and journalists currently operating in India. The foundation does not receive any foreign funding. It was created to represent, amplify and evolve best practices to build a robust digital news ecology that is truly world-class, independent and upholds the highest standards of journalism.

claim: In the third quarter of 2020, the economy of South Africa was 6% smaller than it was in the third quarter of 2019.
label: Supported
justification: A decrease of 6.1% in 3rd quarter GDP (2nd QA) rounds down to a decrease of 6% as per the claim.
speaker: Cyril Ramaphosa

questions.question: South Africa's real GDP was R3.16 trillion in the 3rd quarter of 2019. By the third quarter of 2020 it had dropped to R2.96 trillion, a decrease of 6.1%.  The growth rate has been slower than previous quarters.

claim: 2.7 million hectares has been transferred through the land restitution process.
label: Refuted
justification: I have said refuted because while 2.7million has been given back the end total is way over what was claimed at 3.7million hectares.
speaker: Cyril Ramaphosa

questions.question: The Restitution of Land Rights Act 22 of 1994 was enacted after South Africa’s independence. 3,483,269 hectares of land was restituted between 1995 and 2018. In 2018/19 177,623 hectares were handed back to beneficiaries. In 2019/20 52,955 hectares were transferred.

claim: JOE BIDEN ANNOUNCES HE WILL DEFUND THE DEPARTMENT OF VETERANS AFFAIRS
label: Refuted
justification: Although the 1st and 2nd Q&A pair do not address the claim directly, they does point out that the site which published the claim story is a satire site for 'junk news'

questions.question: America's Last Line of Defence is a subsidiary of the America's parody, satire and tomfoolery network. Snopes called it before they lost their war on satire: Junk News.  “Junk News” is Snopes' previous name for this website.

claim: There were 1.7 million fewer people employed in the third quarter of 2020 than there were in the first quarter. Our unemployment rate stands at a staggering 30.8%.
label: Supported
justification:
16,383,000,-14,691,000 = 1,692,000

so rounded up the maths match.

questions.question: There were 16,383,000 people in employment in the first quarter of 2020. There were 14,691,000 employed in the third quarter of that year. It is estimated that there will be 16,700,000 more people in work by the end of 2020s.

claim: By the end of January 2021, over 430,000 opportunities have already been supported through the [Presidential Employment Stimulus]. A further 180,000 opportunities are currently in the recruitment process.”
label: Supported
justification: The Presidency's annual report supports both figures in the claim.
speaker: Cyril Ramaphosa

questions.question: The Presidential Employment Stimulus has created 433,167 opportunities since 2020. A further 186,879 opportunities are currently recruiting or accepting applications. Ramaphosa notes that the stimulus is aimed at job creation through public employment and on job retention in vulnerable sectors. It also supports direct support to livelihood strategies and high-impact employment enablers.

claim: In South Africa 2.7 million hectares of land have been transferred through the land restitution process
label: Refuted
justification: Actual figure is 3,483,269 hectares.
speaker: President Cyril Ramaphosa

questions.question: 3,483,269 hectares of land was restituted between 1995 and 2018.  According to the Department of Agriculture, rural development and land reform, this amount of land has been recovered. It is 3,483 million hectares.   Â

claim: In the third quarter of 2020, the (South Africa) economy was 6% smaller than it was in the third quarter of 2019
label: Supported
justification: Correct
speaker: Cyril Ramaphosa

questions.question: The South Africa GDP in the third quarter of 2020 is R2,962,669,000,000. In the third quarters of 2019 it's R3,155,290,000 and 6.1% decrease. The percentage decrease of those amounts is 1%.

claim: “In 2020, [South Africa] became the world’s second-largest exporter of citrus.
label: Supported
justification: This claim is supported. According to the QA pair, South Africa exported 1.84 billion USD of citrus in 2020, ranking them 2nd in the world. Therefore, this claim is supported.
speaker: Cyril Ramaphosa

questions.question: In 2020, the top exporters of citrus were Spain ($4.16B), South Africa ($1.84B), China ($1.33B), Turkey ($985M), and Egypt ($946M). The top importers of Citrus were Germany $1.62B, France (£1.31B), United States (£1.,28B), Netherlands (£1,09B), and Russia (£1,.05B). South Africa ranked 2nd in Citrus exports for 2020 with $1;84B.

claim: “Through the implementation of the poultry master plan the industry has invested R800 million to upgrade production. South Africa now produces an additional 1 million chickens every week.”
label: Supported
justification: The second answer shows that SA produces an additional 1 million chickens every week
speaker: Cyril Ramaphosa

questions.question: R1.1 billion has been invested in upgrading and improving the efficiency of facilities at South African poultry plants. One million more chickens are being produced every week than was stated in the previous claim. R1,1 million is being invested into upgrading production facilities.

claim: The United States went from the highest exports in oil and natural gas to the lowest in one week.
label: Refuted
justification: It is clear from the 1st and last QA that the claim is refuted
speaker: Troy Long

questions.question: US exports of crude oil and petroleum products rose from 7.65 million barrels per day to 8.2 million barrels a day in the week ending on January 29, 2021. US ranked 6th in the global ranking of exporters of crude Oil and Natural Gas.

claim: To date government has redistributed over 5 million hectares of land in South Africa.
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: there isn't enough evidence after 2018 to see how many hectares of land have been redistributed beyond the 4.8 million already distributed up until 2018
speaker: Cyril Ramaphosa

questions.question: How many hectares have been distributed between 1994 and 2018? 4,847.596 hectares. How much South African farm land was redistributed by 2020? No answer could be found. As yet, the figure has not reached 5 million hectares. The answer is still unknown.

claim: South Africa’s national power utility, Eskom,  is the largest greenhouse gas emitter in South Africa.
label: Supported
justification: Eskom is easily SA's largest energy supplier with 90% of the market. With electricity and heating contributing 38% of emissions and the next largest contributor being 12.15% from road transport I think the claim is supported.
speaker: Cyril Ramaphosa

questions.question: Eskom produces 90% of electricity in South Africa's provinces. Road transport is the second biggest contributor of greenhouse gas emissions, followed by manufacturing industries and construction at 5.54%. Electricity and heat production still remains the key category, contributing 38.1% and 33.5% to total emissions.

claim: Luz Legaspi's immune thrombocytopenia (ITP) was caused by a Moderna COVID-19 vaccination she received the previous day.
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: Answers pairs give a clear indication that more evidence is needed to support or refute the obvious claim.
