questions.question: Luz Legaspi, 72, from Filipina, has a case of immune thrombocytopenia (ITP) in New York. Experts say it's too soon to know if the ITP cases were caused by the Moderna Covid-19 vaccination or were coincidental.

claim: The US Presidential Transition Enhancement Act allows former US President Donald Trump to remain in control of the U.S. military for 60 days after the end of his term.
label: Refuted
justification: The transfer of power is the same as the day of inauguration.
speaker: Theresa M Zanon

questions.question: The terms of the President and Vice President end at noon on the 20th of January. The new president takes control of the military once inaugurated. He will be Commander in Chief of the Army and Navy, and Militia of several states. It is his duty to take care of the actual service of the United States.

claim: COVID-19 virus gets neutralized by human breast milk
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: There is not enough evidence to support or refute the claim. The last answer and source say more studies need to be done so I could not fully support or refute the claim.
speaker: Karleen Gribble

questions.question: SARS-CoV-2 RNA was not detected in milk produced by women with mild-to-moderate COVID-19. Milk contains anti- SARS- CoV- 2 antibodies and their concentrations are correlated with milk’s ability to effectively neutralize infectivity. Breast milk is the best source of nutrition for infants whose mothers have confirmed or suspected coronavirus infection. The WHO recommends washing the breast before feeding if a mother has just coughed over her exposed breast.

claim: The actual transfer of power between the current and next US president happens in March, not on January 20.
label: Refuted
justification:
Recent news events around the US elections and the transition between a present and former president have made many aware of what date a president is sworn in,
Both Q&A pairs also give a simple answer to the claim which refutes it.
speaker: Theresa M Zanon

questions.question: The terms of the President and Vice President end at noon on the 20th day of January. The terms of Senators and Representatives end at 12:00 on the 3rd day of that month. Joe Biden will be sworn into office on January 20, 2021.

claim: Marijuana's youth impact sees psychotic disorders such as psychosis and schizophrenia increase by three folds.
label: Supported
justification: Both answers linked from the only Question set show that psychotic disorders were linked to the use of Marijuana's by youths
speaker: Chris Kapenga

questions.question: Cannabis use at age 18 increases the risk of schizophrenia six times. A tenth of cannabis users by age 15 developed schizophreniform disorder by age 26 compared with 3% of the remaining cohort.  A Swedish cohort study found that heavy cannabis use at ages 18 increased the risk for schizophrenia by 6 times.

claim: Marijuana can increase the risk of schizophrenia and psychotic disorders.
label: Supported
justification: Marijuana or cannabis has been linked to psychosis and schizophrenia, with those with a predisposition towards mental illness.
speaker: Chris Kapenga

questions.question: Using cannabis can increase the risk of developing psychotic illnesses, including schizophrenia. Not everyone who uses cannabis will develop psychosis or schizophrenia. If someone in your family has a mental illness, you are at higher risk of getting these illnesses when you use cannabis.

claim: A hand recount of 2020 general election results in Windham, New Hampshire, US is proof of election fraud by Dominion Voting Machines.
label: Refuted
justification: Refuted by findings of an enquiry into the allegation.
speaker: Jim Hoft

questions.question: New Hampshire's attorneys general office looked into the claim. The Commission finds there was no evidence on which to question the outcome of the recount and there were no votes not counted. There was a discrepancy in the hand count, but it was not down to fraud.

claim: NATO members instructed the opposition to the current Kremlin government - the imprisoned Russian dissident Alexey Navalny and his associates - to change tactics on how they protest during a meeting in Brussels on February 8 2021.
label: Refuted
justification: The announcement to change tactics was made on February, 5th before the meeting
speaker: Maria Zakharova Russian Foreign Ministry spokesperson

questions.question: Navalny’s regional network coordinator Leonid Volkov and his Anti-Corruption Foundation executive director Vladimir Ashurkov joined a video call on the EU’'s Russia policy organised by Poland on Monday. Diplomats from Britain, the US, Canada and Ukraine were reportedly involved in the two-hour discussions. Volkov said he discussed imposing restrictions on Russian oligarchs linked to President Vladimir Putin and not on the national economy. On February 5, Leonid Vovk announced that Navalny's team was suspending further protests and refocusing on campaign efforts ahead of the State Duma elections this fall.

claim: List Of Informal COVID-19 Vaccine Reaction Reports is  Evidence that Deaths Were Caused By Vaccines
label: Refuted
justification: Evidence finds that there is a disclaimer added to the VAERS COVID-19 vaccine report that states, "The reports may contain information that is incomplete, inaccurate, coincidental, or unverifiable." Most reports to VAERS are voluntary, which means they are subject to biases. This creates specific limitations on how the data can be used scientifically. "Data from VAERS reports should always be interpreted with these limitations in mind." Evidence also finds that healthcare providers are strongly encouraged to report to VAERS any adverse event that happens following the administration of a vaccine licensed in the United States, whether or not the vaccine is clearly to blame. Hence, the claim is refuted.
speaker: Learn the Risk

questions.question: VAERS accepts reports of adverse events and reactions that occur following vaccination. Most reports to VAERS are voluntary, which means they are subject to biases. Data from VAERS reports should always be interpreted with these limitations in mind. Healthcare providers are strongly encouraged to report to the VAERS.

claim: US Vice President Kamala Harris said, “If he’s white, he’s going to be racist.”
label: Refuted
justification: No evidence shows that Kamala has ever said something like this.
speaker: Michael Walker

questions.question: The White House website does not have a search for the quote from Harris' speeches. Jeremy Bird said it is similar to the quote 'He's still going to be racist if it's a white nominee' on the same topic. The quotes are not found on the White House site.

claim: There is a direct connection between discriminatory policies within the USDA and the enormous land loss we have seen among Black farmers over the past century.
label: Supported
justification: It seems from the Q&As that there is a connection and there is plenty of evidence to show this. The claim is supported.
speaker: Cory Booker

questions.question: There's been a sharp decline in the number of Black farmers since 1920. In 2017, there were slightly more than 45,500 Black farmers compared to 925,700 in 1920. Black-operated farms accounted for 4.7 million acres of farmland in 2017, or 0.5% of the U.S. total. There are discriminatory USDA policies leading to land loss among Black farmers.

claim: 84,000 “secret manuscripts” were discovered in the Tibet’s Sakya monastery  library’s wall,
label: Supported
justification: The image in the source below does show proof that there are manuscripts found in the monastery library.

questions.question: A huge library containing as many as 84,000 scrolls was found sealed up in a wall 60 metres long and 10 metres high at Sakya Monastery in Tibet in 2003. The manuscripts were discovered in Tibet’s Sakya monastery library. It is not known if they are still there.

claim: Tweet by pop singer Rihanna is viral on social media claiming that she tweeted actor Kangana Ranaut. The tweet text reads, ''I pay the dancers in my show more than her last five films have earned.''
label: Refuted
justification: There seems to be no truth to this claim.

claim: Former President Donald Trump has an account on Gab Social.
label: Refuted
justification: It sems from the first question and answer that Donald Trump does not actually have a Gab social account, therefore the label is refuted
speaker: Lusso's News

questions.question: Former President Donald Trump does not have a Gab social account. Gab is a social networking website popular among far-right supporters. It rose to infamy following the Tree of Life synagogue massacre in Pittsburgh when it was discovered the shooter had posted anti-Semitic comments on the platform.

claim: A cracker barrel is a barrel that held the whips for sale at the country store.
label: Refuted
justification: Used for transporting crackers (food)
speaker: Domodadonn

questions.question: Adam Exton introduced OTC Oyster Crackers in Trenton, N.J., in 1847. Ezekiel Pullen started baking the Original Trenton Cracker in his kitchen a year later. The cracker barrel was used to ship soda crackers to old country stores.

claim: Secret manuscripts uncovered in a Tibetan monastery detail more than 10,000 years of human history.
label: Refuted
justification: It seems that the book is only 5000 years old from the 2nd QA. Therefore the label is refuted

questions.question: The Epic of Gilgamesh is the oldest known written literature of length. It dates from c. 2150-1400 BC and is less than 5,000 years old. The book is longer than the Bible.    It's about 200 pages long.

claim: Illegals arriving in the USA since President Biden's inauguration get to stay in hotels fee of charge.
label: Refuted
justification: Only legal immigrants are receiving this benefit
speaker: Laura Ingraham

questions.question: Only legal immigrants who have been released by border patrol to enter the USA are getting free hotel accommodation when entering the USA.  For illegal immigrants, it's only those who were released by Border Patrol and allowed to stay in a hotel. For them, it is only after their release.

claim: Nabisco closure of plants in Georgia and New Jersey, US  results in moving jobs to Mexico as a consequence of US President Joe Biden’s election.
label: Refuted
justification: The jobs are not moving to Mexico
speaker: Joe Dillard

questions.question: Nabisco is closing two of its plants in the U.S. by summer’s end. The parent company of Nabisco is Mondelez International. There are no jobs going to Mexico as a result of the plant closures, according to the company.

claim: Joe Biden's Stimulus Checks Reaches Fewer People Than Donald Trump's
label: Supported
justification: Under the latest plan, about 71 percent of Americans would receive the full benefits as opposed to 85 percent who would receive the full benefits if the eligibility criteria remained the same as the two previous stimulus checks, according to the Washington Post's report.
speaker: Bernie Sanders

questions.question: The third round of stimulus checks will be paid out to 71 percent of Americans. The previous round was paid to 85 percent of the population. It is estimated that about 85 percent received the previous stimulus checks under the Trump Administration.  Under the current administration, about 71 percent would receive the full benefits.

claim: The Restaurant Cracker Barrel’s name has racist origins and its logo depicts a whip.
label: Refuted
justification: Evidence states that the restaurant Cracker Barrel’s name does not have racist origins or connotations.
speaker: Arkeen Boss Balla Simmons

questions.question: The first Cracker Barrel opened on Highway 109 in Lebanon, Tennessee in 1969. Today there are 645 Cracker Barrells in 44 states. The company name comes from the country stores of the era and barrels full of soda crackers that were for sale in them.

claim: Former President Donald Trump won a majority of lawsuits targeted at election fraud.
label: Refuted
justification: Former President Donald Trump filed 62 lawsuits in state and federal courts seeking to overturn election results in states he lost; however, 61 have failed. Therefore, this claim is refuted as Trump did not win the majority of his lawsuits targeting election fraud.
speaker: Matthew Vadum

questions.question: The president and his allies filed 62 lawsuits in state and federal courts seeking to overturn election results in states the president lost. Of the 62 cases that were filled, 61 have failed. Some cases were dismissed for lack of standing and others based on merits of the voter fraud allegations.

claim: The amount of caesarean sections performed in Nigeria is ‘far below’ the international rate.
label: Supported
justification: Claim is correct but question mark(?) required in the questions.

questions.question: The national prevalence of caesarean section delivery in Nigeria is about 2.1%. This is below the 10% recommended by WHO. According to WHO, caesarian sections up to 10% are associated with decreases in maternal, neonatal and infant mortality.

claim: The national prevalence of caesarean section delivery in Nigeria is about 2.1%.
label: Supported
justification: The claim of 2.1% is true, as evidenced by the answer.

questions.question: The prevalence of caesarean section delivery in Nigeria was 2.1% (95% CI 1.8 to 2.3%) in 2010.    In the whole of Nigeria, caesarian section delivery prevalence is 2.5%.

claim: 'Operation Talon' was cancelled by the Biden Administration.
label: Supported
justification: the claim is true, Biden administration cancelled Operation Talon

questions.question: Biden’s administration recently cancelled Operation Talon, a Trump administration program aimed at removing convicted sex offenders living in the U.S. illegally from the United States. It is unclear if it was cancelled by Biden's administration or by the current one.

claim: The WHO recommends a caesarean section threshold of 10%.
label: Refuted
justification: There is no recommendation from the WHO

questions.question: There is no optimal caesarean section rate for childbirth in 2015. WHO emphasizes that caesarian section is effective in saving maternal and infant lives only when it is used for medically indicated reasons. There is no effect on mortality rates when caesar sections are increased above 10% up to 30%.

claim: South Africa has halted the use of the AstraZeneca vaccine.
label: Supported
justification: yes, south africa has halted the use of astrazeneca due to effectiveness.
speaker: Twitter Users

questions.question: South Africa stopped using the AstraZenaca Vaccine. New analysis suggests it provides minimal protection against mild disease caused by the new coronavirus variant B.1.351 circulating in South Africa. The new variant was first identified in mid-November 2020.

claim:
US President Joe Biden  
 said "buy a man eat fish, He day, Teach fish man, to a lifetime".
label: Refuted
justification: No evidence in QA pairs that Biden is quoted as saying this..

questions.question: President Joe Biden has lived with a speech impediment since childhood. There is no record of him saying "Buy a man eat fish, he day, teach fish man to a lifetime" on Factba.se. The quote comes from the well-known saying "Give a man a fish and feed him for a day. Teach a man to eat fish for a lifetime".

claim: World Health Organisation disqualifies Nigeria from receiving Covid-19 vaccines.
label: Refuted
justification: The source states that World Health Organisation WHO has not disqualified any country in Africa from accessing COVID-19 vaccines through the COVAX facility, but rather is supporting all countries to access vaccines as quickly as possible.
speaker: Peoples Democratic Party (Nigeria)

questions.question: WHO did not disqualify Nigeria from Covid Vaccines. WHO supports all African countries to access vaccines as quickly as possible. The WHO has not disqualified any country in Africa from accessing COVID-19 vaccines through the COVAX facility. It is supporting all African nations to access them.

claim: Covid-19 has a survival rate of 99.8%.
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: The survival rate of 99.8% of Covid-19 is not stated in the Q&A pair.
speaker: Joe Cusimano

questions.question: CVID-19 has a mortality per case ratio of between 0.5 and 3.4%. It is difficult to calculate the number of deaths from COVIID-19 at the time of the claim. Countries are difficult to compare as they use different case definitions and testing strategies or counting cases differently.

claim: Wyoming House bill will charge drivers for each mile traveled on its roads.
label: Supported
justification: the charge is based on type of vehicle
speaker: James Nulle

questions.question: The relevant document is House Bill 37 in the Wyoming House of Representatives, HB0037 - Road usage charge. There is assessed a road usage charge upon all Wyoming registered vehicles when traveling on Wyoming's highways. Initial road usage charges are established for each vehicle category.

claim: Ratan Tata’s speech delivered at Symbiosis, Pune.
label: Refuted
justification: Seems that ratan Tata's speech was not actually delivered. Therefore, the claim is refuted

questions.question: Ratan Tata didn't deliver a speech at Symbiosis, Pune. Chetan Bhagat did a speech for the new batch of MBA students at Symbiosi in 2008. The excerpt from his speech is taken from it.    The speech was given at the orientation program for the first time on July 24, 2008.

claim: Mike Lindell said “The (Capitol) rioters were hypnotized by antifa temptresses who hid psychoactive drugs in their vaginas."
label: Refuted
justification: The source of the claim is from a satirical website so it's highly unlikely that the claim has any merit to it and so therefore it appears to be false and is refuted.
speaker: Mike Lindell

questions.question: Mike Lindell is an ardent Trump supporter and CEO of the company 'MyPillow'. Business Standard News is a satirical website designed to parody the 24-hour news cycle. They claim that the Capitol rioters were hypnotized by antifa temptresses who hid psychoactive drugs in their vaginas.

claim: The media in the Philippines did not report on the progress of the Cebu Cordova Link Expressway (CCLEX).
label: Refuted
justification: According to the findings from the QA it appears that there has been reports on the progress of the Cebu Cordova Link Expressway, two sources are directly quoted with dates given so it appears the claim is untrue and refuted.
speaker: Solid Duterte

questions.question: The Cebu-Cordova Link Expressway is 47.32 percent completed as of December 6, 2019 after a year since they started on August 2018. The multibillion-peso toll bridge Ceba-Cordesova Link expressway (CCLEX) is now more than halfway to completion and will be substantially completed by December this year.

claim: President Donald Trump made a phone call to Brad Raffensperger, the Secretary of State for Georgia, telling him that 2,560 felons with incomplete sentences, 66,247 underage children and 2,423 unregistered voters all voted in the 2020 Presidential Election.
label: Refuted
justification: Claim should be better worded - am I fact checking the statistics or the fact that Donald Trump made a phone call? Quotes are all from a fact checking article against the rules of the project. But they do refute all claims
speaker: Mike Lindell

questions.question: There were 74 unregistered voters who voted during the 2020 US Presidential election. The secretary of state’s office identified only 74 people who might fit that category. In many cases, the person might have had their voting rights reinstated after completing a sentence or they might have the same name as a felon. There were no under-18s who voted in 2020.

claim: After twenty-six hours of watching ballot papers run through tabulating machines at the TCF Center in Detroit, I did not see one ballot for Donald Trump in the 2020 Presidential Election.
label: Refuted
justification: It seems from the last QA, that the claims made by this lady are inaccurate, therefore the label is refuted
speaker: Melissa Carone

questions.question: Melissa Carone claims Donald Trump received over 12,600 votes in Detroit in the 2020 Presidential Election. Unofficial election results on Detroit's government website show that this is not true. Melissa Carone's allegations were "simply not credible" after an investigation.

claim: The name of market research company Ipsos MORI translates to ‘they die’ in Latin.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: While it does seem that the words mean death, it wax not intended therefore the label is conflicting evidence
speaker: Pippa Allen-Kinross

questions.question: Ipsos MORI was formed in 2005 by the merger of Ipsos, founded in France in 1975 with its name derived from the Latin phrase ‘ipso facto’ and Market and Opinion Research International (MORI), founded in the UK in 1969.

claim: Twenty Seven U.S States use an overseas server called Clarity Scytl for storing election votes in the U.S Presidential Election and the system is not secure with people being able to get in and change votes.
label: Refuted
justification: The 1st Q&A pair confirms that around 27 US states use the election voting server as claimed, but Q&A 3 refutes the part of the claim saying peole can access the data there, or even that the data would be useful to those who did access it  so refuted
speaker: Russel Ramsland

questions.question: Scytl provided election night reporting to seven states and counties in almost 20 states during 2020 general election. It does not tabulate, tally or count any votes. Clarity Scytl houses unofficial data in servers, stateside. The data can be easily verified by recounting the actual ballots.

claim: “We know mask mandates work. There’s enough evidence out there between counties that have done it and counties that haven’t."
label: Supported
justification: this is true, mask mandates have been confirmed as helpful at preventing covid cases
speaker: Gordon Hintz

questions.question: Mandating face masks in public places is associated with a decline in COVID-19 growth rate. Estimates suggest that more than 200,000 COVID cases were averted by May 22, 2020 as a result of the implementation of these mandates. Gordon Hintz said "We know mask mandates work".

claim: A framed image of a naked man hanging on a wall in the Capitol is in an FBI criminal complaint against alleged rioter Brian McCreary.
label: Supported
justification:
The 1st Q&A pair give proof that the named person in the claim does indeed have an fbi criminal complaint against them as claimed.
The 2nd Q&A pair give details about the same image in the claim being part of their criminal investigation as claimed so supported chosen.
speaker: Seamus Hughes

questions.question: The FBI's criminal complaint against Brian McCreary is saved at https://www.justice.gov/usao-dc/case-multi-defendant/file/1371451/download. There is a framed image of a naked man on page 4.

claim: “More than 200,000 DACA recipients are essential infrastructure workers” including “41,700 DACA recipients in the healthcare industry”
label: Supported
justification:
Although the estimated number of DACA essential workers is a very wide range, 200,000 is inside it.
43,500 is close enough to 41,700. Perhaps the claim excluded the 2000 nursing care home workers?
speaker: Richard Durbin

questions.question: DACA is a program that allows young people brought to the U.S. illegally by their parents to get a temporary reprieve from deportation and permission to work, study and obtain driver's licenses. 43,500 DACA recipients work in the health care and social assistance industries, including 10,300 in hospitals and 2,000 in nursing care facilities. 21,100 operate in transportation and warehousing, 6,400 in warehousing and storage, 5,100 in truck transportation, 32,800 are employed in retail trade, 12,400 at supermarkets, 3,200 in pharmacies, and 5,200 at warehouse clubs.

claim: Japan has a train station for scenery viewing only, with no entrance or exit.
label: Supported
justification: The answers and source show there is a station in Japan that is just for scenery so the claim is supported.
speaker: @ThoughtZap

questions.question: The Seiryu Miharashi Eki Station is located along the Nishiki River in Iwakuni. It has no entrance or exit and is only accessible by train. The station's name translates to Clear Stream Viewing Platform, which is a station made solely for the purpose of seeing the scenery.

claim: Face masks, recommended to help curb the spread of COVID-19, cause lung cancer.
label: Refuted
justification: there is no evidence that face masks cause lung cancer or in any contribute to it.
speaker: Courtney Epps

questions.question: WHO, US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and Health Canada agree that masks are generally safe to use and help to curb the spread of COVID-19. Wearing a face mask does not put you at a higher risk of cancer. There is no evidence linking the use of face masks to cancer. The risks associated with wearing masks are low overall, while the benefits are high.

claim: Sir Keir Starmer has never said that he wanted the UK to remain in the European Medicines Agency after Brexit.
label: Refuted
justification: Quoted as saying he did want the UK To remain in 17th Jan 2017
speaker: Keir Starmer

questions.question: Kier Starmer thinks the UK should remain in the European Medicines Agency after Brexit. He worked with Europol and the European Aviation Safety Agency before. The agency ensures that all medicines in the EU market are safe and effective. Kier Starmer wants to find ways to keep them within the EU.

claim: Archaeologists excavated a mummy with a golden tongue in Egypt.
label: Supported
justification: This claim is supported with verification of the source information.  What is not stipulated in the claim is that the golden tongues were placed inside the mouths of the mummies.
speaker: TRT World

questions.question: An Egyptian-Dominican team working at Alexandria's Taposiris Magna temple discovered 16 poorly-preserved mummies with golden tongues in rock-cut tombs popular in the Greek and Roman eras. It is thought the dead were given gold foil amulets shaped like tongues to speak before the god Osiris in the afterlife.

claim: China donated medical supplies, vaccines, and school tablets to the Philippines, while the United States donated bombs during the COVID-19 pandemic.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: The answers show that PPE and hygiene supplies were also donated by the US so the claim is cherry picking the information.
speaker: Integrated Development Studies Institute

questions.question: The United States donated $18 million worth of missiles and weapons to the Philippines during the COVID-19 pandemic. USAID and Procter & Gamble will provide 1,450 hygiene kits for the city. The PPE donation is part of the U.S. government’s nearly Php1 billion investment to support the Philippine's response efforts.

claim: A six-week-old baby boy died in Romania after being immersed three times in a cold water baptism ritual possibly because the parents had overfed the child.
label: Refuted
justification:
The answer to Q2 confirms that the overfeeding mentioned in the claim referred specifically to the baby's mother's milk i.e. the baby was breast fed.
Q&A 5 establish that overfeeding is unlikely when a baby is breast feeding.
Possibly is an option but with the answer at Q1showing the amount of water in the lungs, and the cardio arrest established at Q&A4, this is highly unlikely. Refuted.
speaker: Teodosie Petrescu

questions.question: A six-week-old baby from Suceava died after being immersed in the baptismal font and swallowing a lot of water. The police are investigating the priest who performed the baptism ceremony for manslaughter. Teodosie Petrescu, archbishop of the Romanian Orthodox Church's Archdiocese of Tomis blamed the parents for the baby's death.

claim: US backs India's new farm laws.
label: Refuted
justification: Q&A 3 shows that the US has shown no real backing of India's farm laws as claimed, with only some remarks about farmer protests in general from the US.
speaker: ANI Digital

questions.question: Farm laws were passed in India in 2021. The United States is not in support of India's new farm laws. They have only given general statements about the Indian farmer protests.  They recognize that unhindered access to information, including the internet, is fundamental to the freedom of expression and hallmark of a thriving democracy.

claim: Joe Biden "really did wipe away" student loan debt.
label: Refuted
justification: Fro  the 4th QA is seems that the removal has not happened yet. Therefore the claim is refuted
speaker: Jasmine Grimes

questions.question: Joe Biden won the presidential election in the U.S on November 3, 2020 and will be president in 2021. He does not support wide-scale student loan forgiveness that would forgive all your student loan debt as he did in the claim made by Joe Biden.

claim: The US has returned to the highest gas prices since the Obama administration in many places because of Joe Biden.
label: Refuted
justification: From the 2nd QA it seems , the gas prices are lower during the Biden administration's presence than during Trump's term. Therefore, the claim is refuted
speaker: Travis Tritt

questions.question: The national average gas price reached 2.96 dollars per gallon in the last week of May 2018 under Donald Trump's administration prior to Joe Biden's inauguration. The highest weekly national average reached 2:41 dollars per gallons in the 1st week of February 2021. BP shares tanked by 3.4 percent Tuesday after the energy major revealed that it slumped into an annual net loss of $20.3 billion (16.8 billion euros) on coronavirus fallout.

claim: The Canadian government is putting passengers arriving on international flights into 'forced detention' in a 'COVID camp.
label: Refuted
justification: the claim is clear of a "forced detention" camp, when it's a hotel, which is very different indeed.
speaker: Joe Warmington

questions.question: The Government of Canada wants all air travellers arriving in Canada to reserve a room in a Government-approved 'hotel' for three nights at their own cost and take a COVID-19 molecular test on arrival. More details will be available in the coming days.

claim: Australia suspends, nationwide, their entire vaccine program, because it makes people deathly ill, killed a bunch of people, and they came up positive for HIV.
label: Refuted
justification: The answers show that the claim is false as there have been no serious adverse reactions or deaths and have not given patients HIV so the claim is refuted.
speaker: Alex Jones

questions.question: The COVID-19 vaccination rollout in Australia started on February 21. There have been no deaths associated with the earlier trial involving a CSL-University of Queensland vaccine candidate and there were no serious adverse events or safety concerns reported in the 216 trial participants. The claims that mRNA vaccines alter people’s genes also have no foundation.

claim: A month ago, Australia suspended, nationwide, their entire vaccine program.
label: Refuted
justification: the vaccine rollout was not suspended.
speaker: Alex Jones

questions.question: US conspiracy theorist Alex Jones claims that Australia stopped its vaccination program because the inoculations killed people. Department of Health said it had not been notified of any deaths occurring in clinical trials of COVID-19 vaccines in Australia. The program started on February 21 and Australia remains committed to four vaccine agreements.

claim: mRNA vaccines are a form of gene therapy.
label: Refuted
justification: these vaccines do not alter genes.
speaker: Alex Jones

questions.question: The video makes false claims regarding Australia's vaccination rollout. The program started on February 21 and Australia remains committed to four vaccine agreements. There were no serious adverse events or safety concerns reported in the 216 trial participants. Claims that mRNA vaccines alter people’s genes also have no foundation.

claim: Fact Check: This Isn’t A Cash Giveaway From WHO; Viral Post Is Fake
label: Refuted
justification: The post claiming a cash giveaway from WHO is fake.
speaker: Vishvas News

questions.question: WHO is not giving cashaway to public for completing the survey and sharing to 15 Whatsapp friends. The post claiming this is true is a fake. WHO does not give cash away to people who complete the survey or share it with 15 WhatsApp friends.

claim: Trump awarded a $297 million contact to recruit border patrol agents.
label: Supported
justification: The dates and amounts in the claim are supported in the Q&A pair.
speaker: Tom Cotton

questions.question: The US Government awarded a $297 million contract to a recruitment agency to hire border patrol agents in November 2017. The contract will help with hiring 5,000 U.S. Border Patrol agents, 2,000 CBP officers and 500 Air and Marine Operations agents.

claim: Covid-19 vaccines are killing many people.
label: Refuted
justification: From the question and answer pairs it seems that vaccines are not killing people, therefore the claim is refuted

questions.question: There were 143 reports of death following COVID vaccination in the UK on the date of the claim. The majority of these reports were in elderly people or people with underlying illness. Review of individual reports and patterns of reporting does not suggest the vaccine played a role in the death.

claim: The TATA Group is giving a Valentine's Day gift for participating in a questionnaire.
label: Refuted
justification: The source is from the official Tata Twitter account which says that the claim is not true so the claim is clearly refuted.
speaker: Abubasl Aishammare, @Abubasl_Alshmre

questions.question: The TATA Group is not running a Valentine's Day 2021 promotion to win gifts for doing a questionnaire, as it has tweeted. It advises people to check the source of the claims and links they are following.    TATA tweets that these claims haven't been issued by them.

claim: In 2020, 50% of grade 1 pupils in South Africa will never write a matric examination
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: Although it appears to be 50% of students taking the exam, it is clear that there are other conditions that affect the number of students. So the claim is conflicting evidence/cherry picking.

questions.question: There are 1,071,905 students in grade 1 in South Africa in 2009. In 2020, 578,468 matric students will have written their school-leaving exams after 12 years of study. 53.97% of grade 1 students go on to take final exams 12 years later.

claim: West Virginia in the US injected 108.1% of its COVID-19 vaccine doses.
label: Supported
justification: Pfizer amended the recommendations to state six shots could be taken from a vial instead of five.
speaker: West Virginia Gov. Jim Justice

questions.question: West Virginia injected over 100% of its vaccine doses. Pfizer won an amendment to its Food and Drug Administration authorization on Jan. 6, which allowed for a 20% increase in the amount of vaccine per vial sent. The extra dose amounted to a full additional dose.

claim: Not a single megawatt of new generation has been procured in over five years since 2015 from the Renewable Energy Independent Power Producer Procurement Programme in South Africa
label: Supported
justification: From the Q&A it seems that there has been no generation of megawatts in over 5 years from the programme.

questions.question: Renewable Energy Independent Power Producer Procurement Programme in South Africa was set up in 2010 to increase the country’s renewable energy supply and help achieve broader national development goals, such as job creation. IPPs are meant to generate 39,696 megawatts of energy to be added to the national grid by 2030. IPP's have been invited to bid to provide this energy during certain timeframes. There have been seven competitive bid windows so far, the last one in 2015. Future bid windows are on hold until a new Integrated Resource Plan is implemented.

claim: South Africa was already in a recession for the three financial quarters before the outbreak of coronavirus
label: Supported
justification: The answers show that they had 3 consecutive quarters of negative growth so they were in a recession so the claim is supported

questions.question: Covid-19 was first reported in South Africa on 5 March 2020. The 38-year-old man from KwaZulu-Natal travelled to Italy. South Africa's GDP for 2019 Q3 and Q4 was -.08% and -1.4% respectively.

claim: Myanmar used Dominion Voting Systems in its election before military coup.
label: Refuted
justification: Dominion Voting Systems state that they do not operate in Myanmar.
speaker: Jo Gomez

questions.question: Dominion does not supply voting systems to Myanmar. Dominion voting machines are used in Canada's major party leadership elections and in local and municipal elections across the nation. The military coup in Myanmar did not use Dominion voting systems prior to the coup. A Dominion spokesperson said that they "do not have systems in Myanmar, and never have."

claim: In 2020, there was a 64% drop in cases of gender-based violence and femicide (GBVF) in South Africa compared to the same period in 2019
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: No evidence can be found to compare the different rates of gender based violence in South Africa

questions.question: Hlengiwe Mkhize was referring to the period between 1 April 2019 and 31 March 2020. In February 2020, there were 171,070 contact crimes against women reported in South Africa. GBVF-related cases have increased since implementation of the NSP on GBVs.

claim: Chibok schoolgirls who were abducted seven years ago by Boko Haram have escaped.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: not all of them escaped but few
speaker: Tracy Davenport

questions.question: Some of the Chibok schoolgirls abducted by Boko Haram are said to be returning home. They were taken in 2014 from their dormitory beds in the northeast Nigerian town of Chihobok. Lawyer Emmanuel Ogebe says a parent told him that his daughter and others have escaped their captors. Lawal Zannah's daughter was among those abducted.

claim: If global consumption of beef and sheep continues to rise, eliminating emissions from fossil fuels will not be enough to prevent the earth warming beyond the 2C outer boundary set by the Paris agreement on climate change
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: Evidence is too vague. It shows livestock farming contributes to significant greenhouse gas emissions but does not explicitly explain why increased consumption of beef and sheep would mean eliminating fossil fuel emissions would not be enough to prevent the 2C warming.
speaker: Peter Singer

questions.question: In 2011, methane from livestock accounted for 39 percent of all the greenhouse gas emissions from agriculture. The bulk of the emissions — 55 percent — came from beef cattle. Greenhouse gas emissions have doubled over the past 50 years. Emissions could go up by 30 percent by 2050.

claim: Travel warning issued for Queensland suburbs because of covid
label: Refuted
justification: This claim is not supported

questions.question: Duncan Pegg, the Labor Member of Parliament said that the media release about a travel warning issued by Queensland officials is fake. He claims it's not the official statement from the Queensland government. It's just a press release with a link to a website.

claim: Denzel Washington said, ''I support police over BLM, don't put them down!''
label: Refuted
justification: Mr Washington's words were taken out of context as it is evident from the 1st answer. Therefore the label is refuted
speaker: Popular Superstars

questions.question: Denzel Washington has spoken on the Black Lives Matter movement at the premiere of his new film, "Fences" in January 2021. He doesn't support police over BLM, but he supports their right to express themselves. In America, people have the right to protest.

claim: Merck has pulled its COVID-19 vaccine saying it hurt people.
label: Refuted
justification: This claim is refuted. According to the QA pairs, Merck did discontinue their COVID-19 vaccination but not because it "hurt people" as the claim states. They pulled out as they found other vaccines to be more effective against COVID-19. Therefore, the claim is refuted.
speaker: Alex Jones

questions.question: Merck has pulled their SARS-CoV-2/COVID-19 vaccine from production. The company will focus on advancing two therapeutic candidates, MK-4482 and MK-7110. They halted the vaccine program because the immune response to candidates is inferior to existing shots.

claim: Senior Citizens Above 75 Years Of Age Are Exempted From Paying Income Tax in India.
label: Refuted
justification: They pay income tax .
speaker: Amitaabh Srivastava

questions.question: 75-year-olds and older pay income tax in India. There is a proposal that they don't need to file income tax returns, and the paying bank will deduct the necessary tax on their income. The proposal has not been approved yet though.

claim: Merck says it is ending its COVID-19 vaccine programme as it does not work.
label: Refuted
justification: Has not stopped vaccinations , has stopped 2 vaccine developments because they were inferior to alternates but still working on other covid treatments.
speaker: Alex Jones

questions.question: Merck has stopped working on two potential Covid-19 vaccines. Australia started vaccinating people in October of this year. Merck claims that V590 and V591 were generally well tolerated, but the immune responses were inferior to those seen following natural infection.

claim: In January 2021 Australia suspended nationwide their entire COVID-19 vaccine programme because it made people ill, killed people and they came up positive for HIV.
label: Refuted
justification: The programme hadn't even started at that time
speaker: Alex Jones

questions.question: The COVID-19 vaccination programme was supposed to start in January 2021. Today, the government is releasing details of the Government’s Vaccine and Treatment Strategy. The aim is to offer all Australians the opportunity to be vaccinated by October of this year, commencing in just a few weeks' time. First vaccinations will be ready for shipping and distribution from late February. However, the final commencement date will depend on developments overseas.

claim: French President Emmanuel Macron has suspended the COVID-19 vaccine programme in France.
label: Refuted
justification: Denied in QA pairs.
speaker: Alex Jones

questions.question: The COVID-19 vaccine programme has not been suspended in France. Priority is given to the people most vulnerable to the virus and most likely to develop serious forms of the disease. The AstraZeneca vaccine will be available in France from February 6. It will be reserved for healthcare personnel, then for people aged 50 to 65 with comorbidities and all 50-65 year olds.

claim: Rahul Gandhi thinks that the Indian Army can be replaced by laborer's and farmers.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: The answer suggests that Rahul Gandhi implied but didn't directly say that the Indian Army could be replaced by laborers and farmers.
speaker: Dheeshma Puzhakkal

questions.question: Rahul Gandhi believes that if India's farmers and labourer's were strong and protected, then China would not dare to come inside India. He also thinks that India's army can be replaced with Labourer's and farmers. If they were strong, protected and given opportunity, China wouldn't dare to enter India.

claim: Due to COVID-19's second wave, the federal government is giving out a weekly grant of 10,500 naira to support Nigerians.
label: Refuted
justification: There is no evidence shows that the federal government is giving out a weekly grant due to the COVID-19's second wave.

questions.question: The Nigerian federal government is not giving out a weekly grant of 10,500 naira to support Nigerians. There were pop-up advertisements for dating sites and other services on the website that made this claim. The website is not safe as there is no S following "HTTP" and no padlock symbol at the URL.

claim: Kamala Harris is not the first person-of-colour to serve as Vice President
label: Supported
justification: The first was actually Charles Curtis, who took office nearly a century ago.

questions.question: Charles Curtis was the first person of color to serve as Vice-President. He was a member of the Kaw Nation and went on to be a U.S. Senator and then, in 1929, he became the first African-American vice-president.

claim: Coronavirus breathalyser tests can provide a Covid-19 result within 10 seconds at a 99.9 percent accuracy rate.
label: Refuted
justification: The result provided is within 45 seconds and the accuracy is between 89-92%
speaker: Warga PBG

questions.question: GeNose C19 breathalyser can test for covid 19 infection. It has a 95% accuracy rate and a sensitivity level of 89-92%. The product has an accuracy rate of 93-95% with a sensitivity levels of 89 to 92%.

claim: Republicans voted for almost $2 trillion in tax breaks for the wealthiest people and the largest corporations in the USA.
label: Supported
justification: The Republicans tax cut bill was about $2.2 trillion and it had the top 0.1% paying less.
speaker: Bernie Saunders

questions.question: The Republican tax's cost would be about $2.2 trillion. The top 0.1 percent paid 24.1% of federal individual income taxes in 2017, while the top 20% paid 95%. In 2017 the average household would get only a small percent from a tax cut, whereas larger richer households earning $1 million or more would get an larger average cut.

claim: Jill Jacobs, aka Dr Jill Biden, was the Biden family's babysitter.
label: Refuted
justification: Evidence denies that Kill Jacobs worked as a babysitter.
speaker: Rob Burchard

questions.question: Joe Biden met his second wife, Jill Jacobs, in 1975 and they married in 1977. Jill Jacobs was not a babysitter for the Biden family prior to Neilia Biden's death. She was already married at the time of the car accident. Joe Biden has no children.

claim: The 58 year net gain of global temperature is zero. We are simply in a cyclical, normal ebb and flow of temperature.
label: Refuted
justification: The source and answer shows that there has been an increase in the global temperature so the claim is refuted.

questions.question: There has been no increase in global temperature over the past 58 years, according to NOAA data. Facebook users published this claim and received thousands of interactions on the social media platform. This is incorrect as there have been strong global warming trends over the last 58 years.

claim: Elderly women farmers were intentionally crushed by a water tanker at a Farmers' Protest rally in Amritsar, India.
label: Refuted
justification: The driver says he lost control of the vehicle.
speaker: Alka Lamba (@LambaAlka)

questions.question: Shuklal Singh, the driver of the water tanker has been identified and he is in police custody. He is a construction worker by profession and does not have a driving license either. He lost control of the vehicle and ran over the women. The incident was not politically motivated.

claim: Johnson and Johnson has developed a new vaccine for COVID-19 that only requires one dose.
label: Supported
justification: Three separate answers all prove the claim.
speaker: Tom On Tap

questions.question: Johnson & Johnson has created a new vaccine called COVID-19. It is 66% effective in preventing moderate and severe disease, but 85% effective against severe disease. The Covid-19 single-shot vaccine is a single dose vaccine. Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies developed the vaccine.

claim: 200 Delhi cops resign from their post to show solidarity with the protesting farmers.
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: No evidence provided in QAs of whether 200 Delhi cops resigned or not; and if they did resign, what was the reason.
speaker: Social Media users

questions.question: Delhi police were present at a tractor rally organised by farmers protesting against the new farm laws on Republic Day. A video has emerged of a Delhi police official chanting 'jai jawan, jai kisan' slogan at Mukarba Chowk to urge protesting farmers to get back on the designated route.

claim: White people are getting vaccinated at higher rates than Black and Latino Americans
label: Supported
justification: the answers all confirm this is true.
speaker: Drew Fossen

questions.question: In 14 states, white people are getting vaccinated at higher rates than Black and Latino Americans. In Colorado, however, black and Hispanic people are less likely to be vaccinated than whites. The data on this is incomplete but it's probably true. It's also true that white people get vaccinated at a higher rate than blacks and Latinos.

claim: Long-term Mask Use May Contribute to Advanced Stage Lung Cancer, Study Finds.
label: Refuted
justification: the quoted study makes no reference to mask wearing and only talks about people who already have lung cancer
speaker: Philip Schneider

questions.question: A recent study in the journal Cancer Discovery found that inhalation of harmful microbes can contribute to advanced stage lung cancer in adults. Long-term use of face masks may help breed these dangerous pathogens. The study does not refer to the wearing of masks, but to microbes in the lungs of patients with lung cancer.

claim: Article 42 of the Magna Carta 'enshrines' the right to free movement at home and across borders in peacetime
label: Refuted
justification: The evidence suggests no such clause exists.
speaker: The Telegraph

questions.question: Magna Carta does not include a law article that gives the right to free movement at home and across borders in peacetime. No law exists within the magna cartas 37 articles of enshrined laws stating the right for freedom of movement. The law is not there.

claim: True! Leprosy spreads through respiratory droplets and face masks help curb its spread
label: Supported
justification: The claim seems to be fully supported, the QA provide good information to come to a solid conclusion. Question 3 finds that Leprosy is an airbourne disease and it can be passed through droplets from coughing or sneezing. In question 4 we establish that the WHO recommends the use of face masks in relation to helping protect against catching Leprosy.
speaker: Lois Ugbede

questions.question: Leprosy is a chronic human disease with potentially debilitating neurological consequences. Leprosy has been curable by Multidrug therapy, a combination of three drugs that fight the leprosy bacteria since 1982. 95% of people are naturally immune to it. WHO recommends the use of face masks on health staff and patients.

claim: Joe Biden admits he is governing like a dictator.
label: Refuted
justification: Dates dont match and Biden quote does not state this in the QA pairs.
speaker: Charlie Kirk

questions.question: Charlie Kirk made the claim that Joe Biden admitted he is governing like a dictator. The video supporting the claim was recorded on 15th October 2020. Joe Biden will take the US President’s office on January 20th, 2021. He said in an ABC news town hall in October 2020 that raising taxes via executive order is illegal under democracy.

claim: China Showcases ‘Happy’ Uighurs to Fend Off Genocide Claims
label: Supported
justification:
The Oxford Languages English Dictionary definition of genocide is: the deliberate killing of a large number of people from a particular nation or ethnic group with the aim of destroying that nation or group. 
Cotton-picking cannot be classed as genocide.

Only one Q&A directly tackled the subject of the claim.

The question as to the credibility of the source of the reply needs to be asked.  

Looking at the evidence as presented in the source, it  appears true that China is indeed presenting "happy" Uighurs as the claim suggests  and the label is therefore Supported.

questions.question: In 2018, three Uyghur regions mobilized at least 570,000 people into cotton-picking operations through the government’s coercive labor training and transfer scheme. In July, exiled Uighurs delivered a dossier of evidence to the ICC asking it to investigate crimes against humanity and genocide in Xinjiang. Memetnyaz said in an article published by Global Times that some anti-China forces had been lying about forced labour claims.

claim: Chinese Communist Party Owns Legendary Films
label: Refuted
justification:
The Q&A's show that whilst the group that owns the company in the claim is owned by a member of the Chinese communist party he is not The communist party leader or founder but still a high ranking a member.
It is a stretch to say the party owns the company of one of its members.

questions.question: Dalian Wanda Group bought Legendary Entertainment in 2016. The founder of DalianWanda Group is Wang Jianlin, a member of the Chinese Communist Party. Relatives of high-ranking Party officials amassed a stake in the company prior to the IPO and appreciated to over $1.1 billion when the company was listed.

claim: Agra’s St John’s College Issued a written letter to students stating that Girls would need a boyfriend by 14 February 2021 or they would not be allowed to enter the college
label: Refuted
justification: Officially refuted by the college.

questions.question: Agra's St John's College has not issued any notification regarding female students and boyfriends. The college principal warned students to ignore the fake circular circulating on Monday.    The college authorities will find out those responsible for the mischievous act and initiate action against them.

claim: 84% of all new electric capacity planned to come onto the electric grid this year is clean energy
label: Supported
justification: the sources show that 84% will come from sources without burning fossil fuels
speaker: Joe Biden

questions.question: The new electric capacity slated to come online in 2021 will be 39% solar, 31% wind, 11% from batteries and 3% nuclear. Of the new plants built this year, 84% will deliver electricity without burning fossil fuels. The total percentage of carbon-free energy sources for the US in 2021 is 39%.

claim: Joe Biden canceled the Keystone pipeline because Warren Buffett donated $58 million to his campaign
label: Refuted
justification: The answer and source show that the pipeline was cancelled not for the reason in the claim so it is refuted.

questions.question: Joe Biden cancelled the Keystone pipeline project due to environmental and climate damage it could cause. He did so because of the risks to the environment and climate change. The project will not go ahead as planned, he said.  “It's a bad idea. It's very bad for the environment.”

claim: Tanzania has not been affected by COVID-19.
label: Refuted
justification: From the evidence, it is clear that Tanzania has been affected by COVID-19, as they have reported 509 cases and a total of 21 deaths. Hence, the claim is refuted.
speaker: John Magufuli

questions.question: Tanzania has reported 509 COVID-19 infections and 21 deaths in total due to Covid-19, according to World Health Organization data. Tanzania is affected by the disease as well. The WHO reports that there have been 21 deaths due to it.

claim: Biden administration temporarily freezes arms sales to Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates.
label: Supported
justification: From the Q&As you can see that Biden did in fact temporarily freeze arms sales. So the claim is supported.
speaker: INTELSky

questions.question: President Joe Biden is temporarily freezing weapons sales to Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates. He wants to review a set of controversial arms deals that former President Donald Trump struck with the two U.S. allies in the waning days of his administration.

claim: The Kremlin readout of a phone call between Biden and Putin on 26 Jan 2021 fails to mention that President Biden made clear that the United States will act firmly in defense of its national interests in response to actions by Russia that harm us or our allies.
label: Supported
justification: It seefrom the 2nd QA that indeed the Russian side failed to mention the issues mentioned. Therefore the claim is supported

questions.question: There were mentions of issues relating to Ukraine, protection of U.S. interests by Biden and the Solar wind hack in the readout of the call between Biden and Putin. In the Russian readout there was no mention of things like Ukraine and the solar wind hack.

claim: The CDC may recommend doubling up on masks.
label: Refuted
justification: No Mention on official CDC website and other QA pairs quote WHO.
speaker: Savant Moore

questions.question: One mask is enough to guard against COVID-19, as long as it's medical grade. WHO representative to the Philippines Rabindra Abeyasinghe says there is no need for two masks. CDC website does not mention wearing two face masks.

claim: H&M is selling a sweatshirt for children that says "Koolest Kid in the Klan"
label: Refuted
justification: The original sweatshirt's logo read, "Coolest monkey in the jungle".

claim: Today is the deadline for WhatsApp’s new privacy policy, new rule begins tomorrow that allows WhatsApp to see your messages and photos.

claim: Everything posted in WhatsApp can be published and seen by WhatsApp including photos and messages and deleted messages.

The House of Representatives charges an official of the federal government by approving, by simple majority vote, articles of impeachment. The Senate sits as a High Court of Impeachment to consider evidence, hear witnesses and vote to acquit or convict the impeached official. In the case of presidential impeachment trials, the chief justice of the United States presides.
