speaker: Joey Dumas

questions.question: The FBI is working to bring charges against those involved in yesterday's attack on the Capitol building. The FBI does not tolerate violent agitators and extremists who use the guise of First Amendment-protected activity to incite violence and wreak havoc. There’s no evidence that the mob was a false flag attack led by antifa activists aiming to make Trump supporters look bad or push a liberal agenda.

claim: Leonardo, the defense contractor, used their military satellite uplink to load the software and transfer it over to change US election votes from Donald Trump to Biden.
label: Refuted
justification: There were no voter frauds in the 2020 elections
speaker: The Eric Metaxas Radio Station

questions.question: Voter impersonation is virtually non-existent. Many instances of alleged fraud are, in fact, mistakes by voters or administrators. There is no evidence of election fraud in the 2020 U.S. presidential election.    “There is no proof of election Fraud in the  2020 U.,S. Presidential Election.

claim: Stefan Serafini coordinated with a general, Claudio Graziano -- and Claudio Graziano, Gen. Graziano, is on the board of Leonardo, the defense contractor ... Leonardo used their military satellite uplink to load the software and transfer it over to change the votes from [Donald] Trump to Biden.
label: Refuted
justification: All parts of the claim we're broken up with two questions and discovered to be false by the question and answers, Claudio Graziano is neither listed on the board of directors for Leonardo and the ballots were unable to be switched using satellite uplink because most of the votes are cast on paper ballots.
speaker: The Eric Metaxas Radio Station

questions.question: Claudio Graziano is not on the board of Leonardo. The majority of votes cast in this election will be cast on paper ballots or using machines that produce a paper audit trail. This means voting system software is subject to multiple audits to ensure accuracy and reliability.

claim: Social media giants suspended Trump’s accounts.
label: Supported
justification: Accounts were indeed suspended by Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram.

questions.question: Trump's Twitter, Facebook and Instagram accounts were suspended on Wednesday 6th January 2021. This was after they removed multiple posts that violated the companies’ rules and policies relating to safety and false claims of election fraud. The posts related to the storming of the US Capitol by his supporters today.

claim: Stefan Serafini, a purported foreign service officer in Rome, rigged the 2020 US election.
label: Refuted
justification: Despite no answers could be found of Stefan Serafini or the Italian intelligence being involved directly in any attempts to rig the election in the US, there was equally evidence that suggested the US 2020 election was not rigged by anyone as mentioned from the 2nd answer.
speaker: The Eric Metaxas Radio Station

questions.question: Stefan Serafini was a Foreign Service Officer. There is no evidence that the 2020 US presidential election was rigged. Italian intelligence was not involved in the US 2020 election.  No answer could be found to the question if Stefan Serafinis rigged the elections.

claim: The number of deaths in England and Wales is below average for this time of year.
label: Refuted
justification: Good statistics to draw on, clearly shows deaths are higher
speaker: Dr John Lee

questions.question: The number of deaths in the first week of 2021 was 20,023. This is 6,170 higher than the five-year average. The death toll in the week ending 8 January 2021 was 6,000 higher than previous years' average figure.

claim: A facial recognition software company called XRVision identified two Philadelphia Antifa members among the  protesters at the assault on the U.S. Capitol in 2021.
label: Refuted
justification: The software did not recognise antifa members, but qanon members and neo nazis

questions.question: XRVision's facial recognition software identified two Philadelphia Antifa members among the protesters at the assault on the U.S. Capitol in 2021, but it did not identify neo-Nazis and a QAnon supporter as antifa members. A Washington Times story claiming that XRVision had identified antifa were false.

claim: Last year in 2020, Pennsylvania elected officials passed a whole new law that allows universal mail-in balloting, and did it irregardless of what the Pennsylvania Constitution said.
label: Refuted
justification:
As confirmed in a Q&A answer source, the Pennsylvania Constitution does not disregard in-mail voting, for absentee voters, therefore the second part of the claim is refuted.
The first part of the claim, ie was "a whole new law" passed, has no Q&As, and cannot be verified.
speaker: Josh Hawley

questions.question: Article VII Section 14 of the state constitution says the state Legislature should set laws governing absentee voting in specific instances. After World War II, the constitution amended the constitution to allow certain limited instances of absentee voting. Act 77 added no-excuse voting by mail and eliminated straight-ticket voting. It was not challenged when it was passed during the June primary election. Lawmakers didn't challenge it after President Trump lost the general election.

claim: Barack Obama and Former Italian Prime Minister Matteo Renzi were involved in the plot to rig the US election
label: Refuted
justification: The election wasn't rigged and there was nothing found about Obama and Renzi rigging the election
speaker: The Eric Metaxas Radio Station

questions.question: The Justice Department hasn't found evidence to support allegations of widespread fraud that could have changed the result of last month's presidential election, Attorney General William Barr said in an interview with the Associated Press published on Tuesday. There is no mention of it anywhere, including news websites at the time.

claim: Philippine Foreign Affairs Secretary Teodoro Locsin u-turns on China's new coast guard law.
label: Supported
justification: Having said a different thing earlier he changes his mind
speaker: Locsin

questions.question: Teodoro Locsin Jr. posted two tweets about China's new coast guard law on January 25th and 27th 2021. Vera Files fact check, February 2nd 2021, states that both tweets were in opposition to each other and depict a sharp turnaround of opinion.

claim: Brazil's private clinics sign MoU with India's Bharat Biotech for 5 million doses of coronavirus vaccine produced in India.
label: Supported
justification: The Q&As support the claim, as Brazil did order 5 million doses of the vaccine.
speaker: Satya Priya BN

questions.question: Brazil will buy 5 million doses of Bharat Biotech's Covid-19 vaccine from Indian pharmaceutical firm. India’s health regulator gave it emergency use approval a day after Brazil announced plans to buy the vaccine. The Brazilian Association of Vaccine Clinics (ABCVAC) negotiates for the purchase.

claim: A judge in the United Kingdom rejected a request made by the United States to extradite WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange to face charges of espionage.
label: Supported
justification: Seems from the answer to the question that a UK Judge indeed rejected a extradition request. Therefore the label is supported
speaker: Luke Addis

questions.question: The UK District Judge Vanessa Baraitser rejected the extradition request by the US for Julian Assange. She said that he faces prosecution and jailing him in the U.S. would be bad for his mental health, which could lead to him harming himself.

claim: Antifa vandalized the home of Missouri senator Josh Hawley in 4th of January 2021
label: Refuted
justification: The 1st Q&A pair state that no vandalization of the home in the claim occurred, the 2nd Q&A pair state that this is also backed up from video evidence.
speaker: Josh Hawley, @HawleyMO

questions.question: Activists from the left-wing coalition group ShutDownDC gathered for a "Vigil for democracy" in front of Senator Hawley's home in Vienna, a suburb of Washington, DC, on January 4. Nadine Bock and Ruben Vazquez claim that they did not utter any threats. The entire event was streamed live on YouTube.

claim: Non-medical masks are ineffective in preventing the spread of the Covid-19.
label: Refuted
justification: It seems that non medical masks offer protection,  therefore the claim is refuted

questions.question: There is no medical reason to wear a non-medical cloth type mask to protect from covid-19. It depends on the fabric used and how well the mask fits. The protection of a cloth mask also depends on its quality and thickness, and the number of layers it has.

claim: Boris Johnson has announced  that the UK is going back into lockdown due to COVID-19.
label: Supported
justification: The claim is supported by the Q&A - although the claim should probably state when the lockdown was to start.
speaker: @hannaaa333

questions.question: The UK entered into three national lockdowns due to COVID-19 on the 23rd of March 2020, 5th of November 2020 and 6th of January 2021. Boris Johnson reimposed a lockdown in England on January 4, 2021 because of COVID 19.

claim: A Sikh farmer was on the cover of National Geographic magazine
label: Refuted
justification: It seems that the Sikh farmer was never on the magazine cover. Therefore, the claim is refuted

questions.question: George Floyd was killed on a street corner on May 25 by a white police officer Derek Chauvin. National Geographic magazine printed January 4, 2021 with the image of George Floyd on the cover and mentions the BLM movement. There were other pictures published by the magazine but there was no photo of a Sikh farmer.

claim: Malaria kills more children under five than any other age group.
label: Supported
justification: Confirmed via Multiple QA Answers.

questions.question: Malaria kills more children under five than any other age group in Nigeria. Malaria is the third most common cause of death in children under the age of five, accounting for 5% of all deaths globally. Children make up the majority of fatal cases of malaria in the WHO African Region.

claim: US President Trump tried to persuade elections officials in Georgia US to recalculate state's vote in his favour
label: Supported
justification: President Donald Trump pressured Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger to "find" enough votes to reverse his loss to President-elect Joe Biden in Georgia, according to an hourlong recorded phone call obtained by The Washington Post.
speaker: Amy Gardner

questions.question: Donald Trump is missing 11,780 votes in Georgia. He lost the election to President-elect Joe Biden by less than 1 million votes. The Washington Post obtained a recording of an hour-long phone call between Donald Trump and Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger.

claim: Lok Sabha's Speaker, Om Birla’s daughter did not take any examination or appear for interview and yet cleared Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) Examination in her first attempt.
label: Refuted
justification: QA pair states she had her family with her as she prepared for the exam and interview.
speaker: Yugesh Singh Yadav

questions.question: Om Birla's daughter Anjali has passed the Civil Services Exam (CSE) conducted by the USOC. She had an interview before the exam. Her family stood by her and helped her prepare for the exam, which she passed in her first attempt.

claim: The US Congress has one job on January 6th 2021: to count electoral votes that have been cast by any state.
label: Supported
justification: The congresses job following an election is to count electoral votes. Hence, this claim is supported.
speaker: Mike Gallagher

questions.question: Mike Pence will open the sealed certificates from each state on Jan. 6 and call for objections to each state’s votes. Federal law explicitly says the power to appoint electors belongs to the states. If electors are appointed by the states at least six days before the election, their votes "shall govern in the counting of the electoral votes"

claim: The U.S. government is pushing the COVID-19 vaccines heavily on blacks and browns out of pure racism.
label: Refuted
justification: The U.S. government provided the COVID-19 vaccines to all eligible and available Americans.

questions.question: There are three COVID-19 vaccines approved by the FDA in the U.S. Pfizer/BioNTech’s two-dose mRNA vaccine was authorized via an emergency use authorization on Dec. 11, Moderna's vaccine got the same approval on Dec 18 and Janssen Biotech Inc.'s one-shot vaccine was approved on Feb. 27. AstraZeneca announced on March 25 that its vaccine had 76% efficacy against symptomatic disease in its phase 3 trial and it expected to file for FDA authorization in the coming weeks. Novavax said it expected authorization as early as May. CDC data show people of color have a higher hospitalization and death rate than their white counterparts. Public health experts recommended prioritizing certain members of minority communities.

claim: Nigeria is the fifth largest receiver of diaspora remittances in the world.
label: Refuted
justification: The source shows that Nigeria ranks seventh in the top countries receiving remittances.

questions.question: India, China, Mexico, the Philippines and Egypt are the top five largest receivers of diaspora remittances in the world. Nigeria is the seventh-largest recipient.    In 2020, the top 5 countries were India, China,. Mexico, Filipinos and Egypt.

claim: Nigerians in the diaspora send back an estimated $25 billion in annual remittances.
label: Supported
justification: The second question asks how much money is sent back to Nigeria from overseas Nigerians, and the estimate is over $25 billion, so because the claim is an estimate, I believe the evidence is enough to support the claim.

questions.question: There are 20 million Nigerians outside Nigeria. Nigerians in the Diaspora send back over 25 billion USdollars to Nigeria each year, estimated at $25 billion in 2018.  Nigeria has a population of around 80 million people.

claim: Baringo’s healthcare allocation is the highest
label: Refuted
justification: Q&A pairs show that the country was only 3rd highest for the claim, and also give details of at least one other country that is higher.
speaker: Stanley Kiptis

questions.question: Baringo's health budget for 2020/21 was 2.3 Ksh Billion, Murang'a's was 3.7 Ksh billion. Baringo spent no more on health than the other Kenyan counties during the period 2020-21.

claim: The new COVID-19 variant in Nigeria has a shorter incubation period of between 24 to 72 hours,
label: Refuted
justification: The incubation period ranges from 1-14 days which is still the estimate around the world
speaker: Academy of Medicine Specialties of Nigeria

questions.question: The incubation period for COVID-19 is between 1-14 days. Symptoms may appear 2- 14 days after exposure to the virus, according to the CDC. WHO in Nigeria says it's 5 days from catching the virus to having symptoms.

claim: Lord Subrahmanyeswara Swamy's idol has been vandalized in Vigneswara Temple at Rajahmundry
label: Supported
justification: Lord Subrahmanyeswara Swamy's idol has been vandalized in Vigneswara Temple at Rajahmundry
speaker: @missionkaali

questions.question: On Friday morning, the priests of Vigneshwara temple in Sriramnagar in Rajahmundry found the two arms of Lord Subrahmanya's rock figurine severed. The temple was desecrated on the intervening night of 31 December and 1 January.

claim: China accounts for less than 10% of Kenya’s external debt.
label: Refuted
justification: From the question-answer pair it seems that the numbers are wrong- China accounts for 21.3% of the Kenyan external debt- therefore the label is refuted.

questions.question: China owns 21.3% of Kenya’s external debt, which is the total amount of its debt with China.    It's about $20 billion in total and includes both national debts and international loans. The current level of debt is around $21 billion.

claim: There are more than 15 million Nigerians in the diaspora.
label: Refuted
justification: The source is a credible source and states that there are 1.7 million Nigerians living abroad so the claim is clearly refuted.

questions.question: There are 1.7 million Nigerians living abroad, according to the UN Department of Economic and Social Affairs. It is estimated that there are about one billion people in the world. There are around 1.3 billion Nigerians currently living abroad. The number is expected to rise.

claim: China is by far Kenya’s largest bilateral creditor.
label: Supported
justification: From the evidence below it looks like China is Kenya's largest bilateral creditor at 66%/7 billion as of December 2020.

questions.question: Kenya owes China $7 billion as of December 2020. This is 66% of bilateral debt. It's nearly five times what is owed to the next nearest creditor, Japan, and twice that of the next seven countries put together.    Bilateral debt generally refers to debt loaned by one state to another state.

claim: Counterfeit ballots were found at a warehouse in Fulton County, Georgia.
label: Refuted
justification: Ballot papers were found but they were real ballot papers and they were there for a reason. So the claim was incorrect and is refuted.
speaker: Maureen McKnight Winans

questions.question: The ballots found in Fulton County, Georgia were real ballot papers. According to the state election rules, emergency ballots must be at least 10% of the number of registered voters in the polling place for any primary or general election in which a state or federal candidate is on the ballot.

claim: Video of ink attack on  Haryana BJP MP Raj Kumar Saini, circulating on social media, claims to show a farmers' protest .
label: Refuted
justification: Video is from almost 5 years earlier.
speaker: @JagmohanKausha2

questions.question: The latest social media post showing the video with claims that it was of an ink attack on Haryana BJP MP Raj Kumar Saini was posted on 01/01/2021. In October and November 2016 the same video was on social media.

claim: Baringo county puts 51% of its resources into healthcare.
label: Refuted
justification:
The query states that 51% of a counties budget goes to healthcare,
However Q&A 2 shows how much it spends which is 9,0 billion, and Q&A 3 shows how much of this goes to health care which is, 2.6 billion, which is not 51% so refuted.
speaker: Stanley Kiptis

questions.question: Baringo County's budget for the health department in previous years was 21.5% in 2014/15, 23.4% in 2015/16, 25.2% in 2016/17 and 9.9% in 2020/21. The supplementary budget for 2020/2021 amounts to Kshs 9,029,650,314.

claim: Baringo [has] gone beyond the 35% ceiling on personnel emoluments as set in the constitution. We are at 55.7%.
label: Supported
justification: Personnel emoluments” – the cost of employee salaries and other benefits – take up 54.7% of the budget. This claim is mostly true
speaker: Stanley Kiptis

questions.question: Baringo County allocated KSh3.45 billion for compensation to employees in 2020. The county's total expected revenue to finance its budget is KSh6.3 billion. Personnel emoluments take up 54.7% of the budget. Public finance regulations cap spending on salaries and benefits at 35%.

claim: Kenya’s outstanding loans to China total US$6.4 billion.
label: Supported
justification: QA pair shows the outstanding loan in 2019 is $6.4 billion

questions.question: Kenya owes China $6.7 billion as of November 2020. The outstanding total to China is $6,4 billion in 2019.  In 2020, Kenya owes $6billion to China and $2billion in 2019;    In 2020, the outstanding total is $5 billion.

claim: Polysorbate 80, a synthetic compound used to help keep ingredients together in vaccines, suppresses the immune system and can cross the blood-brain barrier.
label: Refuted
justification: Q&A's 1 and 2 show the claim is right about the compound shown being used in vaccines and why it is there, it is wrong however that it can cross the blood brain barrier, as is shown in Q&A 3

questions.question: Polysorbate 80 is used in vaccines as an emulsifier to hold ingredients together. It is also used in cosmetics, vitamins and food products, including ice cream. According to the US Food and Drug Administration, the COVID-19 vaccine does not contain Polysorbates 80.

claim: Louisianas Congressional Congressman-Elect Luke Letlow died of COVID-19.
label: Supported
justification: True

questions.question: Luke Letlow died of complications of Covid-19 days before he was set to be sworn into office. Luke Letlow, a Republican, was elected to represent Louisiana's 5th Congressional District in a runoff this month. Dr. Marc Siegel calls the congressman-elect’s death a ‘rare situation’

claim: Controversial Austrian Bill bans Muslims
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: The Austrian Bill did include the term "political Islam," but it was later changed to "religiously motivated extremism." This is because the bill would be focused on introducing preventive detention for people convicted of terror offenses, making it easier to strip dual citizens convicted of terrorism offenses of their Austrian citizenship, and in some cases, monitoring people with an electronic ankle bracelet or a wristband after their release from prison.
speaker: Eranga Manohara

questions.question: Austrian lawmakers attempted to curb "political Islam" with a bill due to be voted on shortly. The proposals included introducing preventive detention for people convicted of terror offences and making it easier to strip dual citizens convicted of terrorism offences of their Austrian citizenship. The bill was revised in December and the term “political Islam” was replaced with more neutral language referring to “religiously motivated extremism”

claim: About €500,000 COVID-19 fraud has been traced to Nigeria by the International Criminal Police Organisation (Interpol).
label: Supported
justification: The source confirmed the amount of the fraud and tracing it to an account in Nigeria.

questions.question: The Dutch Fiscal Information and Investigation Service tracked down the EUR 880,000 which had been transferred from the German company Covid-19. Nearly EUR 500,000 of those funds had already been sent to the United Kingdom and were destined for an account in Nigeria.

claim: The total population of Kerala, India is 3,56,99,443
label: Refuted
justification: From a 2011 census, the total population of Kerala, India is 33, 387, 677
speaker: Asish Das

questions.question: The total population of Kerala is 3,33,87,677 according to the 2011 census. It is 3.3% of India’s population. The state has a population of 3.33%, based on the 2011 Census.  Kerala has an estimated population of 1.87%.

claim: The United States government is giving $700 billion to other countries.
label: Refuted
justification: According to the source linked in the q&a, in 2020 the annual budget was approximately $20 billion.
speaker: Bryan S Boccanfuso

questions.question: USAID is the largest bilateral donor of foreign and humanitarian assistance in the world with an annual budget of approximately $20 billion. In December 18, 2020 USAID will be the largest donor of such aid.  The U.S aid budget in 2020 was $20billion.

claim: There are 21,683 madrasas (educational institutions) in Kerala. India
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: Theres no evidence found to support the claim, the QA establishes what the Madrasa educational system is but theres no evidence found on how many of them there are, so we cannot rate the claim other than not having enough evidence to prove the claim.
speaker: Asish Das

questions.question: There are no answers to the question about how many madrasas there are in Kerala. Madrasa system that operates in Kerala is a highly effective machinery for imparting religious education to the growing generation up to plus two level. It is run in a smooth manner with well defined aims and objectives supported by a well planned curriculum.

claim: Politician Pinarayi Vijayan and his government plan to  ban operations of Reliance Jio internet services in the Indian State of Kerala from 2021.
label: Refuted
justification: sources do not support this claim.
speaker: Adv R. S. Chandi

questions.question: Reliance Jio Infocomm Limited is providing free internet to families living below the poverty line in Kerala. It operates a national LTE network with coverage across all 22 telecom circles. Reliant Jio isn't going to be banned in Kerala, but it will provide them with better services.

claim: Goons climbed up a mosque in Mandsaur district of Madhya Pradesh.
label: Supported
justification: From the 3rd QA it seems that indeed people climbed up a mosque. Therefore the claim is supported
speaker: @AlisStrongVoice

questions.question: There was an incident at Mandsaur on 29/12/2020. A group with saffron flags and raising slogans blocked a narrow lane near a local mosque, with some people climbing on top of it. Police ordered them to get down immediately. There was no damage to the structure.

claim: The monthly pension given to a madrasa’s (educational intuition) teacher in Kerala, India is Rs 6,000.
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: Seems that there isn't enough info to make the claim label. Therefore it is not enough evidence
speaker: Asish Das

questions.question: Principals of Coaching Centres are appointed from Principals, Senior grade/ selection grade lectures retired from colleges. They are paid with a consolidated amount of Rs. 25,000. The classes are conducted through different faculties and they are paid on hour basis (Rs. 300 per one hour).

claim: Muslim population of Kerala, India is 88,73,472.
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: I cannot determine what the  Muslim population in Kerala was in 2020 when the time the claim as the evidence could not be found according to the 1st QA pair; the 2nd QA pair only confirms the 8.87m figure was correct in 2011.
speaker: Asish Das

questions.question: The 2011 census gives 8,873,472 as the figure for Muslims in Kerala. The lowest growth rate was seen in Kerala with 12.8% and population increased from 7.8 million to 8.8m.  No answer could be found.

claim: The salary of a teacher working in a madrasa (school of educational intuition) in Kerala, India, is Rs 25, 000 per month (excluding those earning Rs 300 per hour).
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: One claim states a principals wage at 25k and the other states it varies on the committee
speaker: Asish Das

questions.question: There are 16 Coaching centres for Muslim youths in Kollam, Ernakulam, Malappuram, Kozhikodu and Kannur Districts. Principals of these centres are appointed on contract basis from senior lecturers retired from colleges. They are paid with a consolidated amount of Rs. 25,000. The salaries of teachers working in madrasa in Kerala are paid according to the financial capacity of the madrasas.

claim: As many as 2,04,683 teachers work in madrasas (educational institutions) in Kerala, India
label: Refuted
justification: According to the source, there are one hundred thousand teachers working in these madrasas. 8777registered madrasas with a total of 1,035,000 students across all  madrasas (educational institutions) in Kerala, India.
speaker: Asish Das

questions.question: There are 14,16,299 teachers in India. 57.8% of them are male and 42.2% are female. There are 163,160 school teachers in Kerala during 2016-17. They have 8777 madrasas registered to their board with 1,035,000 students learning.

claim: There are 941 panchayats (Village governments) in the state of Kerala, India.
label: Supported
justification: The claim is supported with Gram Panchayat: 941.
speaker: Asish Das

questions.question: There were 941 Gram Panchayats in Kerala at the time of the claim. Block Pachayats: 152, District Panchays: 14 and District Councils are referred to as District Pchayats.  The definition of gram panchayat is covered in article 243B of the Constitution.

claim: Some California Counties Allow Voters To Use ImageCast Remote Software To Mark Mail-In Ballots, But There's No Evidence It's Not Secure
label: Supported
justification: Confirmed in QA pairs, this option is available in California and is deemed secure.
speaker: Ron Watkins

questions.question: Some California counties allow voters to use ImageCast Remote software to mark their mail-in ballots. The Secretary of State’s Office has four certified RAVBM systems: Five Cedars Group Alternate Format Ballot v5.2.1, Democracy Live Secure Select 1.2, Dominion ImageCast remote 5.10A and Los Angeles County Voting Solution for All People Interactive Sample Ballot 2.5.

claim: New York Post published a cover and staff editorial urging President Donald Trump to accept defeat
label: Supported
justification: The source illustrates the article and its content as mentioned in the claim.

questions.question: The New York Post wrote an article on Dec. 27th 2020 regarding Donald Trump and his bid for re-election. The article is titled "Give it up, Mr. President — for your sake and the nation’s." It also adds that the newspaper endorsed Trump.

claim: Military operations in the Amazon have been a big success.
label: Refuted
justification: The first two question-answer pairs are not really related to the claim and are therefore not useful. However, based on the last 3 it seems that the operations have not been successful at all. Therefore the claim is refuted.
speaker: Vice President Hamilton Mourao

questions.question: There has been a rise in deforestation in the Amazon since 2019. In 2020 satellites recorded a deforestation of 890 km², the largest in October in the last ten years. Operation Green Brazil 2 began on May 11, 2020 and is expected to conclude on November 6, 2020, subject to extension. The government purposely lost control of deforestation in Amazon due to military presence.

claim: President Trump invoked the Impoundment Control Act of 1974 as he signed the Covid-19 Relief Bill, forcing Congress to rescind section 230, cut wasteful spending, and to add $2,000 stimulus checks for all Americans.
label: Refuted
justification: this claim is not supported by the sources
speaker: Donnie Everson

questions.question: Impoundment Control Act of 1974 does not force Congress to do anything. It was passed in 1974 as a way to limit the president's power to withhold the spending of funds approved by Congress in a budget bill. President Trump is trying to dial back Section 230’s protections through an executive order. Nancy Pelosi is pushing a separate bill to do that.

claim: TRUMP CAMPAIGN SELLING ‘MAKE AMERICA GREAT AGAIN’ FACE MASKS
label: Refuted
justification: Although branded masks were handed out, they are not being sold.
speaker: Howie Klein

questions.question: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommends that people wear cloth or fabric face coverings when entering public spaces such as grocery stores and public transit stations. Trump campaign staff gave out branded masks to fight the coronavirus to surrogates, but they're nowhere to be found in his campaign store.

claim: Joe Biden Is A War Hero, Rhodes Scholar, and Harvard Law Grad
label: Refuted
justification: the question/answer pair show that the claim is  not true
speaker: Anthony Gelber

questions.question: Biden attended Syracuse Law School, not Harvard. He practiced law in Delaware, not Massachusetts. He was never a Rhodes Scholar. He did not serve in the military.  The claimant decided that the information would not be fact-checked and Biden's campaign bio and biographies maintained by biography.com prove it.

claim: Sam Hyde Was Driving The RV That Exploded in Nashville
label: Refuted
justification: Evidence confirms that comedian Sam Hyde was not driving the RV that exploded in Nashville. Hence, the claim is refuted.

questions.question: A recreational vehicle in downtown Nashville exploded early Christmas morning, causing widespread communications outages and grounded holiday travel at the city's airport. The RV had a recorded warning that a bomb would detonate in 15 minutes. Human remains were found in the vicinity of the explosion.

claim: The AT&T data center in Nashville, Tennessee, damaged by a Christmas morning bomb have a contract to audit Dominion voting machines.
label: Refuted
justification: Refuted by AT&T spokesman.

questions.question: AT&T is not an auditor for any voting systems in Nashville. AT&T corporate spokesman confirmed this.  No answer could be found as to which company does AT&Ts audit their voting machines.    iReport.com: Do you know the company that audits voting machines in Nashville?

claim: A judge ruled that over 200,000 Biden votes are illegitimate.
label: Refuted
justification: The answer and source show that the judge did not rule that the votes were illegitimate so the claim is refuted.
speaker: James Edward Sullivani

questions.question: Wisconsin Supreme Court upheld Biden's win and rejects Trump's lawsuit. Over 200,000 of Biden's votes were not illegitimate. The judge ruled that over 200,00 of them were invalid but the high court said otherwise. It also rejected Trump's suit.

claim: South Korea is the only country in the world in which the Lady Justice statue is not blindfolded.
label: Refuted
justification: The Q&A pairs list at least 3 other countries that have the same as what is claimed to be the only one in the entity of the query

questions.question: The United Kingdom has Lady Justice without a blindfold. Australia and Hungary also have Lady Justice with no blindfold, but not in the UK. The other countries that have her are Australia, Hungary and New Zealand. In the UK, she wears a blindfook.

claim: A video of business tycoon Mukesh Ambani throwing a lavish party has gone viral on social media. It is being claimed that he is seen celebrating the birth of his grandson.
label: Refuted
justification: Confirmed as older video.
speaker: News Mobile Fact Check Bureau

claim: Myanmar award winning film actor Pyay Tii Oo to donate 500,000 kyats to every household in Myanmar.
label: Refuted
justification: The official Pyay Ti Oo Education Foundation which is an official foundation of the actor Pyay Ti Oo have addressed the claim and said that it is absolutely not true and they are not involved in any fields other than education.
speaker: Moh Moh Phyu

questions.question: Pyay Ti Oo Education Foundation is a registered organization that helps students who cannot afford for their education. The foundation supports outstanding students who passed the matriculation examination and cannot afford to pursue their higher education. They donate as much as they can where help is actually needed.

claim: Moderna's coronavirus vaccine has 100% effectiveness against severe coronavirus infection.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: A combined 1st and 2nd dose of Moderna's coronavirus vaccine is 96% effective against severe coronavirus infection.
speaker: The Spectator Index @spectatorindex

questions.question: Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine is 87% effective at reducing the need for Hospitalization. A combined 1st and 2nd dose is 96% effective, so there were 'zero' cases of severe COVID‑19 in a vaccine group, versus 11 in a placebo group.

claim: Recognizing the important role of the United States and its capability to solve regional issues, Syria and Russia have offered the US side to use the Damascus platform with a high status and expert representation for taking part in a joint effort. The answer was no and there was unfounded criticism of those who are really contributing to returning Syrian citizens back home."
label: Supported
justification: US declined as not organised by the U.N.
speaker: General Mikhail Mizintsev

questions.question: The Syrian President Bashar Assad met with a high-level Russian delegation on Thursday to discuss hosting an international conference on refugees in the capital Damascus next month. US refused to take part as it was not organized by U.N and Russian military was not a credible host. EU member states were also not invited or they boycotted it.

claim: North Korea leader, Kim Jong Un became the first world leader to receive a COVID-19 vaccine.
label: Refuted
justification: Q&A 2 shows that the first person to receive a Covid vaccine was Jennifer Haller, 43, of Seattle not Kim Jong Un as claimed.
speaker: Norbert Elekes

questions.question: There is no verifiable evidence that Kim Jong Un was the first to receive the corona vaccine. Jennifer Haller, 43, of Seattle was the person who received it first. She is a mother-of-three from Seattle and she died last year.

claim: Dominion Voting Systems is 28%  owned by Hugo  Chavez, the former president of Venezuala.
label: Refuted
justification: the question and answer pairs show that Dominion has no ties with venezuela.
speaker: Unidentified

questions.question: Dominion has no direct or indirect ties to Venezuela. Hugo Chavez owns 28% shares in Dominion Voting Systems, but he has no company or corporate ties to the company. The company has no connection with Venezuela at all. It is not true that Hugo Chavez has a 28% stake in Dominion.

claim: Researchers develop a vaccine for COVID-19 in a year, while vaccines for HIV, cancer and the common cold remain elusive.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: This first part of the claim "Researchers develop a vaccine for COVID-19 in a year" is supported. For the second part, we have conflicting evidence. Vaccines for HIV and common cold remain elusive, but for some cancers are not.

questions.question: There is no vaccine to prevent HIV infection or treat those who have it. HPV vaccines protect against infection caused by certain types of HPV. There are at least 200 different viruses that can cause cold symptoms, including adenoviruses, coronaviruses and parainfluenza.

claim: Donald Trump won the US election in 2020
label: Refuted
justification: The winner of the US election is Joseph R Biden who won with 306 in the electoral vote

questions.question: Joseph R. Biden Jr. won the 2020 U.S. Presidential election with 306 electoral votes, while Donald Trump had 232 in the electoral vote.  Donald Trump's main opponent was Joe Biden's brother Joseph.   . He will be the next president of the United States.

claim: US Judge gave Pennsylvania's legislators the power to choose presidential electors
label: Refuted
justification: The court judgement is explicit that it does not enable the choosing of new electors.
speaker: Jim Hoft

questions.question: The US judge halted the certification of the Pennsylvania election results. It was because of issues on how citizens would cast their votes. The court agreed that it would be untenable for the legislators to appoint electors after the election had already occurred.    It did not mean that the legislators had the power to choose the presidential electors.

claim: Pfizer-BioNTech’s Covid-19 mRNA vaccine contains lipid nanoparticles that could be concealing little computers.
label: Refuted
justification: An infectious diseases expert said  no technology currently exists by which computers could be inserted into an mRNA vaccine.
speaker: David Neve

questions.question: Acuitas Therapeutics has agreements with BioNTech and Pfizer Biontech to use their proprietary lipid nanotechnology in the development of several vaccines. Ligid nanoparticles are microscopic particles that measure less than 100 nanometres. They have no relation to nanocomputers.

claim: Covid-19 RNA Vaccine will change your DNA
label: Refuted
justification: the mRNA never enters the nucleas of the cell
speaker: colossill

questions.question: COVID vaccine has strands of genetic material called mRNA inside a special coating. This coating protects the mRNA from enzymes in the body and helps it enter the muscle cells near the vaccination site. The mRNA strand never enters the cell’s nucleus or affects genetic material.

claim: The Denver Broncos signed Colin Kaepernick to play quarterback on Sunday, November 29, 2020, after all of the team's quarterbacks were ordered into quarantine for COVID-19 exposure.
label: Refuted
justification: Colin Kaepernick has never played or been signed for the Denver Broncos
speaker: nflmemes_ig

questions.question: Colin Kaepernick played for the San Francisco 49ers in 2016. There is no record of him signing or playing for the Denver Broncos. If he had signed with them on the 28th of November 2020, he would not have been able to play against the New Orleans Saints the following day.

claim: Quantum physicists are crazy in love with Dirac meme
label: Refuted
justification: The claim is a generalisation at best.

questions.question: Dirac equation merges quantum mechanics and special relativity. It provides a description of the electron spin, predicts the existence of antimatter and reproduces accurately the spectrum of the hydrogen atom. Paul Dirac is responsible for several great breakthroughs in 20th century physics.

claim: Masks, gloves, vaccines, and synthetic hand soaps suppress human immune systems.
label: Refuted
justification: none of these things have any effect on the human immune system,

questions.question: Wearing a mask won't weaken your immune system. Vaccines help develop immunity by imitating an infection. Using alcohol-based hand sanitizer does not cause antibiotic resistance. Gloves do not protect you from COVID-19.    The CDC and European CDC say gloves are not necessary preventive tactic when it comes to COVID 19.

claim: Bill Gates was talking about side effects and did not say 700,000 people would be killed or permanently disabled by a Covid-19 vaccine
label: Supported
justification: He did not say killed or permanently disabled just that 700,000 may experience a side effect.
speaker: Mayowa Tijani,

questions.question: A vaccine side effect could affect 700,000 people worldwide. Gates did not mention that the side effects would be adverse and result in permanent damage. He does not say this.  Gates said that one in 10,000 of a vaccine's side effects could have a potential to affect 1 in 700 million people.

claim: The World Health Organisation no longer recommends isolation, quarantine or social distancing because Covid-19 cannot transmit from person to person.
label: Refuted
justification: Direct evidence from WHO website confirms isolation, quarantine and social distancing is recommended and that coronavirus is transmitted from person to person especially when in close contact.
speaker: Dougie Little

questions.question: COVID-19 is caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus. The virus can spread from an infected person’s mouth or nose in small liquid particles when they cough, sneeze, speak, sing or breathe heavily. It's more likely to happen when people are in direct or close contact (less than 1 metre apart) with an infected one. WHO recommends isolation, quarantine or social distancing for COVID- 19 infection.

claim: Thai pro-democracy group Free Youth announced details for an upcoming rally on Twitter.
label: Refuted
justification: Q&A 2 states that the tweet in the claim did not come from the organisation in the claims official twitter account, so looks unlikely to be true as they would have used the official account to organise a rally.

questions.question: Free Youth is a pro-democracy movement launched by students in Thailand. It has staged anti-government rallies since July. The tweet was not sent from Free Youth’s verified Twitter account, which was created in January 2020. There are calls for overhaul of the government and reform of the monarchy.

claim: Malia Obama was arrested in 2020.
label: Refuted
justification: According to the Q&A this claim was originally published on a satire website and not intended as factual information. Therefore claim is refuted.
speaker: Life is Not Fair Facebook group

questions.question: Malia Obama was not arrested for cocaine possession. The claim originated in an article on a satirical site that was shared out of context as if it were true. Daily World Update describes itself as:'satire for flat earthers, Trumpsters and Y'all Qaeda.'

claim: “In Wisconsin, somebody has to be indefinitely confined in order to vote absentee.”
label: Refuted
justification: Anyone can vote absentee in Wisconsin as long as done properly - including indefinitely confined voters.
speaker: Donald Trump

questions.question: In Wisconsin, absentee ballots are mailed 3 weeks before local elections and 47 days before national elections. The application for an absentee ballot must be received by the clerk no later than 5:00 p.m. on the Thursday before the election in order for it to be sent to you. A witness is needed to sign and provide their address on the certificate of your return envelope. If you are a registered voter, you can download the Application For Absentee Ballot (EL-121) and mail it to your municipal clerk's office.

claim: You can write in Donald Trump for the Georgia senate on election forms.
label: Refuted
justification: The second answer and source explain that it is not possible to put a write in on the ballot so the claim is refuted.
speaker: John Fugelsang

questions.question: People are being told to vote for Donald Trump in the Georgia Senate runoff election. Runoff elections in Georgia do not permit write-in candidates, so it is not possible to put Trump's name on the voting form.    The tweets claimed that doing so would change the election results and get Trump reelected.

claim: Trump Supporter Randy Quaid Skipped Bail and Become a Fugitive in Canada
label: Supported
justification: Randy Quaid did skip bail and become a fugitive.
speaker: Aaron Blake

questions.question: The Quaids were held for lack of $500,000 bail each after court appearances Monday in Vermont. Randy Quaid fled to Canada after the California charges. He did not show up at court.    Randy Quaid and his wife are accused of fleeing the U.S. because they skipped bail.

claim: 35,000 votes were added to every Democratic candidate in Arizona to start their voting off during the 2020 US election.
label: Refuted
justification: The answers and sources show that the candidates were not given votes so the claim is refuted.
speaker: Sidney Powell

questions.question: Richard Andrade received 32,075 votes in the 29th Legislative District in the Arizona House of Representatives. Raquel Teran and Robert Meza got 34,106 and 30,546 votes, respectively. Geraldine Peten received 29,342 votes. Secretary of State released a statement saying there is no controversy.

claim: Republicans were locked out of the Wisconsin presidential vote counting process.
label: Refuted
justification: Wisconsin can't count mail-in ballots received after election day, supreme court rules
speaker: Donald Trump

questions.question: There were Republican observers at the Wisconsin presidential election. One of them pushed an election official and another one didn't wear a face mask properly, so they were removed from the building.  They are accused of trying to obstruct a recount of the presidential results by objecting to every ballot tabulator pulled to count.

claim: Australia’s treasurer, Josh Frydenberg, enjoys a far more generous superannuation scheme than the general public while purportedly trying to defeat plans that would deliver higher benefits for all.
label: Supported
justification: The answers and sources show that the treasurer gets a higher amount of superannuation and was looking at delaying superannuation so the claim is supported.
speaker: Rudy Terwilliger

questions.question: Josh Frydenberg wants to delay increasing compulsory superannuation contributions. The general public receives 9.5% of their income from the state instead of 15.4%. A landmark report said higher rates could hurt wage growth and would be poorly timed given the COVID-19 economic hit and rising house prices.

claim: “In the past there were 20,000 people. This past election there were 120,000.”
label: Refuted
justification: The second source shows that there were more absentee voters so the claim is refuted.
speaker: Donald Trump

questions.question: In November 2020, the number of people who were counted as 'indefinitely confined' in order to vote absentee was 2,868. An absentee voter is someone who is unable or unwilling to attend the official polling station and needs to meet one of the following criteria to be qualified to vote an absentee ballot: you will be unavoidably absent from your polling site on election day, OR you are temporarily living outside the territorial limits of the United States.

claim: Pennsylvania just banned alcohol sales
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: Evidence finds that Pennsylvania has barred alcohol sales or on-site consumption at bars and restaurants starting at 5 p.m. on Thanksgiving Eve in an effort to stop the COVID-19 surge. Therefore, this is only a temporary measure and not permanent.
speaker: Pennsylvania Gov. Tom Wolf and Health Secretary Rachel Levine

questions.question: Stay-at-home advisory is in place in Pennsylvania. State will ban alcohol sales for on-site consumption at bars and restaurants starting at 5 p.m. on Thanksgiving Eve to stop the surge of COVID-19, a form of illegal drug use.

claim: Eating chocolate can make you smarter.
label: Supported
justification: Q3  answers state people who eat chocolate at least once a week tend to perform better cognitively and Q4 answer  chocolate seem to have a positive effect on people's brains due to nutrient cocoa flavanols
speaker: Article by Scientific Reports Website

questions.question: People who eat chocolate at least once a week tend to perform better cognitively. Psychologist Merrill Elias studied the relationship between blood pressure and cognitive performance in New York for decades. He found significant positive associations between cocoa flavanols, which are found naturally in cocoa, and cognitive abilities.

claim: Cloth face masks don't stop viruses like COVID-19.
label: Refuted
justification: The evidence says they are effective.
speaker: Lisa Mair

questions.question: Cloth face masks work against the spread of COVID-19. Cloth masks block most large droplets (20-30 microns and larger) and exhalation of fine droplets and particles (10-10 microns or smaller) smaller than 10 microns. Multi-layer cloth masks can block 50-70% of these fine droplet and particles. Upwards of 80% blockage has been achieved in human experiments.

claim: Twitter screenshot shows tweet from Indian Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi stating India's Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru found his bodyguard asleep in bed with his wife.
label: Refuted
justification: From the 4th Qaitis evident that there were no tweets from Priyanka about her grandfather. Therefore the claim is refuted
speaker: Rajesh Verma

questions.question: Priyanka Gandhi's great-grandfather was Jawaharlal Nehru, who was India's first prime minister. Her family has long dominated Indian politics. The tweet referred to in the claim allegedly posted is about 20th of November 2020. Priyanka did not tweet about her grandfather on this date.

claim: Public health measures aimed at reducing the spread of COVID-19 including face masks, vaccines, and frequent handwashing suppress our immune systems
label: Refuted
justification: Vaccinations help our immune systems be able to beat the real disease by making memory antibodies
speaker: galactawhore

claim: India's Parliament during National Democratic Alliance's first term has given the best performance in two decades.
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: the questions do not offer evidence relating to the question, merely how much time was spent - not necessarily a performance factor.
speaker: India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi

questions.question: 17th Lok Sabha had the largest number of hours of 281 hours. The average percentage of time spent by ministers to answer questions was 36% as against the 15% average of the past 20 years. India's Parliament has the best performance recorded on their first term.

claim: The viral load on a nasal swab for testing COVID-19 is equivalent  to that of aerosolized spittle from six feet away.
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: There is no evidence shows that nasal swab for testing COVID-19 is equivalent to that of aerosolized spittle from six feet away.
speaker: James Sickmeier

questions.question: Covid 19 nasal swab can be used to test for the virus. It can be found in saliva of infected people. Coronavirus spreads through respiratory droplets and fine-particle aerosols. The global human population explosion has put us at risk.

claim: Approval to impose lockdown in 5 states, Prime Minister Modi announced.
label: Refuted
justification: There is evidence that the claim is not true
speaker: Khurram Siddiqui

questions.question: There were no reports about the prime minister announcing a lockdown. There was no lockdown announced.  The lockdown was not announced by the PM, however there were no news reports of it being announced at that time. The lockdown is not yet in effect.

claim: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has announced a lockdown in five states in India on November 2020.
label: Refuted
justification: There were not true lockdowns and they were not decided by the PM

questions.question: Narendra Modi was Prime Minister of India in November 2020. There was a new lockdown in five states of India announced by individual state governments, but the restrictions varied and were not a lockdown. The restrictions were to curb the spread of Covid-19.

claim: The astronaut stone carving on Spain's Cathedral of Salamanca is a mystery.
label: Refuted
justification: The answers and sources show that the astronaut is a modern addition to the cathedral so the claim is refuted.
speaker: Weird Fact

questions.question: The Salamanca's Cathedral of Salamanca was built in 1102. The modern addition to the Cathedral is not a joke or a hoax, but a modern addition which may provide confusion some 400 years from now. It is one of the oldest such constructions in the world.

claim: Grocery stores in the southern U.S. don’t require face masks.
label: Refuted
justification: 48 out of 50 states require masks and this affects businesses within them
speaker: @notjacksafford

questions.question: 48 states in the U.S. have statewide orders requiring face coverings in public spaces. Masks are recommended by CDC and WHO to prevent spreading Covid-19. Colorado, Alabama, Arkansas, Colorado and Montana all announced statewide mandates last week. In Georgia, where there is no statewide mandate, Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms announced a mask order for the city.

claim: Tap water is toxic as it contains as much flouride as toothpaste which is inedible and flouride in both come from the waste system of the phosphate fertilizer industry.
label: Refuted
justification: From the last QA it is evident that an adult would need to drink an impossibly huge amount of water in order to get fluoride poisoning, therefore, the claim is refuted
speaker: Operation Take Back Australia

questions.question: Fluoride is added to some water supply schemes in Australia to improve dental health. It is toxic to humans if eaten. The suggested toxic dose of fluoride ion is 5 mg per kg body weight. For a 10 kg child, this corresponds to approximately half the contents of a 90 g tube of toothpaste. Fluoride for human use is derived from hydrofluoric acid and fluorspar.

claim: Georgia Governor And Secretary Of State Took Money From China To Steal Election From Trump
label: Refuted
justification:
Q&A 3 shows there were election irregularities in Georgia but fails to link it to a corrupted official taking money from china, 
Q&A 1 and 2 point out that the person who made this claim was not a trustworthy person either,
Q&A 4 shows that a recount was also used in Georgia to certify its results so they were seen to be accurate 
Q&A 5 does state that overall, false claims and flawed logic was used to suggest that there was widespread fraud in the 2020 election, and that an election technology firm and China were behind it
speaker: Hal Turner

questions.question: Georgia had a recount of the 2020 Presidential election. The audit confirmed the original machine count accurately portrayed the winner of the election. Epoch Times is right-wing biased and questionable. AP News scored an average Factual Grade of 68.8% for their consistent, reliable reporting.

claim: 8.1 million people vote din Michigan in the US general election when there were only 7.8 million registered voters
label: Refuted
justification: The 3rd source shows that there were more than 7.8 million registered voters so the claim is refuted.
speaker: Jennifer Jingo

questions.question: 5,579,317 people voted in the 2020 Michigan general election. 7,700,637 voters were registered in February 2020 and 8,061,525 in October 2020. The 2020 general election will be on November 3, 2020. There are 7,748,541 registered voters in July 2020.

claim: COVID-19 vaccines will cause more severe disease through antibody-dependent enhancement
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: The 1st Q&A pair states that in some vaccines ADE has been seen, but offers no evidence for the covid specific vaccine, but it does make a case for there being a possibility so more evidence is needed.

questions.question: In some viruses, antibodies that target the virus surface proteins can promote infection. This is called antibody-dependent enhancement (ADE) and has been identified in over 40 kinds of virus. Conventional vaccine has shown a weak preventive and therapeutic effect on these viruses.

claim: Flying during the COVID-19 pandemic is safe.
label: Supported
justification: Well written

questions.question: The NPI approach of wearing face masks, disinfection of surfaces and maintenance of appropriate ventilation gate-to-gate will ensure the risk of SARS-CoV-2 transmission onboard aircraft is below that found in other routine activities such as grocery shopping or eating out.

claim: Dead People, Animals, Children Voted For Biden In Georgia In The 2020 Election
label: Refuted
justification: Claim is shown to be a Myth by the Q&A pairs.
speaker: Diamond, Silk

questions.question: Diamond and Silk are pro-Trump sisters. Lorraine Minnite is a political science professor at Rutgers University. Stephen Ansolabehere, an expert in elections, says there's no evidence that dead people have voted in US elections. Georgia's voting system implementation manager said on Wednesday that the system is working exactly as it should.

claim: Certain places in Delhi, India were put under lockdown for 20 days during the Coronavirus outbreak.
label: Refuted
justification: It seems from the question and answer pair, that indeed the lock down was not reimposed in certain areas. Therefore the claim is refuted
speaker: Ankit Manchanda

questions.question: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain said that there will be no re-imposition of lockdown in the national capital. COVID-19 has passed its peak, he added. Deli did not have any lockdown in November 20th 2020.

claim: Ballots being destroyed on Nov. 20 in Georgia’s Cobb County.
label: Refuted
justification: The 2nd Q&A pair show a statement from the elections director of cobb county which says nothing of consequence was shredded, the answer lists non relevent voting paperwork which was shredded, which refutes what the claim says which is that ballots were destroyed which is incorrect.

questions.question: There was some document shredding at the Jim R. Miller Park Event Center in Marietta, Georgia where Elections Department conducted the state-ordered re-tallied of votes in the November 3rd election on Friday, November 20th. Shredding company routinely responds to the Elections Department following an election to help dispose of non-relevant materials that cannot be easily disposed of. The items they shredded were not relevant to the election or the re-tally.

claim: Nigeria is ranked the number one country according to the population of people killed because they are Christians.
label: Refuted
justification: Q&A 1 shows that the claim is correct about Christians being killed in Nigeria, Q&A 2 shows that North Korea is number 1 for killing Christians not Nigeria as claimed, and as Q&A 3 shows, Nigeria is actually ranked 12th. not 1st as is claimed.
speaker: Nnamdi Kanu

questions.question: Christians are killed in Nigeria because of their faith. North Korea is the most dangerous country for Christians. Nigeria is ranked 12th for most dangerous countries for Christians, while North Korea ranks as number one.  Nigeria is a Christian-friendly country.

claim: Thousands of ballots discovered floating in Lake Erie, Pennsylvania.
label: Refuted
justification: The answer describes the source as a satirical website.

questions.question: There were no ballots found in Lake Erie, Pennsylvania. The claim that this originated from Americaslastlineofdefense.com is a subsidiary of the "America's Last Line of Defense" network of parody, satire and tomfoolery. Snopes called it before they lost their war on satire.

claim: The United Arab Emirates stopped issuing visas for Pakistanis and other nationals of Muslim countries because of their continued refusal to recognise the state of Israel.
label: Refuted
justification: The reason was not because of religion but because of covid so the claim is refuted.
speaker: Haqeeqat TV

questions.question: Pakistan, India, America, Turkey and some other countries were banned from getting visas into the UAE. The decision came after around 30 Pakistanis who arrived in Hong Kong onboard an Emirates flight tested positive for the virus.  It is believed to be related to the second wave of Covid-19.

claim: MICHIGAN HAVE MORE BALLOTS CAST THAN REGISTERED VOTERS IN THE PRESIDENTIAL ELECTION.
label: Refuted
justification: Q&A and sources support a refuted claim.
speaker: RJ REGAN

questions.question: There are 8 million registered voters in Michigan. 5.5 million people from Michigan voted in the election.  "I voted for Barack Obama".  "I voted to keep him as president of the United States."    i vote to keep Obama as president.

claim: Pakistani ‘Cricket Chacha’ Sufi Abdul Jalil passed away
label: Refuted
justification: The only Q&A pair is poorly worded but does point out that the claim was a fake news hoax.

questions.question: Sufi Abdul Jalil has died. It was a hoax. He is the Pakistani 'Cricket Chacha' Sufi Abdul Jelil.  ‘Crickets Chacha’ Sufi died.    ‘Crickset Chachas’ passed away.

claim: Trump staffer has confirmed that a computer server belonging to Dominion Voting Systems containing all of the U.S. votes was seized by the U.S. in Germany.
label: Refuted
justification: The credible source states that no foreign governments interfered with the elections so the claim is refuted.
speaker: Dana Ford

questions.question: Dominion Voting Systems says there is no evidence of tampering with the 2020 US elections. The FBI and Department of Homeland Security confirm that there is nothing to suggest foreign actors manipulated the election infrastructure. U.S. Army debunked false claims about an overseas election server raid.

claim: Former President Barack and Former first lady Michelle Obama are producing a comedy series about President Donald Trump's administration.
label: Supported
justification:
The 1st and 2nd Q&A pair confirm that the people mentioned in the claim are making a tv show as mentioned in the claim,
The 3rd Q&A pair confirm the show is largely  about the person named in the query
speaker: Adam Conover

questions.question: Barack and Michelle Obama have signed a multi-year deal with Netflix to produce TV series and movies. They will work on scripted and unscripted series, docu-series, documentary films and features. The G-Word comedy series is based on Michael Lewis’ book 'The Fifth Risk'.

claim: The life expectancy in some parts of Glasgow is less than it is in Rwanda
label: Refuted
justification:
The claim stats life expectancy being higher in Rwanda that Glasgow, However Q&A 1 states Glasgos life expectancey as 73.6 for men/78.5 women.
And Q&A pair 2 list Rwanda's as lower (69.7 women/65.8 men) and not higher as claimed
speaker: Fraser Nelson

questions.question: Glasgow's average life expectancy for women is 78.5 and for men, 73.6. The Rwandan statistics show a 2020 projection of 69.7% for women and 65.8% for men in that country.  Women live longer than men on average.

claim: Golan Heights near Merom Golan on the border with Syria is Part of Israel.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: Although the US recognise Golan Heights as part of Isreal, but the UN state that the area is Occupied Palestinian Territory, including East Jerusalem, and the occupied Syrian Golan
speaker: Mike Pompeo U.S secretary of state

questions.question: Golan Heights is a strip of land in northeastern Israel that was captured from Syria by Israel in the Six Day War of 1967. The United Nations has voted to ask Israel to pull its troops out of the Golan Heights. President Trump signed a proclamation on Monday that recognizes Israeli sovereignty over the area. The rest of the world does not recognise Israel's sovereignty over it.

claim: The Trump campaign was denied access to Philadelphia’s ballot count.
label: Refuted
justification: Jeremy Mercer who was Trump's campaign  representative in Philadelphia was present in the hall and he watched as the ballot envelopes were been moved from beginning of the process, all the way through the scanning of the ballots.
speaker: Donald Trump

questions.question: Jeremy Mercer is an attorney for the Trump Campaign. He was a representative of the campaign at the Board’s pre-canvass in Philadelphia. He walked back and forth across the width of the hall and watched the ballot envelopes going from the beginning of the process to the scanning of the ballots that are in the envelopes. His vantage point allowed him to observe the envelope review process.

claim: President Rodrigo Duterte and his Philippine Government are blowing hot and cold regarding the Visiting Forces Agreement, with suspensions and cancellations of  upcoming mutual defence arrangement meetings with the United States.
label: Supported
justification: The answers and sources show that the president has changed his mind about the agreement so the claim is supported.
speaker: Vera Files

questions.question: The VFA is a bilateral agreement between the Philippines and the U.S. that outlines the terms and conditions on the entry and visit of U.s. armed forces in the country. It lays out rules on travel privileges accorded to U. s. personnel, the importation and exportation of equipment, materials, and supplies, as well as the movement of aircrafts, vessels, and vehicles within the Philippines. President Rodrigo Duerte changed his stance on the visiting forces agreement with the US because of the pandemic and heightened superpower tensions.

claim: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has approved the first  COVID-19 test for home use.
label: Supported
justification: Answer confirmed from a reliable source.
speaker: armchairview

questions.question: The first COVID-19 test for home use was approved on December 15, 2020. It's the first home virus test that doesn't require a prescription.    FDA Authorizes 1st Home Virus Test That Doesn't Require A Prescription.

claim: Elon Musk was called “Space Karen” on Twitter following a controversial tweet about COVID-19 testing.
label: Supported
justification: The evidence presented in the q&a confirmed that a twitter user, in response to Elon Musk's tweet about the results of his COVID-19 results, referred to Musk as "Space Karen".

questions.question: Elon Musk has been called Space Karen on Twitter. He was tested for covid four times today and two of them came back positive.    This earned him the title "Space Karen".  . The tests were done by the same machine, same nurse and at the same place.

claim: David Perdue says he'll do everything in his power to make sure Joe Biden fail.
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: The answers below do not give any evidence for or against the claim so I can not support or refute the claim.
speaker: Jon Ossoff

questions.question: David Perdue is a Republican Party senator for the state of Georgia. What has David Perdue said about President Joe Biden? No answer could be found. He is not known to have said anything negative about him.    He is not unknown to many people.

claim: Inaccurate early vote count in one Michigan county was a failure of the software used.
label: Refuted
justification: The error was not due to software failure but human error.
speaker: Ted Nugent

questions.question: Antrim County, Michigan's 2020 elections had an inaccurate vote count. It was due to a human error in not updating to the latest version of the Dominion Voting Systems software. The new version was loaded in October after county officials learned of two local races in which ballot information had to be updated. However, the old version was left on scanners for precincts where the ballot was not affected by the late change. This resulted in some positions being assigned to the wrong candidates when the results were read by the election management system.

claim: The last mile connectivity programme crossed the 7.2 million household connections mark,in Kenya.

claim: During  Kenya’s President Uhuru Kenyatta's administration, 4.5 million title deeds have been issued in the seven years since 2013.

claim: The Covid-19 dusk-to-dawn curfew is Kenya’s first ever nationwide curfew since independence.
label: Supported
justification:
The claim states that Kenya's first nationwide curfew has  happened since independence
Q&A 1 gives the date for independence for Kenya, Whilst Q&A 2 states that since independence in 1963 this was the first nationwide curfew, and only smaller regional ones had happened before, which supports the claim.
speaker: Uhuru Kenyatta

questions.question: Kenya gained independence in 1963. There have been other nationwide curfews in Kenya since then, but they were based on regions and not nationwide. The most recent was the curfew imposed during the shifta war. It was imposed during that time.

claim: Kenya Powers  "The Last Mile "electricity connectivity programme had provided electricity to more than 7.2 million household connections.
label: Supported
justification: This claim is supported. According to the QA pairs, Kenya Powers 'The Last Mile' supplies electricity to 8 million consumers. 94.5% of its electrical supply are made up of domestic connections. 94.5% of 8,000,000 is 7,560,000. 7,560,000 is "more than 7.2 million household connections" as the claim states. Therefore, the claim is supported.
speaker: Kenya’s president Uhuru Kenyatta

questions.question: Kenya Power has 7,560,000 domestic customers. Domestic connections accounted for 94.5% of all customers in the 2019 report. Kenya Power owns and operates most of the electricity transmission and distribution system in the country and sells electricity to over 8 million as at end of June 2020.

claim: Kenyan exports within the East African Community jumped to a six-year high in 2019.

questions.question: The East African Community (EAC) comprises 6 Partner States: Burundi, Kenya, Rwanda, South Sudan, Tanzania, United Republic of Tanzania and Uganda. Kenya exported KSh140 billion to other EAC states in 2019. In the 6 years prior to 2019, Kenya exported between KSh125 billion and KSh134 billion.

questions.question: Kenya's transition rate from primary to secondary in 2019 was 95% according to the highest source. There are multiple sources for this statistic.  The highest of them is 95% for primary-to-secondary transition rate, which is used by many sources.

claim: During President Uhuru Kenyatta's administration, 4.5 million titles have been issued in the seven years since 2013.

questions.question: Chronic wasting disease (CWD) is a prion disease that affects deer, elk, reindeer, sika deer and moose. It may take over a year before an infected animal develops symptoms. There have been no reported cases of CWD infection in people.

questions.question: All tabulators counted ballots correctly because the Clerk correctly updated the media drives for the tabulators with changes to races and because the other tabulators did not have changes to Races.  The software was not rigged.    The election is over.
