questions.question: President Rodrigo Duterte's visit to the victims of Typhoon Rolly was covered by.abs-cbn and philstar. Philster also provided coverage for it. The typhoon made its second landfall in Albay, where 20 people were killed. It hit with force.

claim: Democratic poster didn't violate rules
label: Refuted
justification:
Q&A 1  does speak of democratic political posters that was placed close to a polling station, Q&A 2 states that this is prohibited  and Q&A 3 states that they are prohibited within 10 feet,
Q&A 4 shows that the poster in the claim was further than 10 feet so not violating rules as claimed.
speaker: Mike Roman

questions.question: There have been reports of campaign posters placed too close to polling stations in Pennsylvania this morning. Canvassing at polling stations is prohibited, and is classed as an offence. The election rules prohibit campaign materials, signs, banners and literature being within 10 feet of a polling station in Pennsylvania.

claim: Donald Trump Supporters were Blocking Access To Polling Stations In Clifton, New Jersey And Doing So was A 'Class A' Felony In The State
label: Refuted
justification: Firstly, the location where it is claimed they blocked  is not a voting location. Secondly, even if one doing so was not a felony.
speaker: the Other 98%

questions.question: Trump supporters in New Jersey blocked a polling booth, but it is not a voting location or an early voting location. In place of felonies they have what are called indictable offenses for blocking entrance to polling booths.    In New Jersey there are no crimes that are categorized as felonies.

claim: Since Nitish Kumar came into power in Bihar as Chief Minister in 2005, there has been a major improvement in the law and order situation
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: some areas have improved, others have not.
speaker: National Democratic Alliance

questions.question: Law and order has improved in Bihar since Nitish Kumar came into power in 2005. In some areas crime rates have decreased, while in others they have increased. The situation is similar in different parts of the state. For more information visit: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/question-and-answers/bihar-crime-rates-increased-since-kumar-came-into-power-in-2005.

claim: Only half of doctors are registered to vote in the United States.
label: Supported
justification: From the QA it seems that actually only half of the doctors are registered to vote. Therefore, the claim is supported
speaker: Tracy Davenport

questions.question: Only half of practicing doctors are registered to vote in the USA, according to a study published in the Journal of the American Medical Association (JAMA).  University of Texas Southwestern study showed this.   Â'Half of practicing physicians are registered for voting.

claim: PV Sindhu announces her retirement from badminton.
label: Refuted
justification: I'm not sure if the source here qualifies as a fact checking article, but it dos refute the claim. However, it has a link to the actual tweet which would have been better evidence.
speaker: Dr.Akshay Rajput

questions.question: PV Sindhu's tweet about her retirement from badminton was misinterpreted. She retired from negativity, constant fear, uncertainty and the current sense of unrest not badmens' tennis but from negative emotions. The tweet has been taken out of context.

claim: Pennsylvania voters told to quarantine due to potential COVID-19 exposure are not entitled to vote
label: Refuted
justification: The 1st q&a pair stats that people can vote in absentee, the 2nd q&a pair state that voting provisions are in place for those quarantining with coved
speaker: Wendy Bell

questions.question: There is an emergency absentee ballot provision under the law for COVID-19 voters. If a voter has to vote by emergency absentee ballots because of illness or disability, they can assign a designee to do it for them.    The criteria for absentee ballot voting in Pennsylvania are: I have or had an illness or physical disability that prevented me from applying for a non-emergency absentee ballot prior to the application deadline. I expect to be absent from my municipality on election day and I did not know that I would be absent before the application date.

claim: The US constitution says that if Trump declares himself the winner at any time on November 3 then he automatically wins.
label: Refuted
justification:
1st QA pair confirms this is not stated in the US Constitution.
2nd QA pair explains that the claim came from a satirical website [but links to metadata as the source which doesn’t quite make sense when the metadata lists Facebook, Twitter as  the source of the claim; a link to the satirical website, or an explanation/review of the website would be more useful].
speaker: Michael Berry

questions.question: According to the US constitution, Donald Trump can't declare himself the winner of the US Presidential elections. The satirical site is not based on the constitution.  It's a satire. There is no such thing as outlined by the constitution for the election process.

claim: The National Guard Is Only Being Activated In 'Blue Cities' for the 2020 presidential election
label: Refuted
justification: Evidence finds that the National Guard has been called up in the "red" (primarily Republican) states of Texas, Florida, and Alabama. Hence, the claim is refuted.

questions.question: The Florida National Guard will be deployed across Florida on Election Day. 300 Alabama National Guard troops prepared for Election Day unrest. Texas Guard will send troops to cities for possible ‘postelection’ disturbances. Red states called up the national guard for the 2020 election.

claim: Mukesh Ambani, richest man in Asia had surgery for pancreatic cancer at Sloan Kettering, New York, US cancer speciality hospital on October 30, 2020.
label: Refuted
justification: The Q&A shows other appearances by Ambani, that conflict with the claim.
speaker: Meenu Sharma

questions.question: Mukesh Ambani has been diagnosed with pancreatic cancer and had liver transplant surgery. The photo of him supposedly recieving the surgery was taken by Manushree Vijayvergiya in Liechtenstein.    A video of Mukesh at the launch of NK Singh's book Portrait of Power was filmed on October 19, 2020.

claim: U.S. President Donald Trump has real estate debt of more than $1 billion due over 4 years.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: Q&As find that U.S. President Donald Trump does have a $1.1 billion debt in real estate, but only $900 million is due in the next four years, during his second term as president if he wins the election.

questions.question: Donald Trump has debts worth $1.1 billion and will owe $900 million of it during his second term as president if he wins the election. The huge sums of money are linked to his commercial real estate properties and golf courses. Donald Trump's net worth is 3.5 million dollars.

claim: Millions of jobs in the US were lost during Donald Trump's US presidency.
label: Supported
justification: The question-answer pairs are very relevant to the claim. Every piece of information hat is needed, is answered. The 3rd answer is what could be used for the justification mostly.
speaker: Center for American Progress Action Fund

questions.question: There were 145,627,000 people in employment as of January 2017. There will be 141,735,000 employed in 2020. The economy lost 3,892,000 jobs under Trump's presidency.  The economy lost an estimate of 3,902,000 jobless under Trump.

claim: Late Actor Sean Connery called Steve Jobs a 'computer salesman’
label: Refuted
justification: The website that posted the comment by Steve Jobs is a fake news website.
speaker: Daniel Estulin

questions.question: Sean Connery rejected an offer to appear in an Apple ad on June 19th. Scoopertino published a letter from Sean Connery to Steve Jobs rejecting the offer. The website is known for publishing fake news about Apple and its founder Steve Jobs.

claim: Denmark government has passed legislation to take away voting rights from the Muslim population.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: The q and a show that yes, the Danish government can take away citizenship and therefore voting rights for dual nationality citizens who fight in certain foreign armies, it is cherrypicking  to suggest that it allows voting rights to be removed from the muslim population as a whole
speaker: Swaraj Bharat

questions.question: Danish citizens who have permanent residence in Denmark, Greenland or the Faroe Islands are entitled to vote. On November 14, 2017, a Danish-born citizen was stripped of his Danish citizenship for having joined and fought in Syria for the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL). In March, under the previous government, Denmark adopted a law depriving children born abroad to Danish fighters of the right to citizenship.

claim: The government of the Solomon Islands has decided to ban social media platform Facebook.
label: Supported
justification: The Q&A show that the Solomon islands did decide to ban Facebook. So the claim is supported.

questions.question: The government wanted to ban facebook to promote national unity and limit abusive language. It will be implemented soon. The reason for the ban is to prevent abuse of social networking sites. For more information, visit: www.facebook.com/ban- facebook.

claim: Drug Manufacturers are supplying the flu shot to pharmacies and doctors' offices for free.
label: Refuted
justification: A Q&A 2 states some people on some health plans do recicve a flu shot for free, however the company's the receive that shot from do pay for it as do all other company's.
speaker: Tammy IsAnointed

questions.question: Influenza vaccines sales were up 17.1% to €596 million in the fourth quarter. Full-year sales increased 7.2%. Affordable Care Act requires health insurers to cover all federally recommended vaccines at no charge to patients, including flu immunizations. People with insurance pay nothing when they get their shot.

claim: Epstein dies while in custody, his private banker is found dead, a judge had a trial regarding Epstein and the Deutsche Bank. Her son has been killed now and her husband has been shot. The shooter who shot the son and shot the judge’s husband has now also been found dead
label: Supported
justification: Sources provided shows that Epstein died in custody, his private banker was found dead

questions.question: Jeffrey Epstein died while in custody, officials say he killed himself. Thomas Bowers was a former Deutsche Bank executive who signed off on some of the institution's unorthodox loans to Donald Trump. Epstein has close ties to Deutsche Bank and Judge Esther Salas, whose son was killed and her husband injured in a shooting at their New Jersey home in July.
